Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Dana-Laurie
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 week at Casa Camper in Barcelona recently. I based our decision to stay at Casa Camper on reviews from Trip advisor. We loved staying at Casa Camper and it was the right choice for us. The reviews were all true, helpful and friendly staff (shout out to Georgina and Allessandro), great location, well appointed rooms, great breakfast and snacks. We traveled to Barcelona during Easter week and the city was inundated with tourists. Casa Camper is located on a small side street 2 blocks from Las Ramblas and is an oasis away from the bustling crowds in the city. We stayed in one of the suites and like the set up with the connected sitting room. The hammock in the sitting room is a great feature and now my husband wants to put up a hammock in our sitting room at home. He spent many hours lounging in the hammock after a long day of site-seeing. The bathroom was modern, well appointed and large which is not easy to find in an Europe. The 24/7 snacks were a life saver when we wanted a little afternoon snack before dinner or some extra bottle water or tea at night. It is a wonderful concept to have free snacks offered 24/7!....thanks. I would definitely stay at Casa Camper on our return trip to Barcelona and recommend to anyone traveling to the city.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect hotel concept for a tourist”
Reviews.Author: jjk94
Reviews.Content: Clean, even the floor under the bed is cleaned. Friendly, only 25 rooms so the staff recognises and welcomes you when you enter. Instead of one room you have two, opposite each other. One is a nice mini lounge with a bed sofa, tv, table chair and a sturdy hammock. With a balcony over the entrance in a narrow typical old town street. The other is a relatively large bedroom with a walk in shower, toilet, washstand, bed and plenty of storage. It has a window to a patio and it is thereby amazingly quiet. The hotel is full of technical gimmicks to save energy. The whole is of a modern design with plenty of examples of clever thinking like a power socket in the safety box so that you can charge your computer or camera when stored away safely.The staff is really helpful. The breakfast with eggs etc made to order and special teas is tasty start. The tables all have clean linen, a nice touch of luxury. And the whole day long one has a free choice of softdrinks, tea, coffee and a diverse array of home made snacks. A perfect break for the weary tourist. Who can also enjoy the roof terrace on the 6th floor. A 5 minutes walk from the airport bus, close to Plaza Catalunya an ideal tourist location.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the reviews say!”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolPete
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper lived up to the rave reviews. Helpful, friendly staff, great location in a quiet street a hundred yards from Las Ramblas, ingenious rooms, decent breakfast. The restaurant next door has the same name but there's not much connection with the hotel - worth a a visit, though for its Asian fusion tapas. Not too much light in the bedrooms, but that's about it as far as criticism goes. And pay a visit to Elisabets just down the road. Catalan home cooking, no English spoken - I got pigs trotters, indicated by the ageing waitress pointing to her feet!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Service!”
Reviews.Author: Sameer R
Reviews.Content: We've had the good fortune of staying at a variety of exceptional properties WW (e.g., St. Regis, Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental, etc. to boutique venues), and while their service is quite good, it pales in comparison to that offered by Casa Camper. The difference appears to be the genuine sincerity afforded by the Casa Camper Barcelona staff. We traveled with a 4 month old infant, and everyone, from the gentleman who picked us up at BCN to the chief, was attentive and accommodating to our needs. They recognized that we were sleep deprieved parents, so they went out of their way to make our stay extremely relaxing. For example, they helped setup our lounge area with our son's gym and toys as well as stored his bottles in their kitchen fridge. Every morning, we were greeted by multiple hotel staff members who desired to feed our baby or simply play with him, so we could enjoy breakfast. As other reviewers noted, the location is fantastic as its quiet at night, yet you can easily access las ramblas and walk to other sites (e.g., Picasso museum, cathedral, etc.) And, naturally, the 24 hour snacks, 'huge' wall map, and complementary Mac with wifi is extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Mod Oasis in the Middle of Barcelona Bustle”
Reviews.Author: 007worldtravelers
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Casa Camper after a 5 hour drive from Arles. We are 2 adults and 2 teenage boys. This was the perfect hotel for us. The free (quite delicious) 24 hour snack bar, the good breakfast and the surprisingly quiet yet modern rooms were a real oasis in the midst of the busiest pedestrian part of the city (do note, that it is a bit hard to find, or to park if you are driving to the city, ask for specific directions in advance). The service staff was terrific. They helped us with directions, suggestions, restaurant and shopping recommendations, including some less touristic spots. We would especially like to call out Georgina who really went out of her way to help. We would not stay anywhere else in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for jet lag recoverers”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnn0702
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper offers a super-friendly staff, excellent snacks (not just potato chips but little sandwiches, yogurt, pastries, coffee, tea, etc) available FREE 24/7, a total blackout window covering, and a separate room for relaxing, sleeping or TV. Sleek, modern, inventive but functional decor throughout. The location is terrific--close to Plaza Cataluna but quiet. We loved everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, tremendous staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Paja_E17
Reviews.Content: Probably the best city centre hotel we have stayed at in Europe. Great location in the heart of El Raval, close to the main city centre but an oasis of calm. Tremendous staff, so friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. Loved the 24/7 snacks, drinks (selection of cold beverages, tea, Nespresso) and a great breakfast to start each day. Loved the layout and furnishing of the bedroom and the view of the vertical garden in the courtyard. The sitting area was cosy with a hammock and a small balcony overlooking the street. Well equiped gym in the basement and a roof terrace make it 5 star. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Barcelona Catedral”
Reviews.Author: Annabelle R
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights after a cruise. It was close to everything and very handy to the hop on hop off tourist buses and the regular transit system buses. I thought it was a bit pricey for not including breakfast. It was clean, comfortable, the staff very helpful Very close to many tapas restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A few super stays at the Camper”
Reviews.Author: Pillarofhercules
Reviews.Content: Let me put it this way. If you are looking for a funky place, that really reflects that 'barcelona vibe' and is central, without feeling like it is too central, this should be very high on your list of considerations. Without wanting to repeat much of what has already been said about this hotel, it is very central, but very slightly 'off centre' which means easy access without the noise and hustle you'd expect. Barcelona is kind of split into quadrants or areas, and this hotel is really well located to give you access to the different areas. I have stayed here a few times, once on a romantic getaway with my wife, and once (also with my wife) to watch a barcelona v madrid game. The hotel suited us perfectly on both trips. You are within the same walking distance from the ramblas as you are from the contemporary art museum (MACBA). The shops on the small roads around the hotel are great, as are the small cafes and restaurants that are dotted around the area. Beds are super comfortable and the separate living space across the hall from you bedroom is also fun. Very cool (think hammocks while watching tv). There are 'cooler' hotels in barcelona, and certainly more flashy but for a comfortable base that gives you everything, and places you perfectly in the city I'm not sure Camper can be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience in a family atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Janis001
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel for those who like a small boutique accommodation. The location is great, the heart of Barcelona, you are close to shopping and the subway. Boquería Market is just minutes away and worth a visit due to the unique atmosphere and fresh seafood. The hotel is very comfortable, staff helpful way of example, all smiling and unobtrusively help with whatever is needed. Pleasant, refreshments during the day, soft drinks, coffee, sandwiches, salads, olives, fruit, sweets and salty nuts are all at hand in sufficient quantities 24 hours a day. Breakfast is adequate, but the way the issue of hot dishes (like omelets) out the window, as in the school cafeteria is truly unforgettable and very personal. The hotel actually accompanied by personal, family atmosphere. Rooms are spacious, separate suite with balcony and hammock is a pleasure, I relaxed there for about 2 during the three days stay. The bed in the bedroom is comfortable, bathroom great. A free WiFi worked reliably. One council finally: Do not put your cell phone or iPad cards close to that open door of the room. For me it had to change the magnetizing 3x.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravelGraniteBay
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper exceeded all of our expectations! From the unique design and room decor (complete with hammock and a bathroom wall of window overlooking a wall of lush, green plants!) to the helpfulness and friendliness of staff, our stay could not have been more enjoyable. Having a suite provided the sitting room, bedroom, and bathroom altogether without the need for crossing the hall to get to a sitting room which was much better for us. The 24 hour snacks and hot breakfast were a wonderful touch and we also made use of the exercise room. Wifi reception was very good, as well. The hotel was perfectly situated for walking Barcelona and was one of the most quiet for sleeping that we have stayed in. Loved it and would stay there any time we are in Barcelona. It's the best!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy L
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. They give you 2 rooms, a living room and a bedroom. The wall behind the sink is actually a window. It has electronic shade you control with a switch that looks into a modern garden. There is no mini fridge...but they have something better than that. Downstairs past the lobby is an area where you can have snacks and drinks for free when you are a guest her 24 hours a day. Both rooms have a flat screen tv and the living room has a couch that could be a a bed if needed and a hammock infront of balcony. Everything is ultra modern and hip and healthy! Great location as well. not a far walk from tons of shopping, fabulous food, and even a hard rock cafe. Would def stay here any chance we got!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem, right up our street.”
Reviews.Author: ZekesWife
Reviews.Content: If you've read any of my other reviews you will know that location is the most important thing to us as we need a good night's sleep so we try and find a hotel in the heart of the action but away from the traffic. This hotel ticks every box for us. Upon arrival the taxi pulled up at the end of a cobbled side street, it looks quite dark but don't be put off it's perfect. You can book this hotel direct through their web site or through an operator, I didn't notice a difference in price but the comunication was impeccable. After Hotels.com fouling up our reservation and cancelling our stay rather than amending it Casa Camper had already emailed me regarding the error so I was still booked in phewwww! It was our first wedding anniversary so we arranged a brief two night stay. Our flight was delayed by an hour and on arrived we were met by the desk clerk who produced a bottle of champagne which was opened by the hotel host who had stayed an hour after his clocking off time just to welcome us to the hotel!!! I have never had that before, obviously ready to go home he poured our glasses and bid us congratulations and left. It was a lovely touch. The desk clerk, I wish I had got her name now, booked us in whilst we sipped away and took our photograph for us. As we only had two nights time was of the essence and we had booked a meal for the next night so the clerk produced a map and wrote on all of the places we had on our list to see which were all in walking distance or were in easy access to the metro. She then gave us the break fast hours and all the usual information about the hotel and I was surprised to find that a great selection of fruit juices and snacks are available 24hrs a day in the fridge. You just help yourself whenever you feel peckish or thirsty at no extra charge. The breakfast is delicious, we had a piping hot omelette made for us to our specifications. The bedrooms are not large but there is plenty of room and the wet room is spacious enough. The added bonus is the separate lounge with a hammock. There's not much of a view but we did that much sight seeing we didnt have time to look out of the window. In the room you get a lovely fluffy bathrobe and fantastic camper slippers so no need to pack these. The bath gel, shampoo and body lotion smells divine so you don't need to squeeze your favourites into those 100ml bottles which is such a pain. On our sightseeing days a different desk clerk wrote down an idiots guide to the metro so we knew where to get on and when to get off. The nearest station is a couple of minutes walk away and you can get everywhere on it. La Ramblas is a great location for tourists so you can't get lost if you head to it and you know Casa Camper is around there somewhere. Some of the reviews here say it's minimalist, but it's not really, they have gone for a quirky feel which works quite well, I'd say it was more modern with the camper brand running through it. Oh...and the beds are comfortable, there is no street noise so you get a great night's sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simon8999
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights for business. Great location, just off la ramblas. Friendly and helpful staff, nothing was to much for them, cannot rate them highly enough. Rooms were clean and tidy, minimalist but comfortable, would be interested to see what the suites are like. Breakfast was great with a chef on hand to cook fresh omlettes etc and a 24 hour free "mini bar" with things like fresh mango yoghurt, fresh fruit etc which is a nice touch. Will be back here when next in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great family trip”
Reviews.Author: Matthew H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Camper over a long weekend with our two year old daughter, and we could not have been happier! The staff was incredible, location perfect, and the fact that one could get good snacks + drinks 24-7 made our trip not just bearable but fun. We moved from a room to a suite after our first evening - but that was a personal preference and not a reflection of room quality. Both standard and suites were well appointed - and the proliferation of hooks for hanging items meant easy stowing of our gear. We will stay at the CC again for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “One of the coolest places i've stayed”
Reviews.Author: SiKenyon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when my company flew us all over for it's 10th birthday celebrations. The hotel itself was fantastic, very cool and minimal. The rooms were well appointed, if a little small. I loved the room across the hall with the hammock and the balcony overlooking the quaint little road. The places reeks of atmosphere. The roof terrace overlooking Barcelona was wonderful. As people have mentioned, breakfast portions weren't the biggest but the food itself was very nice. I can't recommend this hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “Believe all the hype!”
Reviews.Author: Wineguy780
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Casa Camper in October 2011 and it was amazing. So close to Las Ramblas, walking distance to fantastic restaurants, the waterfront and so many attractions. The restaurant around the corner, Bar Lobo was outstanding with fresh food and a great vibe. We dined there two nights out of five nights in Barcelona. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who visits Barcelona. The subway station is a two minute walk away if you need to get around and it is perfect for couples as there is a rooftop patio that you can sit and watch the sunset while drinking a bottle of wonderful Spanish wine.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in a magical city!”
Reviews.Author: Stephd31
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Casa Camperand could not have been more pleased. Everything that the 5 star reviews have said is true. Location wise it is ideal; just a stone's throw from Pl Catalunya where the Aerobus drops off, but set in a quiet area so that there is no nighttime noise to disturb your sleep. The staff are friendly and charming but not overbearing. If you need recommendations for where to eat, how to get to a location, general advice about the city, they cant be helpful enough. Nothing was too much for the breakfast chef, cooking breakfasts to order with a welcoming smile, and the breakfasts were delicious! The staff were very thoughtful, leaving us bottles of water in our room and also lending us an iron and ironing board, without us asking, when they knew we were planning to go out to a nice restaurant! The self-service 24 hour buffet ia a great idea and very welcome after a hard day's sight-seeing when you want a snack or a drink but it is too early to go out for a meal. We stayed in a suite, which was beautifully spacious and wanting for nothing. My husband took advantage of the hammock for an afternoon siesta and I found the bathroom to be well kitted out. I especially like to complimentary bath robes and Camper slippers, as well as the toiletries. Best of all was the view from the bathroom over the 'hanging garden'. I would absolutely recommend Casa Camperif you like quirky, boutique hotels that specialise in great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: RazArtagnan32
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel based on trip advisor reviews and were not disappointed at all. We stayed with our 3 children ages 13, 11 and 8 yrs, they loved the gym and the all day snacks and when tired from all the sightseeing it was a great retreat. The photos do not do it justice and the level of accomodation of a higher quality than I imagined, better than the Ikea looking photos and very simply but stylishly designed. Very minimalist in style but great for my husband who has allergies and where the curtains and carpets in most hotels cause him a lot of discomfort. The hammock and sitting room is in fact opposite your room across the corridor which I hadn't realised from the website, we didn't use ours but the kids did. The staff were very "happy" which was a nice, quite cool and laid back. The general manger is exactly this so it obviously rubs off on the staff. We loved it and it was a perfect retreat while exploring a very busy city. The snacks were great, breakfast was good, small portions compared to other hotels/countries I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “for young people”
Reviews.Author: milagrosribes
Reviews.Content: I don't like to go across a hall to be in my bedroom, and I don't like "hammocks". Perhaps I am to old for these things. But there were young people there that seemed happy. Also some of the staff I found not so good. It is in a quiet place, this is nice. The design has some interesting ideas and a lot of colour. The hotel is near to the Placa de Catalunya, this is very good for public transport and for taxis. It is also close to the MACBA and the CCCB for good exhibition and art, and there are nice cafes and restaurants that are not so much for tourists. I liked that it is close to the centre of the city, but in a quiet place. If I go back to Barcelona I will not stay in this hotel I think.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy Quirky Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: markhusted
Reviews.Content: This is the hight of cool! The hotel pushes the whole Camper brand ethos and everything evolves from that. I stayed for one night on business and absolutely loved it. The room was seperated into two areas each side of the upstairs corridor, bedroom bathroom in one and your own personal lounge complete with hammock in the other. The staff are bright and very helpful and the whole place just oozes laid back cool. Camper flip flops sit by your bedside and the accessories in the bathroom are amazing. The room is adorned with logos and anecdotes and the overall feeling is that of comfort and warmth. the only downside is that they do not really have a bar area and the breakfast is limited. But they do have a 24 hour complimentary buffet that you just help yourself to. i like it the place a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Fantaaatic service”
Reviews.Author: 101travelled
Reviews.Content: Amazing location. Minutes from Catalunya where the Aerobus drops you off. The bus costs 5 eu. A sweet trip to a from the airport. Amazing restaurants close by like Bar Lobo. Clean hotel. Quiet hotel. Superb breakfast. 24 hr yummy snacks. And the best was the cheerful And helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual but great fun”
Reviews.Author: Rutzie
Reviews.Content: We booked here based on TA recommendations and the location. On our arrival we soon got a feel for the excellent warmth and service from staff. The rooms are functional rather than aesthetic but all nice quality and very clean. Unless a suite is booked the lounge is a room straight across the corridor, not perfect but it works. Breakfast is a bit basic but nothing is too much trouble for staff. The 24hr free drinks (not booze) and snacks is nice but the food options vary and what gets put out in the morning are not topped up (when we were there) so many items ran out by late afternoon. Location is central but away from areas that could be noisey. Great place, we'd come back if visiting Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nashes_5
Reviews.Content: If you want waiters in black tie wishing you a good day, and soft squishy chintzy armchairs - DONT COME HERE. It's a minimalist dream. It's right in the centre of town, but in a cobbled side-street so no noise other than the chatter of passers by. Its dark and moody with trendy little details, like lit up his & hers teddy bear lights and a single gaudi-esque sculpture, and a lone bicycle. There's a free permanently open cafe, with fruit juices, tea & coffee, pastries, sandwiches, fruit, yoghurt soup & wraps. Just help yourself or take a tray to your room. We loved that. It was easy and immediate and unfussy. Our room (suite 15), had a lovely big bed with a TV and some open shelving, and a separate lounge. This was our only complaint. The lounge was a bit too brutally minimalist for us. It contained a sofa and chair and table and TV. The hammock was a cute touch but the sofa was very spartan, not squishy or comfy, and not conducive to a night snuggled up infront of TV when it rained (which it did - but then it always does when we go away). The bath was a bit small but the bathroom was fine with good products and a groovy view over a huge (HUGE) tower of aspadistras outside in the yard. The staff were excellent, distrete, helpful and charming. There's an apple computer at the desk for us to use and they cook you a fresh breakfast. We really liked the atmosphere. So. Two things stopping it from being perfect. No comfy chairs in the room to veg out in, oh , and the hairdryer was rubbish. Definitely recommend it if minimalism or anonimity is how you like to travel.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but wonderful”
Reviews.Author: acw613
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights here on vacation at the end of January. The layout is odd. Didn't use the lounge across the hall very much and would have appreciated a chair in the bedroom and carpeting on the floor. However, our overall experience was excellent. The breakfast was excellent, the 24 hour snacks were great--enough to make a meal out of--soup, sandwiches etc. The staff was extremely helpful and a source of wonderful advice about what to see and how to get around. The location was great--in walking distance of most of the sights and a short walk from the metro for the rest. We felt the price was very reasonable for the value received.

Reviews.Title: “CASA CAMPER IS FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: 523didi67
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in the world.....terrific location , friendly helpful staff that can't do enough for you. Loved the breakfast and all day snack concept. Funky , tasteful rooms. Free Wifi and Internet. Great hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “What a location!”
Reviews.Author: Quebec_Yankee
Reviews.Content: You couldn't get a better location! A block off Las Ramblas, and very close to metro stops and all the tourist booths at Place Cantalonya. Service was wonderful. Staff knew/used our names, and helped us with everything we needed. Decor is new and modern, with lots of unique touches. We had a small room with two single beds, which is standard for European rooms. Larger than usual 'bathroom' area, so two women could get ready at the same time with no problem. The room also comes with a separate "sitting' room across the hall, with another TV, balcony, couch and hammock. Was nice to have a place to go to get some privacy if needed. Having all the food available was such an asset! Great breakfasts, and all day hot lunch. If you sleep late because of jet lag, or need a snack before your late dinner, there was always good food available. It's a bit pricey, but the added perks were nice. If you stay here, which I recommend, watch out for the bathroom window! It's a beautiful view of a brick wall of green plants. All the rooms look out on this wall. It's totally private though; nothing across from your window but a brick building and plants, so we never closed the blinds, because no one could possibly see it. Until the window washers came by! Yikes! I had to grab a complimentary robe quick!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother staying anywhere else. This is the place.”
Reviews.Author: JSJJMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Great area amongst the hustle and bustle of the locals but like an oasis to enter when you return. Brilliant rooms with a great breakfast and snacks available free all day. Service first class and friendly without being intrusive. We had a suite and a room which gave us heaps of space. The boys loved the hammocks and I Ioved the wall garden and bathroom. If you're used to staying at the Hilton don't come.

Reviews.Title: “A TRUE gem in every sense!”
Reviews.Author: Verely
Reviews.Content: Exquisite. What an exquisite experience staying at the Casa Camper has been! Rarely I happen to visit a new place, somewhere I have never been before and find a hotel that not only captures the vibe and of what the city is all about but it ALSO  marries it with what you want to make of it. Casa Camper location, history and metropolitan design captures the essence of the Barcelona you'll visit and savor. The service, design and unexpected treats allow you to shape the experience and make it yours - however you want to live it.  We stated at suite 35 and it was just delightful: relaxing and comfortable with twists that made our stay memorable - the hammock! The rainfall shower! The view on the garden wall! .. and the ability to deliver on the musts like being quiet and spacious.  The Team can't really be referred as 'Service' since from attitude and behavior perspective they are a step up versus what one is used to expect from a hotel staff. Attentive but not overwhelming, genuinely nice, respective of your space but also impeccably efficient. Thank you! The complimentary non-alcoholic drinks and treats are a real nice to have - expecially after you spent the day walking around. The way some if them are served add to the experience. Simply wonderful breakfast: superior quality ingredients!  The rooftop must be wonderful in the summer, not so in the winter but as you spend time in Barcelona you'll appreciate rooftop views more and more so it is a nice to have the option.  The combination of all of this made our stay truly exquisite. Casa Camper has all the elements that inspired the W hotel concept while maintaining a more personable boutique size experience.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adambikenyc
Reviews.Content: I just return from a long weekend visiting Barcelona. If it were not for the recommendation of a friend, I would not have stayed at the Casa Camper an am I glad I did. The location of the hotel is central to shopping, the waterfront and many of the cultural and architectural attractions, I walked every where. The staff is superb. First they had a room available for my early arrival, so I could shower and change after an overnight flight. Second, the desk staff could see I was tired and brought me a cup of delicious coffee. Third, I gave them a list of restaurants and they booked all my reservations, even calling me to confirm. The staff is very acccomodating. The hotel itself is pretty quirky but it works. The rooms are moden and sparse, they contain a very comfortable platform bed and a great shower. The bathroom looks out onto a vertical garden and the room is very quiet. Across the hall is a separate sitting room. The hotel features compliementary snacks and beverages in the lobby, I mean real food, salads, breads, pasteries and a variety of bottled water. I would not hesitate to stay at the Camper again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous chic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Phildickenson
Reviews.Content: We have just left the Casa Camper after a wonderful stay. The reception staff made us feel welcome as soon as we arrived and gave us a tour of the facilities. We immediately felt relaxed in this modern minimalist environment. Our standard room was a good size with a very large and comfortable bed. At the opposite side of the corridor was our own private lounge. The bedroom window opened onto the vertical garden. The lounge looked into the street below. That made the bedrooms very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “life in style, barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Primordialooze
Reviews.Content: Along a narrow street off the ramblas, few minutes walk from placa catalunya, is a quiet and comfortable hotel where nothing is too much trouble for the multilingual staff. The decor is elegantly understated, in the day it can be a quiet refuge from frantic city life. The rooms private with an amazing wall of greenery seen from the bathroom. After the Casa Camper, no other hotel will do!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've slept in”
Reviews.Author: agur11
Reviews.Content: Although a bit more expensive than other hotels - it's definitely worth every cent! It's not your everyday, plain, boring hotel: The rooms are different, the lobby is different, the staff is special - all in a good way. We've spent 3 nights in the hotel - and I have only good things to say about it. We took the suite as we took our 2-year old daughter with us, and wanted some kind of a separation between the spaces. (The regular rooms each have two separate spaces - the bedroom+bathroom on side of the corridor and across the hall the nice living room with a hammock and a balcony. It may sound weird, but it's cool). The suite has 3 spaces - bathroom with views to the garden, the bedroom and the living room+balcony. All separated by a sliding door so very convenient with kids. There is no mini bar in the rooms as the hotel wants you to enjoy the cool buffet area that offers (free of charge, 24 hours a day) snacks, tea, coffee, little sandwiches etc. Again - very cool and convenient. Few more things to point out: The staff is extra nice and helpful. Really out of the ordinary. The roof is really nice. The location is perfect - 1 minute walking from the Ramblas and the MACBA. Bar Lobo is 5 minutes away (very good food and cool atmosphere). Bottom line - I found my hotel in Barcelona and will def. go back + recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable 4 star boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: tinpanalley
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper is a quiet hotel in a good/central location in Barcelona, very near to the metro and taxi stops and within walking distance to several major tourist attractions. The hotel offers free 24 hour access to bottled water, juices, food, fresh fruit, sweets, etc in the kitchen on the first floor. Finally, I was glad to have access to free wifi as there are a lot of hotels that still charge for wifi. I've stayed here twice in both the larger suite and the smaller room and they are both quality rooms and quite comfortable. I will definitely stay here again when I return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hispanisto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (late 20s) enjoyed our stay at Casa Camper, Barcelona immensely. The hotel is charming, the staff attentive and the location excellent. The price compares favourably to other 4* hotels, and we took advantage of an early booking discount (paying in full at the moment of booking) to pay 10% less than the list price. The bedroom was spacious and well kept, with a huge showering space, and the orientation of the bedroom (looking out onto a 'vertical garden') ensured peace and quiet. The 'mini-lounge' across the hall (which comes as standard and is for you only - ie, not shared with other guests) was a great place to relax (on the hammock or sofa) in between returning from sightseeing and going out again for an evening meal. The breakfast was good, as was the selection of snacks available (as part of the room price) 24 hours a day in the lobby area, although I would have liked to have seen a little more variation on that front. But, that is the most minor of minor quibbles in what was a wonderful city-break experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in a dynamic city”
Reviews.Author: hpeep54
Reviews.Content: The rooms (you get a bedroom with bath AND a separate living room, with a futon and hammock), the food (ask for a poached egg at breakfast), and the staff(knowledgeable, helpful, always available) make this hotel a perfect respite in this busy city. Staying at CC enhanced our visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for travelling with small kids”
Reviews.Author: xgirl76
Reviews.Content: Can only repeat what the other reviews have said about the hotel - very friendly staff, lovely rooms, very clean and quiet and great location. We spent 4 nights here with a toddler, so wanted to review from that point of view - we booked a suite, which was perfect for when she went to sleep before us and the hotel provided a travel cot made up with sheets, blanket, pillow. Staff were very friendly and welcoming to baby and the free snack bar was a lifesaver on days when she refused to eat with us when we were out - we always knew we had a number of options to offer her back at the hotel and the kitchen staff were very accommodating if we asked for any extra fruit or similar to be provided. The food in the snackbar was actually delicious - nice and fresh and selection varied daily - this is a great bonus for being included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great people”
Reviews.Author: AHB58
Reviews.Content: This was located perfectly for my sister and myself. Easy to get to the main street, lots of cafes near by as well as Metro and buses. We liked the separate rooms as I had to take a few conference calls, and loved the snacks. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrewsp50
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in august and really enjoyed! Location was perfect near ramblas. Room was nice and clean. Staff very helpfull!

Reviews.Title: “A very fine "un-hotel" experience”
Reviews.Author: alanglazen
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in the most luxurious places, but decided to try something different in Barcelona. Casa Camper is two blocks from Ramblas, down an alley (a busy one!), and all that marks it is a red neon line and the word "HOTEL." The glass slides to let you in, then another...and suddenly, you're in a sort of college housing situation----but much nicer. The ground floor is a check-in area, lots of tables and chairs, and a room full of snacks---beverages, sandwiches, salads, deserts, etc etc....all available all day at no charge. The rooms are like no other. Your room is minimalist, comfortable bed, a wall to wall strip of hooks so you can literally hang your entire wardrobe, each on its same hook! The rooms are spotless, the shower supplies are wonderful, and the beds are very comfortable. Shower is walk-in and great, plus there's a vertical wall garden outside the window. The special twist is that you also get the room across the hall! This room has a wall to wall hammock, a couch and a nice flat tv; and there's a small balcony overlooking the busy alley. You can walk here in minutes from either end of Rambla, and are within 15 minutes of virtually everything the city. The staff is enormously helpful and friendly, with absolutely zero attitude, much the same as the hotel itself. This is a great place to bring the kids----not a romantic destination, no pretense----it's just fun.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, but good!”
Reviews.Author: SussexAdventurers
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have just returned from a very enjoyable weekend in Barcelona. Largely on the basis of Tripadvisor reports, we chose to stay at the Casa Camper and we were not disappointed. Upon arrival at the hotel late on Friday evening (the taxi driver got lost - the hotel is not that easy to find) we were warmly greeted by name by the desk staff. This was probably the best greeting we've ever experienced in any hotel we've stayed at, so thanks very much Wim. The hotel iteslf is boutique and very quirky. Some of the quirks were really great, e.g. the 24/7 help yourself snack/soft drinks area (being very nit picking the choice of snacks could have been more imaginitive), and some were weird, such as the separate 'lounge' area (across a public corridor) to the rooms. To be honest, we didn't use our lounge at all and find it difficult to see why many guests would. Location wise, this hotel is in a great spot being just minutes walk from La Ramblas and Placa de Catalunya, but in a relatively quiet area. In fact, the hotel was very quiet in general (unlike most city centre hotels, especially in Barcelona). Our room was modern, spacious and minimalistically but tastefully appointed. The shower was great. The only problem was that our room was simply too hot. The hotel had turned off the a/c for the winter period but, despite having the only opening window (toilet) open this failed to let in sufficient cooling air. The breakfast (a buffet + cooked-to-order eggs/omelettes) was good and the service impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: perryjohnston
Reviews.Content: Location perfect: easy walk to the best known Rambla, but far enough away to be in another world of small shops and restaurants. Comfortable, clean--love that shower-- and an across the hall private lounge was used and enjoyed. An outlet in the safe allowed us to charge the laptop but keep it locked up while we were away Breakfast was great and all-day and evening snacks just what we needed. The staff was helpful without being overbearing, youthful, very nice to older guests (us) and knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the city. What more could we ask for? (ok, one thing-- a little boost in the WiFi in the rooms). Seven days later we didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “You rocks man”
Reviews.Author: Mykosher
Reviews.Content: Incredible place. Renovated, great staff etc. Everything has been already say about it. Maybe should recommand to traveler to book in advance for getting better price. I usually prefer large place but this one make think twice. Well will come back and recommand. just forget about a rental car. too hard to reach and to park

Reviews.Title: “Great stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpk186240
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at Casa Camper, not the cheapest of hotels but loved it's quirkiness. Given it was such a different and enjoyable experience, we felt it was worth every penny. Having two rooms was such a great idea. We used our lounge loads, really comfortable with a little balcony where we could watch life in the street below. Also the great choice of freshly made salads, savoury and sweet, sandwiches, snacks and drinks free 24hrs was so good - fun to take a little tray up to our lounge late at night. Breakfasts were excellent too. The location couldn't be better - just a few minutes from la Rambla, and short walking distance to some superb restaurants and metro stations. Very quiet, clean, amazing shower and very comfortable beds. The staff were so helpful too. If you like unusual and modern this is THE place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has the je ne sais quoi factor!”
Reviews.Author: linmos
Reviews.Content: I have to be honest – when I first arrived at the hotel, I did not get all the hype from TripAdvisor. To me, the hotel looked like an adult hostel – very minimal and modest. It did not take me long though to get it – this property was anything but ordinary. This hotel had the je ne sais quoi factor. There were so many reasons as to why the experience at this hotel was exceptional. Firstly the location – the hotel manages to have a sense of seclusion and intimacy even though it is set in the midst of the hustle and bustle of the trendy area of Barcelona just off La Rambla. The simplicity of the design and décor of the common areas and rooms were in fact anything but that, as the hotel was very edgy, trendy, clever and sophisticated. The consistently outstanding service and attention to every detail to make our stay in both the hotel and Barcelona the most memorable was unparalleled at any hotel we have stayed in except for Casa Campa Berlin which I have reviewed separately. Perhaps the most subtle and intangible factor that sets this hotel apart from most hotels is the outward passion and exuberance of the staff. Simply put, I fell in love with this property. To Susana and all her staff at Casa Camper Barcelona, thank you for everything and more!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phil B
Reviews.Content: A truly perfect hotel for Barcelona. The free mini bar (including free bottled water) was worth the slightly premium rate alone. A very clean, modern and thoughtful hotel. All staff spoke good English which was helpful for us. The restaurant that is attached is equally as great as the hotel. Only downside is the location is bordering on a sketchy part of the city. We had no issues but if you walk a couple blocks away from the Ramblas at night time it wasn't as pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Casual, effortless style and service”
Reviews.Author: traffjudd
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper embodies the Camper philosophy of casual, effortless style with a touch of sass. Located close to Catalunya Square, Rambla, etc, this is a perfect place from which to explore Barcelona. It is so refreshing to know exactly what you will be paying when visiting a hotel. Service is outstanding; personal yet not irritating. Rooms are extremely spacious for European standards, impeccably clean, quiet and with 100% blockout shutters to allow you to sleep off the cava and tapas from the night before. Having read about the included food provisions, I was sceptical to say the least. So imagine my surprise when I found fresh salads (not easy to find in BCN), great sandwiches, yoghurts, juices, soft drinks and snacks, available 24/7. Breakfasts were cooked to order, and included omlettes, eggs, bacon, pancakes, etc, all cooked by the very friendly Casa Camper chef. There are only 5 rooms per floor so you never feel like you are just a number. If travelling with a partner or friend, the separate mini-lounge is a great way to give yourself some space. There is also a small gym if you feel like hitting the weights or treadmill. My only gripe is that the free wifi was very weak to the point of being unuseable from our room. We were able to access it fine from the lobby/meals area, where they also have a free computer terminal and printer set up. Despite this, I would recommend Casa Camper wholeheartedly and would jump at the chance to stay there when I am next in Barcelona (or Berlin, for that matter, where they have a second property)

Reviews.Title: “Novel”
Reviews.Author: skoyen89
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in September on business. Location was ideal for the Ramblas and the whole place has a modern/designer/funky feel with some really nice touches and bright, bold (scarlet) decor. Loved the free snack bar in the lobby and the bedroom worked fine for me. Had a small lounge across the corridor and although the idea is great I didn't use it whereas I probably would have done if it was attached to my bedroom. Service efficient and friendly. Meeting room in basement functional but wouldn't want to spend more than a working day in it as it had no windows. Overall made a great break from normal business hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience, can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Timmy373737
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Barcelona and from the get go it was an amazing experience We booked based on tripadvisor and were not disappointed at all, in addition to the huge room we also had a separate room with a lounge and a hammock which looked over the alleyway and into the street. We had a great rain shower with plenty of space and a fantastic Spanish radio station to groove to. The staff were more than helpful, totally lovely and kind. We helped ourselves to he 24/7 buffet whenever we wanted and took great pleasure in the great breakfasts that raised the benchmark for the rest of our tour of Europe, this place comes highly recommended and we will certainly return (perhaps permanently)

Reviews.Title: “A model for what a city hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: Frequentraveller4950
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this boutique hotel during a recent visit to Barcelona. It's such an innovative concept of city hotel accomodation. The décor is minimalistic and very modern, but with a very refined elegance. The hotel is spotless throughout; rooms, reception area, caffeteria; a high standard of cleanliness is an obvious concern of the management. The idea of two separate rooms, one with the sleeping, cloth-storing and bath facilities and the other as a small sitting room, is very intelligently designed. Also the availablity of snacks and drinks round the clock is very much appreciated by all clients - what a wonderful idea! Breakfast is quite good, and the hot food option is quite extensive and freshly prepared to your requirements. The staff is extremely friendly, courteous and helpful throughout. This hotel is owned by the footwear company 'Camper', designers of shoes that focus on practicality and comfort - a concept that has been brilliantly and sensitively appllied in their new hotels (they have another one in Berlin).

Reviews.Title: “lovely, lovely, lovely!”
Reviews.Author: xtcfan1964
Reviews.Content: Great location, helpful staff and 24 hour free snack area a real bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: humphrey58
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5nights. The staff could not have been more helpful. On arrival we were given a tour of the facilities available.Throughout the stay the desk staff helped with bookings and advice. The hotel is quiet,funky and clean. A great stay

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, amazing friendly service, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: snooper
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this wonderful small hotel from the 16th to the 24th of October and had one of the best experiences ever in Barcelona. This is a small renovated hotel family owned, they have one in Berlin I believe, which really delivers on both amenities and personal, attentive service. The staff were the best, from making reservations for us at hard to get in places, Moo, Dos Padillos, getting us tickets to the Opera and a private tour of some wonderful wineries outside Barcelona they came through, nothing was to much trouble. The rooms are great, we had a suite, #25 this was bathroom, tub and wonderful waterfall shower, lovely comfortable bed, flatscreen TV, large front room with couch and hammock, balcony that overlooks the small street the hotel is located on, Carrer Elisabets. They do not have mini bars but instead an area downstairs where there is food free 24/7, sandwiches, deserts, soups, fruit, etc. The breakfasts, cooked to order in the morning were wonderful and this is such a great value. They were happy to put away any wine you brought in and bring up to your room when you wanted, they also have wine and cava's for sale at very reasonable prices. There is also a gym on the bottom floor if you feel so inclined but after an eight our day of walking around the city you may not need it. Again the location is amazing, three streets off Les Rambes, so not to noisy, one block from the Museum of Contemporary Art, lots of little cafes and restaurants in the immediate area. The hotel also works with a wonderful company that will do private tours and excursions for you where ever you want to go. Again, this was a wonderful place to stay in every way, would absolutly go back!

Reviews.Title: “The nicest staff for weary travelers!”
Reviews.Author: AMS2007
Reviews.Content: My daugther and I stayed at the Casa Camper in Bacelona for one night before a Mediterranean cruise. It was definitely one of the best decisions I ever made. The absolute friendliness and helpfulness of the staff made up for any shortcoming I may have found after being awake for almost 24 hours in a new country. The location was uniquely perfect and the accomodations, although not my typical choice, were very comforting. As a result, Barcelona was a highlight of our trip and we would love to go back for a longer visit.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful welcome to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: moxieandgiggi
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we knew we had made the right choice for our first night in Barcelona. The enthusiastic and friendly staff gave us a warm welcome and an orientation to the city using the map on the lobby wall. The kitchen was available 24 hours a day with a variety of snacks and refreshments, and a great breakfast was served in the morning. The location itself is convenient and charming. It's on one of the narrow streets on which the only non-pedestrian traffic allowed is delivery vehicles and taxis carrying customers of the hotels on the street. There are several charming cafes in the neighborhood and it's only a 5 minute walk to Las Ramblas. There is a nice rooftop terrace where you can finish your nightcap. The rooms have garish red walls, but each room has a seperate sitting room across the hall, and the large modern bathrooms have a one-way glass wall looking across and alley to a wall covered in plants. Our room was a bit pricey at over $200, but worth the extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: winecouchon
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast is a real plus made to order. Snacks and coffee anytime. Clean and airy. A great location. A fun and quirky hotel a great stay. Sandi & Bonnie

Reviews.Title: “easily my all time fav hotel........”
Reviews.Author: Anita W
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent 5 nights at the Casa Camper in Barcelona recently. From the moment we stepped in we were looked after exceptionally well. The staff were attentive, friendly and very helpful. We loved the concept of the hotel, it's quirkiness, the location and all the amenities. The only thing I could fault was the lack of english channels on the cable tv......but, tv is not why we came to Barcelona so it's The convenience of a 24 hr food bar, the fact that it was free all helped. The rooms were spacious, quirky and we loved the hammock in the living room. The waterfall shower was amazing! Thank you Casa Camper for making our stay in Barcelona so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “There's a reason it's #1!”
Reviews.Author: Leendaz
Reviews.Content: To celebrate our retirements this year, my friend and I spent 3 weeks in Spain, France and Italy. Casa Camper was by far the most "customer-centred" experience of all - from the moment our cab pulled up in front and a staff member was there immediately to help us with our bags - to the moment we left. We agree with all the compliments paid by other visitors - love the 2 rooms for giving us space to spread out - great beds, love the bathroom with the view of the plants - great toiletries; appreciate the convenience of the 24 hour snacking facility and the made-to-order breakfast in the morning. Friendly, knowledgable staff provided the finest service we experienced in our travels. We highly recommend Casa Camper!

Reviews.Title: “best choice, you cannot go wrong with casa camper”
Reviews.Author: mfp718
Reviews.Content: Just to add my accolades to the pile: we loved the staff, the location, and the amenities at Casa Camper. All the basics were taken care of (firm bed, strong waterfall-style shower, great linens, delicious breakfast), with truly personal, warm, and informal service. We had a little trouble with the Wifi in our floor 1 suite, but I liked sitting in the lobby to check email anyway, watching the foot traffic on lively (but not noisy) Elisabets outside. I slept better at Casa Camper than in my own home -- go!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service, quirky, cool, sleek, but friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Alison M
Reviews.Content: Stunning,all too short stay from start to finish. A young team providing exceptional service: from the warmth of the initial welcome to the great restaurant recommendations and help with making the most of the very limited time I had available - special thanks to Georgina for sharing (and making reservations for me at) her favourite restaurants, but also to Christian, Leon and the rest of the team for impeccable service. The hammock was great fun. Clean lines, lovely rooms, dark slate floors (don't drop anything breakable), a cracking breakfast, and the overall air of a hospitable home with laidback hosts for whom nothing is too much trouble. If you like the concept, you'll love the hotel. A superb base from which to explore the Barcelona. I am just looking for an excuse to return.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Style in a great area”
Reviews.Author: Cass2007
Reviews.Content: We had just one night which was not nearly long enough to appreciate either Barcelona itself or the Camper hotel. Excellent service and lovely room - we had a suite. The bathroom was superb. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and Delightful Experience in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Jagfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Camper for one night following a cruise -- wish we could have stayed longer! The hotel is conveniently located on a side street near La Ramblas and Placa Catalunya. We arrived very early off our ship and were able to get right into our rooms. One room contains the comfortable king bed, a large vanity, water closet and nice sized shower. Across the hall was our "mini suite" outfitted with a couch, another flat screen tv, small table, little balcony -- and a hammock which my husband quite enjoyed. Free breakfast and snacks are offered, including sandwiches, yogurt, fruit, and non-alcoholic beverages. They also offer beer, wine and alcohol for a reasonable price -- I enjoyed a cold Corona on the roof top terrace -- a great place to relax after a day of touring. The staff were exceptional and provided us with discount coupons and maps for the hop on and off touring bus that was a great way for us to see the sites during our short stay. They also suggested a nice, local-flavored restaurant within walking distance which we enjoyed. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “ONE COOL CASA”
Reviews.Author: britalyMiami
Reviews.Content: We stayed again twice in September at the very cool Casa Camper ,having visited it on several occasions over the years and also having stayed at other 4 star hotels in the old city...which in our opinion is the only location to stay in this fun city. Camper is virtually right next to CCCB, Macba,the Boqueria and really cool restaurants used by the locals. Highly recommended and within a few minutes walk are Anima, En Ville,Carmelitos and Lobo . all are very reasonably priced and the lunches are a bargain as is Casa Camper. The staff are a fabulous team that are fun and strike exactly the right balance with their guests. Casa Camper offers a 24 hour free snack bar, excellent coffee and drinks...help yourself all day long ,bikes etc and most of all reflects this citys special vibe. Camper will always be our first choice on future visits if we can get in .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: dsheane
Reviews.Content: Loved the Casa Camper hotel. Stay here if you want friendly, helpful staff, free snacks and soft drinks, delicious breakfasts cooked to order by a very cheerful chef, central but quiet location, nice bath products, very clean in every way & a cool atmosphere. Don't stay if you want old style, traditional type hotel. This is somewhere very different! Casa Camper was a highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: OdileParisBxl
Reviews.Content: Best location in Barcelona and beautiful rooms and terrace. Great products in the bathroom and very nice "parfum d'intérieur" in the room. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. There is also a great choice of food and drinks free of charge all day long in the lobby/dinning area! Minus points: not much natural light in the rooms, got food poisoned by one of the salmon sandwiches there... Serious minus points: bad acoustic insulation between the rooms (one can hear the next room's neighbour shower at 5 am (to catch an early flight?!) and loud water pipes in our room (NB: maybe not the case in all rooms). Whatsoever, we loved the very special atmosphere of the CasaCamper, but, considering the minus points, we left the place having mixed feelings about it... Improvements on the isulation issue would make CasaCamper truly amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service ever”
Reviews.Author: Nicole28970
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best customer service of any place I have ever stayed. My credit card was stolen when I was en route from the United States. The front desk staff at Casa Camper helped me contact my credit card company in the US and get a new card delivered. They even poured me a glass of wine and commiserated while I was on hold with the Spanish arm of Visa. And they provided great sightseeing suggestions. The staff is very warm and friendly, but not at all pushy. The location is great -- right in the heart of town. The rooms are quiet and immaculate. The breakfast is ample, and there were free snacks available all day (including fruits, yogurt, soup, bread, pasta salad, etc.). I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Stay there, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we've ever stayed in :)”
Reviews.Author: Bianca1987
Reviews.Content: Hmm, where to start. We chose the hotel basedon Trip Advisor reviews, that is why I think it is really important to write mine here as well. This hotel is one of the loveliest we've had the opportunity to stay in. Starting from the location, right in the center of Barcelona, but on a quiet side street where there wasn't much noise, breakfast - maybe the best ever, and of course, the staff, who were so friendly I just wanted to hug them :). Obviously, the price is not small, but we were not looking for a "budget" option anyway. It does include lots of little freebies and lovely gestures that make you think it's worthwhile to pay a little more. Of course, I need to talk about the complimentary breakfast, which I absolutely loved. The best part is the fact that we could order almost anything we could think of at the kitchen - pancakes, eggs in every shape and form we liked (I recommend scrambled with "everything" - vegetables, mushrooms, ham, I just loved those) and have really hearty meals before going out to explore the lovely city. I must also mention the tentempié - 24 hour snack area. It has a soup of the day, 3 sandwiches, 2 or 3 salads to choose from and 3 deserts (of which one is always fresh fruit). There are also chips, some crackers, pastries and complimentary tea and coffee, in addition to water, coke and other juices and sodas. It might not seem like much, but it all adds up, and when you are tired and not particularly hungry you can take a tray to the 6th floor and just enjoy the view of Barcelona with your little snack. All just lovely. The rooms are immaculate, the sheets and towels get changed every day, everything is wonderful and I like the fact that you get proper bottles of shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, lotion that they refill instead of the tiny sized ones that you use halfway through and then get a replacement. I also liked the smell of all the toiletries a lot :) We found the design of the room quite interesting, the shower was great, the view from the bathroom window (that is actually the room window) overlooking the vertical garden was sooo lovely and there was even a little make-up corner, with mirror and chair and everything :). Over the hallway there is the living room, with a really cute hammock, TV and a tiny balcony overlooking the street. We didn't use it extensively, because we loved the 6th floor terrace, but for really hot days it's a treat to have it. I left the best for last - the staff: just wonderful. We arrived early, at around 9 am, and Georgina had our room already prepared. Everyone was sooooo nice and helpful, giving us maps and explanations for anything we needed, they booked tables at restaurants and taxis for us, everything with a smile and wonderful manners. The ladies in the kitchen prepared such lovely brakfasts that I wanted to take them home! In the afternoon, if we were not in the room, someone always passed by to make the bed, turn on the music, leave us each a small bottle of water... simple gestures that made our stay just perfect. The free wi-fi was also great, always nice to have, especially with all the internet compatible devices we use nowadays. All in all? If we come back to Barcelona (and we certainly will), Casa Camper will always be out first choice. Definitely a keeper!

Reviews.Title: “Truly one of a kind!”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshireman2000
Reviews.Content: We are only two days into a 4 night stay at this wonderful hotel, but as the superfast hotel wide wifi is so good, I thought I may as well review it now! Much as the other reviews say, this is a unique hotel, situated in a really upbeat area of Barcelona, only 5 minutes walk from Placa Catalunya. The staff are amongst the best I have ever come across - helpful, knowledgable, friendly and efficient. The all day snack bar and compliamentary drinks make life so easy, and with a wealth of bars and restaurants in the local area, it's a superb oasis of calm in this busy city. You will feel at home the second you arrive, and I would recommend this place to my best friends without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, accomodating and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: SusieASeattle
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Barcelona and stayed one night at the Hotel Casa Camper and had a wonderful stay. This is definitely an urban hotel, very small and no pool but it didn't matter. The rooms are very spacious and you get a bonus room, the mini-lounge which is across from the hotel hallway from your sleeping room. The mini-lounge has another TV, couch and a hammock. It's perfect if you have young kids who sleep earlier. I just left the main room door slightly ajar so that I could hear my kids and my husband and I didn't have to whisper everything. Don't miss the breakfast, it's really fantastic. It's not a huge selection but everything they have was high quality, especially the pancakes and eggs made to order. We also loved the 25 hour snack station. They have fresh sandwiches and salads along with cold drinks, such a nice touch. The hotel staff was also very accommodating and friendly, a very nice stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms were funky and stylish and the staff were AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: tcjr5736
Reviews.Content: We arrived late Saturday night in Barcelona. The taxi dropped us off at the end of the busy, what we would call an "alleyway" in Philadelphia, but was actually a European throughway right out of Westside Story. It was buzzing. Bikers riding their bikes, skateboarders dashing through, folks enjoying their dinner at 11p at the outside tables of restaurants and couples of all types walking hand-in-hand. We walked the equivalent of a block only to arrive at this modern gem with glass doors, bikes suspended from the ceiling, funky chairs, and a flatscreen projecting in the entryway. They have done an innovative thing. The minibar is downstairs with your selection of glasses or bottles of wine in a sleek case. They quickly serve whatever you ask for. You walk toward the back and there is your pick of waters, juices and snacks. This same location is where you can order breakfast between 7:30a and 11:30a. Paula (pronounced Pay-oo-la) is an amazing chef who whips up your choice of omelette, eggs, bacon, pancakes...you name it. Then Adrienne, a wonderful young man, slips in and out with your tray of coffee. It could not be better orchestrated. The rooms are sleek, modern and comfortable. Again an open floor plan with open-type shower that turns into a bidet and a beautiful view of their wall of plants. You just have to see it. The other neat thing is the sitting room directly across the hall from your bedroom. With the touch of a button you have access to your own sitting/lounge complete with the signature hammock. All so simple yet stylish and thoroughly accommodating. The rooftop is another plus. After a day of going around the city, grab a glass of wine and go sit atop the roof and see the amazing mountain view with the sounds of Catalan music in the background. It is truly a tasteful, funky, lovely place. Finally, the staff are extraordinary. Everyone was more than helpful from the minute we set foot in the door until the early morning departure--making dinner reservations, drawing diagrams, directions, information sharing, history sharing, Catalan language and pure kindness. Gina, Alesandro, Vin, Aurelie, Max, Fernanda, and Mimi were ever so charming. I am certain we have missed someone but all were outstanding. We cannot wait to go back and stay their again. If this does not help, to give you an idea we are stayers at Kimpton Hotels and we feel Casa Camper has matched if not exceeded them

Reviews.Title: “Clean, upbeat, accomodating place for beginning of honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Yayareagirl
Reviews.Content: This place was really lovely. My husband told them it was our honeymoon, so they put flower petals on the bed, provided a chilled bottle of sparkling wine, and chocolate strawberries (i assume he paid a little extra for that). It is located in a fun and funky part of town. We asked for one of the larger rooms with a little balcony. There was a hammock in the room, right next to the balcony doors. They have a lounge and kitchen area in the lobby with all kinds of snacks available throughout the day, and where you can go down in the morning and get a great hot breakfast prepared. The rooms are perfectly clean, and the service was wonderful. We had zero complaints.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LisaCOrlando
Reviews.Content: My husband, 14-year-old son and I stayed here Aug. 5-10, 2011, and we couldn't have been more pleased. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is hip, spare and stylish, and the rooms are unique -- with a bedroom and a "mini-lounge" with a hammock across the hall. The mini-lounge, which also has a sofa that can be made up into a bed, was where my son slept, and he loved having his own space. It had double doors that opened onto a balcony overlooking the street. On our side, we looked out onto a vertical garden. The terrace on the 6th floor is a lovely place to relax. But the best part was the 24/7 snack bar, which also in the mornings serves a full breakfast -- from eggs and bacon to omelets to pancakes. Having a teenager, the always-available drinks and snacks (and we're talking substantial snacks, including sandwiches and salads) was a real bonus. Those who complain the hotel is like Ikea are totally missing the point of it, I think. Finally, the location is perfect -- near Ramblas, but far enough away to be an oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Castor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good! I stayed here with friends, and we all agreed. We chose the hotel because of its good reviews here on TripAdvisor, and we were not dissapointed. Modern and lots of cool details throughout the whole hotel. Service in reception flawless!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful home base in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mrchiplambert
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed every moment staying at this hotel. The staff is exceedingly friendly, warm, and helpful. We stayed there twice during our 2 weeks in Spain, both at the beginning of our trip and at the end, and were welcomed back as if we were good friends. As many people have noted, the 24-hour complimentary food and beverages are a huge plus (and delicious), particularly when you're traveling and paying a fortune for bottled water and other refreshments. I have great memories of taking a tray of water and a snack up to the beautiful roof for sun-drenched siestas. The novel 2-room set-up was great for the 2 of us, and I especially enjoyed opening the doors overlooking the lively street below and reading in the hammock. This configuration also created a situation where our bedroom was completely silent at night - much appreciated in such an exuberant and boisterous city. The bathrooms and the shower were spotless, modern, comfortable, and I adored the bath products they provided. The only note I have is that the bedrooms are a little spare and dark for both my taste and a hotel at this price level. That said, I loved this hotel and would return any time I am in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding modern hotel, great staff, will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I stayed at the Casa Camper in two separate rooms during the Formula 1 race weekend in Barcelona. The rave reviews on TripAdvisor influenced our decision to stay there and we were thrilled with our choice. The rooms are modern, clean and fun to spend time in. The extra lounge room concept is very clever and fun, the vertical garden, the clever posters, the free food during non-meal times, and finally the location are all fantastic. The staff were the biggest asset, especially Aurelie, always helpful, genuinely friendly with a big smile and ready to ensure an unforgettable stay. I will definitely come back to Barcelona and Casa Camper will be my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable stay I've had at a hotel in a long time!”
Reviews.Author: Looking-Ahead
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for pomp and circumstance, over the top luxury, or plush accommodations, this isn't the place. Casa Camper is lovely and simple. The rooms are pleasantly furnished with streamlined, basic seating. The beds are super comfy and we all slept extremely well. I was traveling with my three teenage sons and the 24 hour "Tentempié," or food pantry came in very handy. Free beverages alone would have been a boon. The staff at the reception desk were helpful with directions and recommendations for restaurants. One young woman gave us a few options for restaurants and suggested that we look the up online and decide which one we liked best before choosing, which was great advice. Everyone we came into contact with at the hotel was kind and friendly including housekeeping. Showers were lovely with large overhead shower-heads, lots of pressure and plenty of hot water. We booked a regular room (bedroom with sitting room across the hall) and a suite (bedroom and sitting room combined with pocket door between the two, and had more space than we needed most of the time. The kids loved the hammock. All in all it was a pleasant and enjoyable experience - better than we have had in some pricier and more "luxe" hotels!

Reviews.Title: “I just lovvve this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Najla-a-k
Reviews.Content: The hotel is definitely is not one of those hotels you see every day, it's very unique and modern. You get to have in addition to your room a mini lounge just across the hall. The buffet is open 24 hours a day and it's complementary. You can take your meal at the lobby, in your own lounge or at the terrace on 6th floor. Wifi is free all the time and everywhere in this hotel. The staff are extremely friendly and cooperative. Some may think of the location as a down side -since it's on a side street of the rambla's - but to me I stayed at la rambla's in the royal hotel it was too noisy so the location is perfect for my taste.

Reviews.Title: “More like staying with your most hospitable friends, than staying in a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Shirlaws
Reviews.Content: As a family of four it's sometimes difficult to find a hotel that can offer enough space, within a reasonable price i.e. without having to book 2 entirely separate rooms. Casa Camper is an absolute gem, we booked a suite which meant our sons were close by, but not too close! The staff are amazing, genuinely helpful and clearly very happy to be part of the Casa Camper experience. Our children were also made to feel welcome, which made the entire trip more relaxing for us and we really appreciated that. As with all the other reviews we loved the buffet, the roof terrace, the location and the excellent presentation of this hotel. My only concern is that it's so good you have to force yourself to go out and explore Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joe835
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Casa Camper from 19-22 July, on foot of the rave reviews it's gotten on TripAdvisor, where it was #2 rated hotel in Barcelona. How it dropped to #3 I have no idea, because it lived up to our expectations hugely. Firstly, yes it's a little pricey. But you get a lot for your money at the same time. A very central location, yet utterly silent (the street is pretty noisy but you'd never guess inside). A cool, peaceful reception area and a nice selection of snacks and drinks, all free to guests. We saved around €20 a day on snacks, so don't forget to take that into account if you're on a budget! Breakfast is nice but I would've liked some kind of idea as to what they actually can make for you. We saw other guests with omelettes, so we asked for them every morning but I felt odd asking what they did or didn't make. The cereal selection was a little odd; Smacks, tasteless Country Store muesli, Special K and some type of Coco Pops - Corn Flakes would've been nice! But honestly, who cares? The rooms are big, the wi-fi is free and it never gave any trouble, the beds are insanely-comfortable (and my wife adored the in-room hammock). The staff are wonderful. And there's a big map of the city in the room; what a handy little innovation. Our bathroom looked out onto a patio with hundreds of large potted plants mounted on a huge metal frame around 30m high, a great source of natural light. We were only sorry not to have availed of the rooftop terrace! But that's this hotel all-over; innovative. It's a little unusual, the Ikea comments aren't far off the mark and if you want old world luxury, this isn't the place for you. But I like Ikea - and if you want premium comfort in a fantastic location with wonderful staff, you'll like this hotel. I honestly don't think you can't do better than the Casa Camper. We're definitely going to their Berlin hotel the next time we visit!

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: dmambler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, recommend suite for families as this is one large room that can be divided. Best location in Barcelona. Decor refreshing novel and 24 hr snacks were a great feature.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly style over substance?”
Reviews.Author: debbieg5
Reviews.Content: Yes this is an enjoyable hotel, but would not stay there again. For the cost felt I was being taken for a ride, as case of the Emperor's New Clothes perhaps. First the good news. staff and location fantastic. But they couldn't have done things any cheeper and were passing this off as some sort of style statement. Personally I like a door on my shower or at least a seperate bathroom, tower rails, wires fixed or hidden in walls, a bedhead and the odd surface or draw to put things in, and as we were staying 4 nights this became irritating. The extra room is only useful if you have children or need to work. The lack of a fridge and kettle wasn't compensated by the snack bar downstairs althiugh this did give the hotel the 'home' feel of going to the fridge when you wanted something, you did have to get dressed and go downstairs. The reviewer who said this hotel was Ikea got it absolutely right, so don't get carried away by the rave reviews. Its a good experience but a limited one, I would say keep it to 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, but darkish....”
Reviews.Author: montgolfier
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the good bits: Very nice people, helpful service; good breakfast and a very nice selection of included drinks, sandwiches, salads, soups throughout the day; location is excellent in the old part of town. On the downside, the hotel is pretty dark, in particular the lobby, so is the bedroom that catches some light from the large bathroom windows. This sounds worse than it actually is, but it just adds the the darkish character of the place. Fixtures, etc are well kept. The split room concept did not convince us. You need to cross the corridor to enter a small lounge room to the front; actually, we never even spent time in that room. All in, not a bad place, nice goodies, good location, but overpriced for the standards you are offered.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Cool, & Free Food!!!”
Reviews.Author: Emmy1778
Reviews.Content: Free food & drink are always a plus. Just not having to worry about getting bottled water all the time was good enough for me. They had every drink you could ever want. Food/snacks weren't great, especially for an American, lots of carbs, but it's better than what you'd get anywhere else, which is nothing. The biggest asset this hotel has is it's wonderful staff. Such nice people!!! We had a camper suite. Clean, large & quiet, although dimly lit. Overall, fun & quirky. Hotels side street location off La Ramblas is truly delightful. Barcelona is probably one of my least favorite European cities. Very strange, hippy-like culture & dirty, but would stay again for 1 night, pre or post cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Very belated review, but memories still fresh!”
