Reviews.Author: trishpdx
Reviews.Content: I'm really, really late in writing this review! My husband and I stayed here almost 4 years ago for our 10th anniversary and we loved it. I want to go back to Barcelona just to stay there. I can't say enough good things about it! Glad it is still receiving the rave reviews it deserves!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel concept”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesPal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Camper for 4 nights in early June. Wonderful concept with the additional room across the hall and the 24 snack/drink bar and free breakfast. Absolutely fantastic staff, their restaurant suggestions were great. The area seemed perfectly safe, close to the Rambla yet quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly my all-time favorite”
Reviews.Author: captainjackhays
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay. Small, quiet, chic, personal, spotless, fun, and innovative. Elegant simplicity. The café is exactly right, the separate room across the hall is smarter than might at first appear, the staff is helpful and friendly, the location is excellent, and on and on and on. Here's a small tip: Next to the hotel is a small pan-Asian bar/restaurant that appears to be part of the same enterprise. I know that Asian food in Barcelona might sound weird, but it's a must. Their Asian "tapas" are incredible. You may need a reservation for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: deserttraveler50
Reviews.Content: We have traveled in Europe many times and the Casa Camper Hotel is the best hotel experience we have ever had. We LOVED it!!! The staff was very friendly and more than helpful. Each room has a separate lounge area which made it feel more like a suite than a room. Great idea!!! The complementary breakfast, soft drinks and sandwich/soup bar was such a GREAT addition! Casa Camper is right off the Rambles and convenient to everything. Even though the hotel is in a bustling area, it was very, very quiet. Each room is off a beautiful inner courtyard. A real treat after a busy day of sightseeing. We will stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: Vanni75
Reviews.Content: All positive comments below are true. Add the good location (near to Ramblas 'and' quiet - you could hear nothing within your room) , the personal approach of the Hotel staff and 24H buffet and this is great value for money (rates are not cheap).

Reviews.Title: “I adore this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vamonos99
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. I wouldn't change a thing. It is in a perfect location just off La Rambla on a very quiet street. A very short walk from Plaza Catalunya. The staff are so wonderful and too many to name but Mimi, Max, and Little French girl made my visit extra special! The rooms are very spacious, light and airy. I loved the living room across the hail to throw the doors open and relax. The shower is awesome. The bed was fantastic. The 24 hour snacks and drinks are lovely. They also have a terrific little selection of wines and beers etc. for purchase. No request ever seemed to be too much and the staff always seemed to know just what to do to help. I came back from shopping with flowers one day and by the time I made it to my room they were in a gorgeous vase of water. I just can't wait to get to go back one day. Thanks to all of you for such an amazing stay. My plans caused me to have another hotel booked for the second half of my week and I missed my new friends at Casa Camper dearly!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: HappyGardener26
Reviews.Content: This is a straightforward, modern and practical sort of place with lots of flexibility. The staff could not have been more helpful and sympathetic. The rooms were clean and spacious with fantastic big showers and comfortable beds. The chill-out room across the corridor was a hugely popular novelty - especially the hammock - and the 24 hour 'snack' bar was an instant hit with our student sons. They could get soup, sandwiches, yoghurt and fruit, day and night, and we could make ourselves a cup of tea. So rare to find a kettle available for guests' use in continental hotels. This facility would surely be a boon for families with young children too. The location is very central, just off La Rambla, near to the wonderful market and an easy walk from the Placa Catalunia. Barcelona was packed for Easter week and the hotel was full, but in spite of the crowds outside our room (on the 5th floor) was quiet and the Casa Camper proved to be a peaceful retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel staffed with nice people”
Reviews.Author: Grapeman57
Reviews.Content: The people who work at many designer hotels can be haughty and frigid but not here. The decor at Casa Camper may be hip and modern but the staff is helpful and friendly. They'll answer your questions and give you great recommendations on the city. Breakfast is a treat with eggs and pancakes to order. And the snacks and drinks in the lobby are convenient and tasty. Would recommend and look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “a little piece of heaven in bustling Barcelona!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luvgreathotels
Reviews.Content: Just home from a trip to Barcelona with very fond memories of my stay at Casa Camper!!! I was sad to leave this hotel after a five-day stay although the hugs from several staff when I departed took the sting out of my departure. This might sound like an over-the-top comment but rarely in my travels have I enountered such warmth from staff, as well as helpfulness and cheeriness!!! The location of this hotel is ideal - a few blocks from Las Ramblas down a narrow street which makes it a quiet oasis away from the hubbub. Should also mention the excellent security as no one can even enter the lobby without a pass key so you feel very secure. The lobby is serene with lovely music playing, a computer area, a 24 hour snack and eating area. Breakfasts have an excellent selection of food [meats, cheeses, fruits, baking, breads, etc], individually ordered specialty coffees, and, eggs/pancakes made to order and delivered to your table by the smiling chefs, Paola and CHristina. After breakfast and throughout the day and evening, there are a good variety of snacks and beverages provided. We would stop there late afternoon and after supper for relaxation and a drink/snack and our day's debriefing. The hotel is contemporary, funky and quirky in design. The rooms are large, very clean and well kept. The suites are almost condo-size. The 'regular' rooms have a large sleeping area and bathroom [with very large shower] and then across the hall is a 'living room' with TV, couch and hammock - a perfect set-up for families or duos [where one wants to sleep and the other wants to watch TV, etc]. I loved my stay at the Casa Camper and would definitely stay there again when I return to Barcelona. I want to specifically name several staff who went the extra mile: Fernanda [whom I called "Bonita"] and Alexander!!! I miss them already and I only checked out two days ago. With fond memories................................

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: veus55
Reviews.Content: First, we like the hotel location, close to the Ramblas but on the side streets. Many great restaurants close to the hotel. The hotel is very modern and convenient. We love the fact that there are drinks and food 24 hours in the hotel lobby that are included with your stay. The rooms are very practical and modern. The beds are comfortable and king size. Every room has a "sala de estar" across the hallway. This is a small living room with a balcony, hammock, a sofa and a TV set. We found this room to be very charming and we would go there every day to take a "siesta". The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazingly helpful and warm team, great room, permanent smiles on our faces!”
Reviews.Author: DazTaff
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona this weekend for our wedding anniversary. From arrival to departure, the Casa Camper team couldn't have been more welcoming, hospitable and helpful with regard to restaurant reco's and information. The generosity of 24 hour inclusive access to treats, snacks and drinks (versus that old overpriced minibar chestnut) made all the guests in the 25 rooms of this delightful hotel behave in an equally generous manner in response to the only request - that trays be placed back in the kitchen. Delicious breakfasts cooked every day from 7 - 11 only served to add to the feeling that we were being treated really well by really good friends who were sharing their cheerful home and rooftop terrace. Rooms are really comfortable and cleverly set up, each with a completely separate sitting room that enables one of you to work while the other watches TV undisturbed! Located within about thirty steps of the Museum of Modern Art, and just a few more steps from La Rambla - even closer if you use one of the guest bicycles hanging in the lobby - it is nevertheless in a peaceful quiet little street and is an oasis from the energy of the city that is so remarkably close by. If you're looking for chintz, swagger and pretentious bellboys don't bother to stay here; if you want to spend your time in Barcelona with a huge grin on your face, it's just the place for you. My only complaint is that they don't have a shoe store in the lobby - it's at least a 50 metres away.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with good friends.”
Reviews.Author: Macabsyd
Reviews.Content: I have only the highest praise for Casa Camper. My husband and our friends Jim and Mary Jo stayed here March 27-30th and we were extremely impressed by the helpful staff--in finding restaurants, advising us on visiting sights, making sure we were comfortable, they even fetched coffee for us in the morning (remembering to prepare it as we like it). Fernanda, the desk clerk on days, even helped us get back the credit cards and traveler's checks pick-pocketed from us at the Picasso Museum gift shop! The thieves took out the cash and threw away the wallet and it was found by an Argentine woman who lived near the Museum. She contacted us through Facebook, but she spoke little English and we, little Spanish. Fernanda became our intermediary, and we got everything except $35 US dollars back! As for the hotel facilities: The roof top sitting area on the sixth floor provides a lovely view over the city. The first floor cafe where free snacks and sodas are available all day long--and where breakfast is served daily--became a favorite hangout for us when we needed a late afternoon pick-me-up! We also used the free wi-fi and first floor business center! I just can't say enough about this hotel, its' fabulous staff, and the neat set up of the rooms--with a separate living area across the hall so one person could stay up and watch TV from the hammock while the other slept undisturbed. I highly recommend the hotel for its cleanliness, comfort, staff and convenient location near Catalunya Square and Las Rambles. We will be back! By the way, the hotel is owned by the same people who make the amazingly stylish and comfortable Camper shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Choice”
Reviews.Author: Sabahanne
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in March while attending a conference. I loved everything about this hotel. The design is great, the staff are terrific, the dual room system is fantastic, especially if you are travelling with someone else. The best thing is the free food all day. The breakfasts are excellent and good food is available at any time for snacks or light meals. Security is very good, which is important since the hotel is so close to Las Ramblas. Just terrific all round.

Reviews.Title: “Is this IKEA in disguise?”
Reviews.Author: Malim27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is currently rated number 2 out of 555 Barcelona hotels in the Tripadvisor popularity ratings, so it must appeal to a large number of travellers – but not for me. Quirky, hip and modern are previous reviewers’ description of this place, which is about right. I would say the hotel plays homage and testimony to….IKEA. Cheap furnishings and lighting albeit modern. A 24 hour [free] service bar is a good idea – especially for those on a budget or large families – but the choice is limited, which I guess is only to be expected for the very reasonable rates this place charges. However for me, the whole concept – including the lounge area each bedroom has (a separate room adjacent to your bedroom) is poorly conceived IMHO. A prime example of this was whilst trying to use my personal lounge space to work, I had nowhere by the large desk to plug my laptop or blackberry in unless I used the powerpoints behind the sofa. Doh! Why the lounge, complete with hammock?!! However, the location is excellent, just off of the Ramblas with many places to drink, eat and visit close by. BTW, the staff are extremely friendly and accommodating. So again, whilst this may appeal to many, it’s just not for me.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel , ideally situated .”
Reviews.Author: lorraine046
Reviews.Content: The staff were very welcoming and could not have done more to make sure our stay was pleasurable . The breakfasts were excellent and freshly cooked .Ample snacks and soup were available as and when required . The accommodation was very comfortable with every need catered for and cleanliness is obviously very important to the hotel . An extraordinary vertical garden of aspidistras is unique and fascinating . We certainly hope to return .

Reviews.Title: “Casa Camper is a complete delight!”
Reviews.Author: Janet9988
Reviews.Content: What a great surprise -- to find a completely original hotel that is not overburdened by trendiness. There are so many unusual features -- the 24-hour kitchen where, in place of a mini-bar in the room, there are always sandwiches and soup and yogurt and other good things. The staff truly is exceptional -- there's a personal warmth one doesn't feel elsewhere. The location couldn't be better, at least for us. A narrow charming street that leads into the plaza where Richard Meier's contemporary art museum stands; an excellent bakery and cafe on the corner; interesting streets on all sides . . . we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A human experience and a reference hotel that others should aspire to”
Reviews.Author: sobakasu
Reviews.Content: The welcome was excellent. I arrived early and was given my room without asking for it. This was appreciated. The bedroom was spacious and attractive with ample storage space. The bed was super comfortable and the shower good. The concept of an individual separate leisure/work space across the corridor was excellent though I didn't use it much (did some ironing and spent a short moment on the balcony). The public spaces of the hotel are lovely and the concept of being able to grab a drink and a snack any time of day in the communal kitchen area is great. In short, I don't have a bad word for the hotel and I look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: glrlwr
Reviews.Content: 24-hour food bar was an excellent idea well implemented. Bedroom/lounge separation works well espceially if travelling with friends and occasional privacy is required. Well located 2 minutes from the transport hub of Plaza de Catalunya. Friendly and helpful staff. Pleasant design sense to the decor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kiwifamilyWellington
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper is a fabulous place to stay. By the time we had exited the taxi the staff had brought in our suitcases and were ready to check us in. We were shown around the hotel by an enthusiastic and friendly staff member, and made to feel very welcome. The hotel design is really cool - you get a bedroom with ensuite as well as a separate mini lounge with sofa, hammock, second TV and couch. Our room had a comfortable king sized bed, and the children had a twin room. The mini lounge looks out onto the street, while the bedroom looks out onto an internal vertical garden. Breakfast and 24 hour snack bar items are included in the price. The hotel staff provided recommendations on places to eat - all within ten minutes walk - and made bookings on our behalf - all three places had really good food and service, and were tolerant of our total lack of Catalan or Spanish. Menus were also in English. The hotel is just off La Rambla and five minutes from Placa de Catalunya, so close to shops, attractions, tourist information and public transport. The only negative thing is that the air conditioning in the room is a bit noisy. You can adjust and turn it off, but the room was somewhat overly warm even in winter. Best thing about Casa Camper is the warm, friendly and efficient service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully different hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Karen62Brisbane
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! Very modern stylish design. Terrific location near La Rambla. The rooms has a seperate lounge area with a hammock, lounge and TV. The bathroom looks over a unique hanging garden. The 24 hour snack bar was well stocked with healthy and delicious food and drinks. Such a nice touch to be able to come downstairs and grab a snack or drink. My only very small complaint would be that the rooms are a little dark and could benefit from a bit more strategically placed lighting. But overall one of the best hotels I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Very unique, great location”
Reviews.Author: marumaruni
Reviews.Content: When I first knew about this hotel I wasn't sure if I'd be confortable with this hotel having two rooms (a bedroom and a living room) across the hall way, but when I got there it comepetely made sense. It worked out great if I was travelling with a companion. The room was quiet and comfortable. The 24-hour food & drink lounge was convienient as well. The lounge served hot breakfast (very good) and everyone at the hotel was always nice as well. Also, the hotel is close to most places and the metro and bus stations. The location was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service , very good choice”
Reviews.Author: DanielJDBK
Reviews.Content: My family and me enjoy a lot our stay in Casa Camper. The rooms are OK, and the service is outstanding, well located and with a special advantage, free food available at anytime ,which , when you are a father of a couple of teens makes a difference. A confortable hotel were you fell at home. Very good choice slightly expensive in specific datas.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but with one big flaw”
Reviews.Author: maninthemoon
Reviews.Content: I'm always on the look out for something a little bit different but the concept of splitting the room in two across the hallway just doesn't work. Whilst funky, the rooms are dark and a little depressing. Working in them is out of the question. The late night snack buffet was excellent and breakfast was good. The location is great. The staff are very friendly. The wifi is free and it worked well. But it is flawed.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Romantic Hotel, with Excellent Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: nzkiwi78
Reviews.Content: From the moment we made the booking we were reassured, when I rang to check if the online booking was complete I was informed that Casa Camper were looking forward to having us stay. On arrival we were greeted by our room assistant Alejandro who was very obliging and explained the layout of the entire hotel and our room explaining the ethos and concept behind Casa Camper Hotels. We were told nothing would be a problem. Our room was lovely massive bed with a 32" LCD TV mounted on the wall which had english speaking channels. A safe and GORGEOUS Rain shower, with Bidet which my husband raved about..LOL...reckons he has never felt so clean (I will take his word for it!!)! The shampoo and conditioner were in generous pump bottles so I found this brilliant having long hair I find I need a little bit more than the standard tube you get in most hotels. There was lovely hand cream by the wash basin, and wonderful towelling robes for after your shower! The big bath sheets were great!!...As if that was not enough every room comes with a separate lounge that again has a 32" LCD TV a sofa and a hammock Special mention has also to be given to the 24 hour snack room which had a wide selection of salads, sandwiches, desserts, soups, bread, coffee, tea and soft drinks, you could help yourself to as much as you wished no one looked at you sideways, it is covered in every room price, Breakfast consisted of the usual fresh pastries cereal etc and in addition to this the chef was behind the counter eagerly offering to cook omelettes, eggs any way you wanted, sausage, bacon, pancakes any hot breakfast dish you could almost think of, my husband is a chef and he was amazed at the enthusiasm of the breakfast chef at such an early hour (6am), On the day we left the reception staff informed us that we were leaving too early to get breakfast (we left at 530am) however she bought us out pastries, and made us fresh coffee herself. We were given our room key as a souvenir of our stay and needless to say we were treated like royalty and like the staff were genuinely happy to have us stay there, we were even greeted in the morning by the cleaning staff who were smiling away. We were so sad to leave our relaxing stay but we are definately going back to Casa Camper would highly recommend this hotel it is right at the start of La Ramblas is very central to everything. The staff are very obliging and willing to offer advice on lovely places to eat, and things to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way!”
Reviews.Author: jakeandben
Reviews.Content: My husband, 20-year-old son and I spent three nights at the Casa Camper in Barcelona and could not be more pleased. The set up of the rooms was perfect - my husband and I had a room with a king-sized bed and our son had his own room across the hall with a sofa bed, hammock and balcony. The staff, particularly Anja, were amazing - always welcoming, interested in how we were doing and always happy to make suggestions about sightseeing and restaurants. They made reservations for us, called cabs, and gave us maps and detailed instructions on how to find places we wanted to see. Having food and drinks available at all hours was a real bonus, particularly for our always hungry son! Free high-speed internet was an added attraction. The location is great - far enough away from Las Ramblas to ensure a quiet sleep but close enough to be in the middle of things within minutes. The rooms are not opulent, but the simple and efficient layout and environmentally friendly thoughtfulness made this hotel one we would be delighted to visit again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: poha8990
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel for those who seek great service and quality without opulence in the classic sense - big furnitures and a lot of textile, crystal etc. As it says, it is minimalistic with a healthy approach to food and interior design. We did not see too much of other guests, probably due to the limited number of rooms. The staff speak very good english and are eager to assist you in any way. We let them book tables for us at a restaurant and a nightclub. It seems their recommendations must be questioned; the suggested restaurant was not impressive and I overheard two American women being dissatisfied with the recommended nightclub. The buffet is great and was much used by us; it replaced a lunch out at one time. It was also great when returning from the night life in the early morning or if you slept over the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PoojaKshetrapal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and its an exceptional hotel. The staff is excellent and very friendly .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Astrid23
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 3-night stay at Casa Camper. This is the best city hotel I have stayed in. They've got it just right - 5-star customer service but not in an obtrusive way. All the facilities you could want to make you feel at home. Not stuffy, relaxed, friendly. You are invited to make yourself feel at home. Everything works, the place is super clean and the friendly crew is always to hand to help with any requests. Great breakfast buffet and the drinks and snacks which are available throughout the day are a real bonus as sometimes you just want to sit quietly with a cup of coffee. I will definitely go back there on my next trip. We sayed in a suite and appreciated the extra space it gave us. Lovely bath products and fabulous towels. I can't praise the place enough. Ah yes, and the location is fabulous. Central but away from the horrible main drag. Lots of interesting side streets with great little shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and perfect”
Reviews.Author: NMOSHIRI
Reviews.Content: You have to stay here, it is a great find, fantastic location, and great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: DaniellaLondon
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 2 night stay at Casa Camper and had a fantastic time. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful without being intrusive. The rooms (bedroom and lounge area) were clean and bright - great shower and very comfortable bed. The 24 hour snack bar is great too. The hotel has a great location and is very accessible. All in all, a really great find - book it!!

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel when traveling with our kids”
Reviews.Author: Dana13
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice with our kids (6 and under) and it's the best place for a family stay in Barcelona (or anywhere!) The suite rooms can accomodate the kids in the living area so you don't have to get a second room and they love the hammock in the room; it's good for hours of swinging fun. The lounge/snack area in the lobby is ideal for a little bite between meals and the kids love the chocolate milk typical for Barcelona :-) The staff is great with kids (they learn their names and are very patient, etc.) They will also organize babysitters upon request which is useful for visiting Dos Pallilos in the hotel. The great thing is that the hotel is still really cool and hip so its not Disneyworld :-). Moreover, the location is so central that you can walk everywhere and the metro is also a 3 min walk for further destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: JimmyMac10
Reviews.Content: I was concerned having read some of the reviews but shouldn't have been - stayed only 2 nights on a business trip but throught the service was very good. Breakfast was good and large!

Reviews.Title: “Could not be improved upon.”
Reviews.Author: blackster
Reviews.Content: Had heard from friends that this was a good place to stay to really experience Barcelona. They were correct. The location near to Las Ramblas but not too near was just perfect for us. I enjoy staying in lively parts of towns and this area was great lots of cafes, galleries and retro clothes shops. The staff were exceptionally helpful and pleasant giving us the steer on a couple of excellent places to eat and even got us excellent tickets for the Barcelona/Valencia match (the day before the match). Also their restaurant, hidden next door in the back of the tapas bar was superb. We had a 13 course Japanese/catalan meal from El Bulli's ex Chef de Cuisine, fantastic. If however you are looking for a traditional 5 star hotel, try elsewhere, there are quite a few hotels in Barcelona that fit that description.

Reviews.Title: “User-friendly Design (and staff)”
Reviews.Author: MCMember
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper is an original design hotel, supported by a strong brand. It promotes a wholistic approach to well-being through a well-balanced mix of user-friendliness and efficiency. The concept is advertised throughout the hotel until the most private areas of your room: a sign posted onto the lift advises you to take the stairs, but only going down on your way to the lobby; further signs advertise healthy leaving and a positive attitude. Some of the slogans may have an irritating ‘Diesel’ feeling, and you do not have to buy into them all. However, I was impressed (and I do not consider myself easy to please) by the staff attitude, the perfect balance between genuine interest and informality, miles away from the fake smiles of some top hotels. Accommodation comprises a traditional room, with an additional lounge across the corridor, both with their own flat screen TV. This may sound unusual and of course imposes a certain ‘dress code’ when moving from one area to the other but proves to be quite a nice idea if you have to work – and there is free wireless throughout, with sufficient bandwidth. There is no minibar (nor fridge) but the lounge includes a free 24 hours buffet with (non-alcoholic) drinks and sandwiches. There is probably room for improvement there, especially on the sandwich side. The hotel location is ideal, few steps from the MACBA and 3 minutes walk to the underground (on Plaza de Catalunya). The hotel street (Elisabets) is just remote enough from the Ramblas to protect guests from the flow of tourists.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: City of San Marino, San Marino
Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mugwump888
Reviews.Content: A great hotel organized with some innovative concepts: 24/7 access to free non-alcoholic drinks and snacks (including breakfast) and 2 separate spaces per room (bedroom and day room, separated by the hallway). Free Internet. Expensive but fully recommended. On the other hand, we recommend staying away from the restaurant in the same house (Japanese/Asian fusion cuisine). It struck as as overpriced, substituting effect for freshness of ingredients and taste.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cmonestero
Reviews.Content: Don't miss Casa Camper! Stayed at this hotel for four nights and it was worth every penny. The prices are a bit on the high side, but the rooms are very spacious and the service is top notch. In addition to your room, you also get a "mini-lounge" that is an entirely separate room across the hall with a hammock, couch, and another flat-screen TV. It was awesome! Breakfast is included and they have a nice selection of fresh breads and pastries, meats, cereal and fruit. There is also a window where you can request hot breakfast made to order- eggs, bacon and the like. After breakfast, it switches over to lunch/snack type food like sandwiches, salads, soup and chips. This is nice for a snack, but don't count on it for a meal. There is also an excellent selection of bottled water, sodas and juices available all the time. The location is great, very close to the Plaza Catalunya, that is a major stop for the sightseeing buses and also has a subway stop. We were able to walk to Casa Batllo and La Pedrera easily.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Maijju
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, perfect staff, good facilities, lovely atmosphere. I will definetely stay there next time I visit BCN as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service. Great for kids!”
Reviews.Author: chokotoff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in one of the "suites" with our 2 year old son for 4 nights. Fantastic hotel-- really perfect for kids. The 24 hour "snack bar" is a lot more than snacks. There were a couple of nights it became our son's dinner while we waited for a more "Spanish" dinner hour (lots of fruits, veggies, salads, sandwiches). The rooms are very clean, very utilitarian (in a good way) and very well insulated-- didn't hear anything from any of the other occupied rooms. Highly recommend the suite option for those with younger kids-- we weren't comfortable leaving our 2 year old in a room by himself across the hallway. The staff is what really makes this place excel-- their service level compares to the Four Seasons (friendly and helpful but not obsequious).

Reviews.Title: “An astonishing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: likecity
Reviews.Content: Stayed 06-10 April.Can only replicate what every person additional is saying about this truly incredible hotel. Decor, position and breakfasts excellent.The satff are whole heartedly beautiful and pledged to the ethos.I unwittingly left my iPod in our room on check-out but when we assembled our luggage it was presented back. I understand 2 persons who have finished alike in English Hotels and not ever glimpsed their MP3 players again! An astonishing Hotel that excellent complements an astonishing city.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful couples hotel”
Reviews.Author: MEU15
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent two night stay at the Casa Camper Hotel. The staff are helpful and friendly. There is a great breakfast in the morning and complimentary food and beverages are available throughout the day and evening. The terrace on the top floor is great for watching the sun go down and relaxing after a day of sightseeing. Overall, an excellent experience. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “as others have said, it's like an oasis”
Reviews.Author: youarenumber6
Reviews.Content: This was my favorite hotel on a 2 week European vacation. I spent 2 nights here. The staff were incredibly helpful and the rooms are so comfortable I could easily have spent 2 weeks there. The avant-garde ideas often prove to be highly useful, like the giant map of Barcelona in the lobby...good for sussing out the day's activities with staff. The lobby's 24h buffet is an absolutely brilliant idea and will hopefully find its way into other establishments. The room also had excellent climate control. Minor con: I'd like a little less plumbing noise but compared to other hotel noise issues I encountered it was nothing to worry about. It wouldn't be loud enough to wake the typical sleeper. The hotel appeared to have poured concrete floors which eliminates the worse types of hotel noise. (feet or bed sounds above you!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service, great amenities, hip hotel..stay no where else!”
Reviews.Author: fennster
Reviews.Content: The service and the amenities were second to none at Casa Camper. First the amenities: in an area of the world where a coke costs 3-4 Euro (about $5 US), it was amazing to come back each afternoon, evening or late at night and be able to grab whatever drink or snack you could imagine from the Casa Camper kitchen...coffee, tea, espresso, soda, bottled water, juice, fruit, nuts, salad, bread, cheese, omelets, sandwiches all at your finger tips. The staff at the front desk were incredible. They were always super friendly, informative, and gave some great dinner recommendations. This location could not be beat. Located in the Raval neighborhood (some parts of El Raval are shady, but not in the area near the hotel), one and a half blocks off Las Ramblas and two blocks from Catalunya Placa. Close to all the major sites, but just far enough away to prevent you from hearing all the noise that accompanies them. The standard rooms were big enough for two of us to adequately spread out. The bathroom and the view into the courtyard kept things quiet, but also let your room get a lot of light. After a long day of walking, my wife could not wait to plop herself in the hammock in the room across the hall that accompanies each bedroom. Prior to booking the Casa Camper we were also considering the staying at the 1898....after going to the 1898, seeing its location (right on Las Ramblas, very noisy) and getting a little taste of how inattentive their staff can be, we knew we made the right choice with the CC.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Camper ...a delightful oasis”
Reviews.Author: dpnivala
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Casa Camper as first time visitor to Barcelona. It is centrally located and easy walking to see the city. The staff was outstanding. Multilingual, gracious, courteous, friendly, and made you feel most welcome. They helped problem solve questions and requests. Having drinks a nd snacks available is a great idea as you are often fatigued after several hours of sightseeing. The outdoor terrace overlooking the city is relaxing. The rooms are utilitarian yet zen like in quality.Would recommend highly to all age visitors.

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: mayyouch
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at Casa Camper and I can't say enough how great our stay was. From the moment we arrived the staff were absolutely terrific, offering help, recommendations and top quality services throughout our stay. The food lounge is a wonderful idea and was a great escape from the busy streets outside, and our room (and mini lounge) were just perfect in terms of equipment and cleanliness. We were traveling with our two year old daughter and the staff were ever so kind to her (and us!), special thanks to the lovely Mimi! If we return to Barcelona we will definitely stay there again, it's just too good to search for somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: iowacyclenut
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband, two children (10 and 12) and mother and all of us enjoyed this hotel. The suites are great with one long extended room, separated by sliding doors into a sitting area, bedroom and bath. Lots of natural light and great functional furniture. My children enjoyed the "lounge area" that came with the regular rooms. This is a sitting area, across the hall from the regular room, with a couch, hammock and TV. Excellent, hot breakfast included. Snacks and light meals available free anytime (great for those jet-lag hours). Good location for walking to the sites. Very helpful staff. This is a unique, boutique hotel that offers comfort and function instead of glam. If you tell your taxi driver that it is one block from the Museum of Contemporary Art, that will be helpful. Also have a written address to hand to them since we did not encounter any taxi drivers that spoke English. Will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “luxury without pretention”
Reviews.Author: cumbrianlass_10
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Free buffet and free cold drinks are a great idea. The hotel staff provided room service breakfast, cava and birthday cake for my husband for very little cash. Location is great, just off La Rambla and close to the excellent Metro. Rooms all face a garden so are incredibly quiet and an external shutter blind means that they are really dark too. Would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, love it”
Reviews.Author: mstack088
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, love the free buffet throughout the day. The staff were really friendly. Its a real funky hotel in a great location. I wouldnt stay anywhere else if going to Barcelona, except maybe the new W hotel which looks great. Barcelona is by far the best city in Europe,

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room, location, and service.”
Reviews.Author: mikecbell82
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper might be one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed in. It is luxury, but it is down to earth. The rooms are a good size, and you get 2 of them: 1 bedroom that faces the center of the hotel, which is a soothing tree garden (no outside noise!!) and a second room for relaxing with a view of the outside. The service was some the best I have ever experienced. Each member of the staff was polite, personable, and spoke English. Instead of a mini bar in each room, they offer complimentary food to each guest from a kitchen in the main lobby. Everything from drinks (alcoholic included, but you had to pay for them), sandwiches, salads, soup, to fresh breads with cheeses and meats, to omelets made to order. By the way, the food all comes from the local market, so it's all fresh. The location is great. It is on a small road just off La Rambla, which defeats much of the vehicle traffic, and is a short walk to a metro station (maybe a 5 minute walk). You can also escape to the roof garden, which has a fantastic view of the city. The price is up there, but worth every penny and then some.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, superb service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SonjaWinston
Reviews.Content: My husband, our daughter, and I stayed three nights in two Camper King rooms, and we loved everything about the hotel. The location is perfect for exploring Barcelona; it is within walking distance of just about everything, yet just removed from the noisy Las Ramblas area. The design of the hotel in general, and of the separate sleeping and lounge areas in particular, is brilliant. During the day, the sleeping room can be made nearly dark as night for jet-lagged travelers or bright with a private view of the hanging garden. The separate lounge across the hall enables one person to check email, make phone calls, and watch TV without disturbing the other person. The complimentary breakfast buffet was excellent, and the 24-hour snack area offered a nice selection of fresh, healthy food and drink. The staff is among the friendliest and most helpful we have ever encountered in a hotel. For example, they emailed us prior to our arrival offering suggestions for things to do during our stay and places to eat. They made restaurant reservations for us, and then they proactively confirmed reservations for us each morning of our stay. They provided maps, and patiently explained how to get to the places we wanted to go. Whenever we returned to the hotel, they greeted us warmly by name. We highly recommend Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE”
Reviews.Author: MarcoTT
Reviews.Content: A great hotel that knows how to combine unfussy but breathtaking luxury with effortless and friendly service in an unbeatable location at the heart of Barcelona. We LOVED our stay and only wished there had been space for us to extend our stay. We especially loved the sitting room with the divine hammock and gorgeous views of el Raval district. Breaklfast and 24h snackbar superb !!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FatOldUglyGuy
Reviews.Content: The Casa Camper is in a fab location, the staff where all really friendly. The boutique style is just that bit different that makes it really stand out. We loved the all day buffet and the best of all was the rooms. Beautifully designed, attention to detail, quirky. No nonsense but really nice. I liked sitting up on the toop floor balcony with coffee, beer or breakfast. I was very quiet. The only warning would be make a note of the street name that leads to the hotel because at 4am after lots of drinks it can take a long long time to find the place :)

Reviews.Title: “The place to be”
Reviews.Author: davin
Reviews.Content: Great location and really helpful staff.Gave us great restaurants and metro info.Loved the 24 hour snacks and drinks and the rooftop patio makes a nice place to go after touring all day.The room with the hammock is unusual but actually quite nice.Don't waste your time looking for better.cheaper deals stay here.Stayed for 6 nights in mid May.Free internet a big bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, modern boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: BeachBound68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Camper for three nights in June. The hotel decor is very minimal and unique which I happen to like very much. The young staff were all very friendly and helpful and you truly felt like they wanted to help you and make sure you enjoyed your stay. The room was a good size for a European hotel. The shower was amazing but it does not have a door so might be awkward if traveling with someone who is not a partner/spouse. Lovely bath amenities (we even purchased the shower gel we liked it so much). The room was very quiet, we heard no outside noise. Comfy beds and nice linens. The free breakfast was great, there was a nice selection of cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, breads and pastries plus you could get hot dishes cooked to order such as eggs any way, pancakes, and bacon. The location is very good with lots of little shops, bars, cafes close by and walking distance to the rest of the "old city".

Reviews.Title: “dorm chic”
Reviews.Author: ptbooth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Casa Camper for 5 nights in early June for a conference. The location is convenient, as it's just a 5 min walk to the P. Catalunya metro stop and just off the top of La Rambla. It's on a narrow street (a glorified alley) that you may find hard to believe cabs can navigate (in fact mine wasn't really sure where it was). I'm a bit slow, but I evenutally figured out this is part of the Camper shoe fashion empire. I can only describe the place as ultra chic dormitory. The lobby is basically a clean modern cafeteria seating area. The rooms are very modern, but with the open shelving/closet area and the stone/tile floors, it really does feel like a dormitory (not that there's anything wrong with that). The little living room with hammock area across the hall is also quirky. The staff were very nice and helpful with dinner reservations, and I love the 24-hr snack area. Free WiFi also a plus. The rates are reasonable also, which is a plus. I think the only down side is that if you want more traditional hotel features (plush lobby, carpeted bedroom with sitting area), this may not be the place for you (e.g. friends staying at the Hotel 1898 nearby had much more luxurious accomodations). But for a clean, hip, modern, friendly place to stay at a reasonable price, this was a good pick.

Reviews.Title: “Group of 10 agrees-Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Service, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: WrldtrvlrThree
Reviews.Content: Our group of 10 ranged from 2-77 years old and everyone loved the hotel. The front desk service is fantastic with great people who can answer any questions about restaurants, tours, etc... The rooms were spacious and very clean. The minimalist approach is still comfortable and practical. We all had suites and enjoyed the extra space. Every night after dinner, we all headed to the sixth floor to hang out on the rooftop deck and enjoy the city lights. The 24 hour food and drinks come in handy, something to consider when looking at the hotel's rate. Overall, fantastic stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Clean, Friendly & Quiet Hotel in the middle of the City”
Reviews.Author: Applause_10
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper Barcelona is a wonderful small modern hotel just off Las Ramblas near Place de Catalunya. It has 25 very clean and modern rooms. The Staff are so helpful and friendly it was a pleasure staying there. The bedroom and modern bathroom with wonderful rain shower are on one side of the corridor, then surprise - you have a sitting room with a little stone balcony, sofa (bed sofa), tv and a hamock to have your siesta in. So peaceful and quiet. The location is great, right in the middle of everything you want to see and within walking distance of anything you need. Restaurants, tapas bars, sights etc. There is a wonderful breakfast in the morning - everything you could think of. The kitchen will make you any kind of eggs, bacon, sausage etc. There is also 24hr. snacks of sandwiches, juice, deserts, yoghurts, fresh prepared fruit, soup, cookies. You could not ask for more. There is nothing negative to say about Casa Camper - it was very secure too. Room safe, and a beautiful "Wall Garden" looking out from the bathroom. Quite exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel in great location with the friendliest staff ever”
Reviews.Author: RuthieHM
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed in a modern, boutique style hotel before and so were a bit apprehensive but this was allayed as soon as we arrived and were met by the friendliest, most genuine staff we had ever come across. The room decor and facilities were excellent - there were complimentary slippers, bath robes and decent sized, good quality toilettries including body lotion which is always a nice touch for the girlies. The hotel provided an excellent 24/7 buffet instead of a mini bar in the room which was always well stocked and a really great idea when you've come in after a day's exhausting sightseeing and are too tired to go out again to find somewhere nice to eat. The extra lounge room was also an unexpected and fabulous addition to the accomodation with the hammock and balcony overlooking the street. Location was really central yet set back from the main La Ramblas so quiet at the same time. Have already recommended it to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Brilant hotel”
Reviews.Author: contented_wanderers
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Barcelona, the first time we stayed at the Hotel 1898 which is also superb, but out of the two, we honestly prefer the Casa Camper. This hotel has an ultra modern and stylish interior with an almost Swedish feel. We had booked one of the suites which was a nice size with it's own seperate living space. All the bedrooms look into a private courtyard, so you always got a good night sleep. The staff were very friendly and helpful and it's location just off La Rambla was ideal. The 24 hour free buffet is a brilliant idea and very handy when all you want is a quick snack or drink. People with more traditional preferences may find this hotel too modern at first glance, but should really give it a go as it is comfy and welcoming and hammock sleeping isn't compulsory! But beware of taxi drivers who rip you off!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Olivia81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Casa Camper for four days on a business trip to Barcelona. Location is perfect, I got to see some sights and soak up the Barcelona atmosphere, even though I was there on business. The rooms require a bit of getting used to, especially if you compare the hotel to Hyatt or Intercontinental, but I really liked the concepts of 2 rooms, and the minimalist style towards the end of my stay. The 24 hour buffet is perfect for light meals. Breaktfast fantastic! Rooftop terrace great for a drink in the evening. Broadband coverage was excellent throughout the hotel. Other reviews comment that the hotel is expensive, but with the breakfast included in the rate, the buffet with light meals and, FREE and excellent broadband coverage, there are no hidden costs, so all in all, it's actually quite cheap! On the downside, there is no gym, but it is very close to the beach, so a morning run is well within reach! Would absolutely stay there again, both for business and leisure!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the 3rd time”
Reviews.Author: orionyh
Reviews.Content: Returned to Casa Camper for the third time for 5 nights. This is a fun hotel - very modern, great staff, in the raval neighborhood of Barcelona just off La Rambla. They have food available for snacks 24 hours a day which is great if you are just back from the beach or signtseeing and want to have a snack and/or rehydrate. They have the best showers of any hotel that I have ever stayed in, with the showerhead large and overhead. You can walk just about anywhere from here if you are a bit adventurous, and it is also very close to the metro at Plaza Cataluna and the Renfe train station at Passeig de Gracia. The only issue is street noise but the placement of the bedrooms in each suite is such that soundproofing is not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “You're Really Gonna Like This Place”
Reviews.Author: LivnBtr
Reviews.Content: Second stay in this wonderful hotel, located in a quiet neighborhood, just a couple of blocks from the Rambla and the central (where everything starts or finishes) Place de la Cantaloyna. Breakfasts are delicious, the rooms very comfortable and user friendly (though I wish the extra room had a coffee table or extra end table since we ate and drank in their some), the WIFI worked perfectly, and the 24/7 canteen is almost priceless. Take the recommendation to go to Pla for dinner, and the local place Elisabets was great for local food at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific find - has it all - location, staff, cleanliness, breakfast”
Reviews.Author: dannyboy2_10
Reviews.Content: We thought this trendy modern hotel was terrific. Incredibly friendly and helpful young staff. Terrific included breakfasts. Best possible location. Clean room and bath, with well-planned shelving much more useful than bureaus. We took a junior suite which was worth the modest price difference. All in all, we enjoyed this hotel as much as any on our recent European trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: drbryguy
Reviews.Content: 2 Adults and 2 young children (ages 5 and 1.5) stayed one night after overseas plane trip here. Arrived during very busy holiday (St. George's day) about 10 am. All staff was friendly and spoke English well, room on second floor was ready on arrival, a Bell-man acted as a guide and went around showing us were things were. Crib for youngest was available in room on arrival. Nice food for snacking was available all day, and made to order breakfasts that were terrific the next morning. Place was quiet. Didn't see a single smoker in entire place. Very helpful staff that gave us directions on where to go and how to get to the Subway system. We had a main room with a separate room across the main hall that was like a sitting room but had a sleeper bed, also had a hammock in it that our children loved (but did involve the entire length of room and was over tile so I didn't allow playing with it without supervision). Lots of activity that could be heard from this separate room outside if window/door opened, but this was the only noise heard from outside the place. Main room had nice bathroom with shower that overlooks a wall that had planted trees in pots in them and this was a nice touch. Our 5 year old loved the shower that had 3 different water sources and you could 2 of them at the same time (Wand, Bidet and overhead sunflower). Completely private. We only booked this place a couple of weeks before we went, and e-mailed them questions about the crib and families of four staying there before we booked; they immediately answered our emails within minutes in English. Moderately more expensive than nearby locations but we thought this was well worth it. We stayed here the night before a Disney Cruise and ran into other families doing the same thing. We loved this place and would plan to stay here on a future trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with others - it's different!!”
Reviews.Author: patnlcc
Reviews.Content: No point in me repeating what has already been said. Quirky and different. Enjoyed it but would look for a more conventional hotel next time. Thought it expensive for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, contemporary, chilled, lux minimalism in fab location”
Reviews.Author: Herts02
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. Because it is so different from anything else, you don't really compare. The foyer/reception area is reminiscent of an industrial warehouse area but very cool, spacious and chilled. Apple computer available for use any time. Friendly helpful staff. Absolute bonus is fact that snacks are available free! 24/7 - drinks, sandwiches, salads, muffins, tea and coffee etc. Rooms feel spacious. Fairly minimalistic, but the details are quality - large, comfortable bed with high quality bed linen and towels. Glorious shower. Loved the vertical plant wall and natural daylight without need for curtains as rooms not overlooked. Across corridor we had our own sitting room with hammock. Absolutely brilliant. Location is fantastic - off La Ramblas. Recommend Bar Loco for tapas/meals on adjacent lane. Note: we stayed while Icelandic volcano erupting, so because no-one could get home on the 3rd night we were moved to a suite - would not recommend this option as didn't seem to get any more for money. In fact I preferred the other room as it had separate sitting room and view of vertical plant wall.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings . . .”
Reviews.Author: TipperaryStan
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent two nights in a "suite" here in March. We left with mixed views. On the one hand, the staff are very friendly and eager to please. On the other hand, and as noted elsewhere, the hotel has certain aesthetic issues i.e. it is quite dark, gothic even. Not surprising given that it is located in a narrow sidestreet off Las Ramblas. For some reason I was faintly excited at the thought of the free 24 hour buffet. The food, however, on offer in canteen style fridges did not look especially appetising although I did bump into a guy early on Sunday morning who had clearly been out for most of the night and was happy to eat anything and everything on offer. Breakfast was nice. As for the suite, well it was . . . quite dark. Querky, yes, decent bathroom and comfortable bed, yes, hammock, er . . . yes, but still not altogether a satisfying or overly comfortable experience. Still, if you are after a somewhat avant garde and well located hotel in the centre of Barcelona it ticks all the boxes; I probably would stay there again although not for long. It is pricey and . . . quite dark.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: christosgrGreece
Reviews.Content: I stay for seven nights.The stuff is very friendly.The hotel interior is a little bit strange.The room and the bath was very big,i stay at suite.The location is very good almost 200 meters from the center.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but dark and depressing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tatiana10
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by a business colleague who spent little time at the hotel. It all looks funky from the outside but there is no light inside and the rooms are minute. I don't think I have ever stayed in such a small hotel room for over 200 euros a night. There was nowhere to unpack, no table, no chair and absolutely appalling light so we could see nothing. The hammock you see in the photo is across the corridor in a soulless box of a room which you would not want to spend any time in. If it is a beautiful day outside I cannot think of a more depressing hotel to stay in as even if you craned you neck you could not see the blue sky. We were also woken by cleaners shouting in the room next door at 8am. Be warned the walls are very thin. The location is good but that is about all I can recommend.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gra_ob
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at Casa Camper in Feb '10 and loved it. The only down side was not having longer to appreciate our second room with the hammock etc! We arrived quite late on the Friday night, no problem, we were shown around and brought to our lovely room. We even grabbed some snacks and drinks from the free food area. The hotel is quite comtemporary so it might not be for everyone but we loved it. Plenty of space, big comfortable bed and fantastic shower. Reception staff were really nice. Breakfast was great too. There is also free use of the internet for residents, useful for checking flights. We left late on Sunday night and there was no problem leaving our bags at Casa Camper and everything was secure and looked after. Location is supberb, only 2 minutes to Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya and really easy to find. You could spend a little less and stay elsewhere but I think if you can, splash out the extra and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Baixas
Reviews.Content: Location: Perfect. Near La Rambla, Placa Catalunya, El Corte Ingles department store, metro station, and many buses. 10 minutes by bus to the beach, 10 minute walk to Barri Gotic and El Born. Service: Excellent. All the receptionists are very helpful and very nice. They made restaurant reservations for me, internet searches and phone calls to get information. All you have to do is ask and they are happy to help. Breakfast: Excellent with many choices: cereal, muffins, cheese, fruit, and fresh orange juice. You can also have eggs or pancakes. Food: Available all day long. There’s soup, sandwiches, juice, yogurt, bread and cheese. Room: Suite is very quiet and clean. I slept very well. There are two TVs and a hammock. I would have liked more closet space but that’s just nitpicking.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Julia R
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just wonderful, very different from your ordinary hotel. Firs of all, the staff is wonderful: from answering emails before the arrival to being very attentive and helpful during your stay. Second of all, the rooms are modern, well designed and make it fun to be there (the kid absolutely loved the hammock). The location is great too: close to bus turistic, Rambla, on a quiet street. The breakfast was very nicely done with your personal order of eggs, omelet or pancakes delivered to you table. The 24/7 buffet is quite convenient and very decent: there is always one kind of a hot soup, a choice of sandwiches, salads, sweets and fruit, as well as drinks, coffee and tee. If you think about going to Barcelona, try to stay here, it'll make your experience so much better!

Reviews.Title: “in love with barcelona”
Reviews.Author: troymonster
Reviews.Content: Casa camper served me as a perfect context for my stay in Barcelona..it was a perfect destination, in the center of the cultural artistic n touristic attractions. the staff is exceptional, very friendly helpful and polite. The design is comfortable clean and a view on the city is beautiful i recommand it for solo travelers for couples families design conscious n for the rest of the people who are looking for a home in barca..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Oceans14
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in Casa Camper in December and loved it. I had seen the rooms on a previous occasion, and did not really fancy the separate bedroom/living room thing, so instead I booked a suite for apprx EUR 20,- extra. It worked perfect. The breakfast is great and the service is excellent! I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: galway75
Reviews.Content: Great location, just off La Ramblas. Really trendy hotel, love the free buffet. Rooms cool and the hammock is great. Rooms are a little expensive however. Staff all very nice

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Cath999
Reviews.Content: This is a really unusual, stylish hotel in a very central location. Staff extremely helpful and friendly. The 24 hour snacks are great - I was pleasantly surprised by how good the food was, and took full advantage of it! Rooms are well-equipped - minimalist in style, but comfortable with ample storage. . Good shower and nice toiletries. Free wi-fi is a nice touch too. No, it's not a "traditional" hotel - if that's what you want, go somewhere else. But it is a lovely relaxed place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: grover_tx
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Casa Camper. The location is great (we were able to walk to all of our sightseeing destinations), the staff is incredibly helpful and friendly and the 24-hour snacks and drinks are a great idea. Also, the staff's restaurant recommendations were spot on. Breakfast - included with the room - was very good. Yes, the hotel is somewhat minimalist, but the bed was comfortable and the hammock was a nice touch. My only complaint was ventilation-related. We were in a suite, which has a bedroom between a bathroom and a sitting room, separated by sliding doors. The first night we closed the doors and tried to use the air con, as it was not too cold outside. We realized that the air con must not be on this time of year. The rest of our stay we opened the window in the sitting room a bit and kept the sliding door open a bit - it brought in plenty of cool air and then we were fine. That really was our only issue - everything else was great. Overall, a great stay and we will definitely stay at this hotel the next time we are in Barcelona. We could not have been happier with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: mbolcere
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently and I cannot say enough about Casa Camper. I had never been to Barcelona and I stayed at Casa Camper for Merce'. They were so helpful and made certain that I hit all of the best events, and sights. They actually helped map out an itinerary. The hardest part was for the taxi driver to find it from the airport. Rooms: The room design is modern yet not the sterile design that you sometimes get. Really liveable environment: great shower and the full window window into the garden interior gives you breathing space for the bathroom, and yet private as you look out on an old brick wall across the courtyard. Mini-Sala: So you also get a mini sala with a hammock, and a small balcony that lets you look down the small street at the foot traffic in Barcelona. Location: Could not be better. Again, perfect. Food: All included. So if you need a small bite to make it to the late Spanish dinners, you can grab a small sandwich. Breakfast provided with nice omelets cooked to your specification. Staff: Just wonderful. Had the best time. And traveling by yourself, it can be a bit solitary, but the front desk women are very cheerful and always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Surely the coolest and most quirky hotel in Barca”
Reviews.Author: ros07England
Reviews.Content: Ok picture this. Its November in England and we've had incessant rain for days on end. We leave Manchester Airport on a miserable Friday morning amidst freezing, gale force winds and torrential rain. Several hours later we sit in t-shirts by the marina in Barcelona in glorious sunshine sipping ice cold beer. What a great city this is....... And what better place to stay than casa camper? Surely the coolest and most quirky hotel in Barca. First off we booked our transfer in via the hotel - much more reasonably priced than some of the usual websites and very reliable. Arriving at the hotel, we were a liitle concerned it might be too cool for its own good but a great start as we were greeted by very friendly staff who couldn't do enough especially the guy with the plaster who gave us the tour and took us to our room. We had booked a suite - worth it for the extra £20 or so per night. You have all your rooms in one (rather than being split by the corridor) so a decent sized living room with hammock (loved it!), table and chairs and balcony overlooking carre Elisabets, a minimalist but very comfortable bedroom and well-equipped bathroom looking out onto the lighwell. Location wise its perfect - steps from La Ramblas, MACBA and Playa Catalunya and close to all the shops as well as the harbour and marina. We did explore a little further into the El Raval district - not the best in the city - certainly not very salubrious! However, you are safe as houses in casa camper - you cannot get into the hotel without your key pass. But as many others have commented the best part about this hotel is the food. When we booked we didn't think we would use the 24 hour buffet as we love to eat out - how wrong we we were. Fresh sandwiches, fruit, bread, soup and the most delightful coffee and crisps (the best) made our stay - especially when we took them to the roof terrace overlooking the city. Excellent breakfast with friendly chef who summons up wonderfully light scrambled eggs and divine bacon. Moans - minor ones include having to go to reception every time you want a beer and not being able to make a coffee in the morning in the room. But our major moan relates to the cost of late check out - we stayed until 4pm and were charged 90 euros. Left something of a sour taste after a wonderful stay. But overall an excellent hotel. While in Barca, do make sure you take the cable car from Barceloneta to Montjuic and if you've time have a Greek meal in Dionysus on Comte d'Urgell. Enjoy....

Reviews.Title: “A+++ The bar for great hotel experiences has now been raised!”
Reviews.Author: VegasPisces
Reviews.Content: This was hands down the best hotel experience that I have ever had. My husband and I traveled to Barcelona last month for our 7th wedding anniversary and, based upon reviews here at TA, we booked at this property. From the moment I had made the reservation, which was about 5 months before our actual stay, I knew we were in good hands. One of the hotel staff members had e-mailed me immediately to say they were available to help with any of our requests during our stay. Indeed, when I had inquired about selecting a romantic local restaurant for our anniversary dinner, they were eager to help and made us a reservation at a delicious spot called Senior de la Paradella, which was amazing. We had quite a long journey to Barcelona and by the time we arrived at the hotel, we were exhausted. But we were met with smiling faces and a split of champagne for us to toast our special celebration. This truly started our stay off wonderfully! The hotel location is fantastic - just off of La Rambla, so very close to everything that you will want to visit. The metro system in Barcelona is extremely easy to use and the hotel staff is always there to guide you with maps and helpful tips. My favorite part about this hotel was the food! In addition to a delicious made to order breakfast every morning (eggs, pancakes, fruit, meats, cereal, breads, etc...), they have a self service cafe that is open 24 hours a day and the price for which is included in your room rate! Each day, my husband and I would start with a hearty breakfast and then embark upon our explorations of Barcelona. Since the hotel is so centrally located and easy to reach via metro if you've gone farther out, we would stop back by later in the day for a late lunchtime meal, which usually consisted of sandwiches, soup, chips, nuts and soda or water, all at no additional charge! Then we would dine out each night at a nice restaurant around 9:00pm or so, in keeping with local tradition! There is an amazing balcony on the 6th floor where we would take our late afternoon snack, and gaze out over the amazing city below. Another notable feature about this hotel is the fact that each room is actually two rooms! Your sleeping quarters are located on one side of the hallway, with the bed, flat screen tv and bathroom features. Then across the hall, you have a separate living area with a fold out couch bed, hammock and another flat screen tv. We used this second room for enjoying our late afternoon snacks on days when we decided not to sit on the balcony whilst snacking. While we were there, we saw both couples and family travelers, but we never felt as though the property was exclusively catering to one group or the other. In fact, while we were there, we decided that we definitely want to come back with our little ones - between the 24 hour open kitchen and the separate, but right across the hall, sitting room, I would think that this property is ideal for the family traveler. The bath products in the room were extremely high quality - honestly, I wish that I would have purchased some of the scented lotion before we left. The room had everything you would need - robes, hairdryers, slippers, etc. I have raved about this property to everyone since returning and truly cannot recommend it highly enough. Being in such a central location, with the additional benefit of 24 access to food and drinks, made this property ideal for our visit. The decor is funky and cool, without being uncomfortably off putting. I can't wait to go back someday (hopefully soon!) with our kids!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jersey_Girl_PDX
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper was an awesome hotel! Great location, friendly and knowledgable staff, great room (although the sitting room was not really necessary - we never even used it!), and terrific little cafe area. This was such a fantastic convenience...to have a really good breakfast, and then the convenience to get a snack, drink, whatever at any time. Overall, the hotel had a really cool vibe to it. It was a great start to our trip in Spain and I would absolutely recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A novel approach to a hotel that really works. Great location too!”
Reviews.Author: DG_Sydney
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper has deconstructed the typical hotel experience and started from first principles. So you get: a very clean and comfortable sleeping room with bathroom annex, looking into a light well with a 'green wall' of plants. You also get your own "mini lounge" directly across the hall with a sofa, a chair, a hammock and a table. This worked brilliantly for me, traveling with my 19 year old daughter. When we wanted to, we could have our own space. The other big innovation is the banishment of room service and the mini-bar (with its attendant ripoffs) and its replacement with a guest lounge downstairs. This gives guests unfettered 24-hour access to a generous range of snacks and soft drinks: sandwiches, salads, cheese, jambon, bread, cake, muffins, yoghurt, juices, coffee, tea etc etc. You simply go down and help yourself – it's all included in the room rate. The only thing you'll pay extra for is alcoholic drinks, which are available (again 24 hours) from the extremely helpful front desk staff. At breakfast (7 or 7:30 to 11am), this is supplemented with eggs etc cooked to order. In practice this works really well. There's also a small "business centre" (an iMac and printer) and free wifi throughout. We found it a great base (the location is fantastic), with a very relaxed, cool vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Dig this!”
Reviews.Author: blidsheim
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper was a truly fantastic experience for two families traveling together, children age 1-6. Location is excellent just off the Rambla but the most amazing thing is the out-of-this-world ambience and features of the hotel. The offering of free-bees in the lounge/breakfast room 24hrs is something we found to be of very high value when traveling with children. The mini lounge lay-out is cool and very well suited when traveling with children. Gotta love the hammock too. Living the Camper experience is what this hotel is about.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: damelb
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a suite, it was a great size, perfect for two people. The location is as ideal as you can get - walk to everything, but just off the main hustle and bustle. The hotel is a great fun experience, rooftop terrace is magic. Extras included room safe big enough for laptop with a power point in it for charging, iPod cables to plug into the stereo in the room, hammock in the lounge right next to the window for afternoon siestas. The cafe, food area is open all day and into the night with food and drink included in the price. Of all the hotels I've stayed in all the cities, this was far from the most expensive, and still the best all-round experience of any.

Reviews.Title: “Fun concept, free buffet and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: dreamlaurie09
Reviews.Content: We would definitely like to come back to visit Casa Camper. Their unique concept separates your sleeping quarters from your lounging quarters- that's right, 2 rooms! One room offers an excellent wall garden view (completely private but lots of light) and the sala has a second TV, couch and mini- balcony. We had a wonderful view from our sala but it still didn't compare to the amazing view of the rooftop terrace. My husband's favorite part was the free buffet. They don't serve full meals but rather light snacks, drinks, and coffee. The staff was friendly and engaged in a conversation about Barcelona and even other cities on our route. Wonderful location but not on a busy street- you may want to email/call the hotel for directions.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneBookgirl
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for work and pleasure, and although I regularly stay at five star hotels, Casa Camper is easily the best hotel that I've ever stayed at. Casa Camper offers all the best features of a boutique hotel, with innovative features that will enhance your stay, in an environment that focuses on the individual traveller. I think that the 24-hour-available cafe area is invaluable, perhaps particularly for the non-European traveller adjusting to different meal times, but certainly also for rehydrating after time in the Catalonian heat. The hotel's attention to hygiene surpasses anything that I''ve ever seen (and I'm a doctor, and fussy), and the location is sensational. However, it is the staff who I will remember as particularly impressive. The service is thoughtful from even before you arrive, and beyond what I would have hoped. My best example of this was when I returned for a second stay, and my airline had lost my luggage. The staff took the initiative of locating it and ensuring its safe return, and although I think that the airline was very unhelpful, the hotel staff followed up with what I suspect were dozens of 'phone calls, saving my luggage and my holiday! My sincere thanks to Aurelie, Cristina, Stefano and Valentina, and to all the staff I met (including the charming chef, who makes the best pancakes ever).

Reviews.Title: “THE best hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: BbBbBbBbTx
Reviews.Content: Our extendend family group of 11 stayed here 3 nights in August 2009. It was a fabulous experience. We travel internationally often and frequently and feel that this hotel is definitely in the top three of places we have stayed at. The hotel is owned by the Camper Shoes company. The location is adjacent to the lively/landmark Ramblas Ave, but since the hotel is about a block away, the rooms are very quiet and comfortable. The metro stop (Catalyuna) was about 2 blocks away. There are a ton of restaurants around the location. We felt safe while taking the usual precautions against pickpockets. The hotel is almost setup as an all-inclusive since they have a 24 hours lounge with FREE drinks, breakfast, snacks, tea/coffee, salads, sandwiches, pastries..... It was great to come back to the hotel after a day of touring and have free cold drinks awaiting. The Staff is FABULOUS and really made this hotel special. They were all a young group of about 6-7 people who managed all aspects of this 25-30 room hotel. Upon Checkin "Silas" gave us a detailed description about the hotel, its facilities, transportation options, nearby restaurant recommendations, and so forth. They really wanted to make sure that we made the most of our trip. The decor is ultra modern. The size is HUGE by European standards. There is no shower door, and the sinks have a huge window with a rolling shade that goes up or down so you can view the courtyard. The bed was very comfortable. I believe the shower runoff water is recycled to flush the toilets. The Rooms are very interesting. There are only 5 rooms per floor. All rooms come with a "lounge" that is a separate room located across the hallway. It contained a hammock, TV, Twin bed, a Balcony overlooking the Elizabeths street, and table and chairs for snackin. What a cute concept (except for the fact that you do have to cross the hallway from your room to enter) There is a balcony on the 6th floor with a view of the city. It was great to relax up there with something to drink. We enjoyed the hot cook to order breakfast. The omelets were great. Everyone was very pleased with the stay (the kids were especially ecstatic about the lounge). The only thing was that we feel our immediate family of four could easily have fit in one room (plus the lounge). The maximum "capacity" per room is 3 so we had to have 2 rooms (one for the kiddos).
