By in large based on the rates we paid (even counting in the extra rooms) we felt this was a great value and would HIGHLY recommend this hotel. The staff said that a new Casa Camper hotel was being opened in Berlin and we would certainly be willing to try that (I understand they are following the same boutique type service) They can offer such great service because there are only 25 rooms or so in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fabulous Staff”
Reviews.Author: merlin321
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at Casa Camper. Its a quiet, relaxing refreshing oasis in the middle of this hectic city. There are many novel and convenient aspects to this hotel that make it very different, and in our opinion, far better than the typical hotel. The 24 hr. refreshment bar is just one great feature. But by far the best thing about the hotel is the young, helpful, knowledgeable staff. They are extremely approachable and pleasant. Not only did Ariella not seem to mind that we wanted to check-in four hours before check-in time, but she greeted us like long-lost relatives, made sure the room was ready, took our bags up and offered us a cup of coffee. Anja was especially helpful. She made it seem as if it were her singular responsibilty to guarantee that we enjoyed our vacation. She anticipated our every need, before we even asked. The guys were equally helpful. They're there when you need them, but know when to give you your privacy. And Susanna, the general manager, seems to be doing everything right. Besides hiring great staff, the hotel is spotless, secure (you need a room key to get into the lobby) and comfortable. Great work guys!! We feel this hotel greatly enhanced our visit to Barcelona and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Schmik”
Reviews.Author: aussieexpats
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to Las Ramblas but quiet because the sleeping area faced an internal courtyard. Friendly staff and we were able to have our room early which was great after a 15 hour flight. The all day snacking was good especially since we are not used to eating at 9pm. The roof terrace was a lovely place to watch the sunset. Although we understand the hotel philosophy we would have liked a bar fridge (just empty) and a kettle (I know European hotels don't provide them) but who wants to pad downstairs at 6am for a cold water or cup of tea? As expensive as the shoes if you don't earn in Euros but we still enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “I have found the perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: brencagirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Camper before a cruise. Before we even arrived, I had received contact from the hotel asking if they could do anything for us. I gladly accepted the ride from the airport (with carseats), which costs not too much more than a taxi fare. They also offered bikes, tours, DVDs for kids, bedtime stories for kids, etc...When we arrived at the hotel...I was absolutely amazed at the service we received...they gave us a full tour of the hotel, explained all the amenities (the rooftop terrace is BEAUTIFUL in early evening) and then...they left us alone! :) We were able to stop in at the hotel during our sightseeing for a quick snack (salads, sandwiches, sweets, fruit,etc.), a drink (water, juice, soda, etc), coffee (Nespresso Yum!), all of which were included in the room rate. Breakfast is lovely. The rooms were so much fun...quirky but very nicely done. The vertical garden was spectacular...the bathrooms were beautifully done and very nice. The people, however, are what make this hotel most special. They were so friendly, helpful, I can not say enough about this hotel. My husband and I travel quite a lot (he is on the road weekly for work) and we both agree that hands down...it is the best hotel experience we have EVER had. :)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience, great staff, perfect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bklynite
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our trip to Barcelona this morning and I felt compelled to write this review imediately due to the positive experience and wonderful, personal treatment we both received from every member of this hotel's staff, from the manager tdown With only 25 rooms and a small number of employees, by the end of our trip we felt that we had really met everyone and that they were genuinely interested in our enjoying the hotel and the city. The hotel might look like one of those hipper-than-thou places, but it's not. During our four-night stay we say everyone from young singles to families with babies and teenagers; the room set-ups seem conducive to any type of family arrangement. Our positive experience began before we even checked in. We arrived in Barcelona but were heading immediately to the Costa Brava for two nights and didn't want to lug around our extra bags for the trip. The hotel eagerly agreed to store them for us at no charge until we checked in. When we returned, we were greeted warmly, and didn't even have to explain that we had left our bags there. We were given a quick tour of the hotel, and then brought up to our room, where our bags had already been delivered before we had arrived. I offered a tip to the staff member who showed us to our room, but he refused. The room was beautiful and quiet. All of the sleeping areas are on the back side of the hotel, so you don't hear the noise on Carrer Elisabets. Trust me, noise is an issue at nearly every hotel in and around El Raval and La Rambla especially and in Barcelona in general, so to have a hotel where you don't have to ask for a room in the back is a blessing. We slept like logs. There was a turn-down service each night with bottles of water left in the room. My wife is pregnant and her comfort was very important on this trip. The staff inquired about her frequently, and made her feel welcome and attended to without being pushy. They seemed genuinely interested in how she was doing, and the manager asked us to send a birth announcement when the baby comes! We asked for a late check-out and were able to keep the room until 3 PM, which was perfect, since it meant we could relax and shower before heading to the airport for a late flight. We were sad to leave the hotel and will definitely stay there again when we go back to Barcelona. You can pay as much or more to stay somewhere else, but not get the level or service and perks this hotel provides. Highly recommended. Other quick pluses: - The mini lounge across the hall from our room was a real pleasure. The hammock, small couch, chair, table, and TV allowed us to relax during the afternoons without feeling like we were hanging out in a hotel room. It was more like being at home. Given the heat in Barcelona this month, it was a huge plus to have this room for afternoon naps and relaxing. - The comfy Camper slippers. (You can buy a pair at the hotel, but the only bad thing is that they are cheaper at Camper stores!) - Free breakfast, including made-to-order eggs, coffee, breads, cereal, juices, etc. - Free snacks and beverages at the lobby's cafe, which meant no silly, expensive minibar charges. When we were close, it was nice to come back to the hotel for lunch, or to just grab a water, a Coke, or a snack to bring up to the room at the end of the night. - Helpful, friendly staff. They recommended restaurants that THEY would go to, not just touristy places. Each recommendation came with a printed out Google map for easy directions. - Bike rentals, for a small fee, meant not having to deal with outside bike companies. Just reserve a bike and it's ready for your to take from the hotel. I've never been so enthusiastic about a hotel. I'd go back to Barcelona for the city, of course, but this hotel is a draw in and of itself.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: viba424
Reviews.Content: I just loved this hotel. It was in a great location in central Historic Barcelona, just a block or two from Las Ramblas. All the amenities were very well done. The best part is you have 24 hour access to free snacks in the hotel, which is especially important when you are travelling. The cooler was always stocked with fresh sandwiches and drinks which you could take to your room or to the AMAZING rooftop balcony. The free daily breakfasts were huge and not to be missed. A computer with internet access was available in the lobby which was very convenient and always seemed to be available. Staff were outstanding at this hotel. Very friendly, easy going, and always available. And you saw them everyday which was nice. Owned by the company that makes Camper shoes, the hotel certainly fits their "look". I even picked up a pair of rare Camper slip ons from the front desk before returning home as a special souvenier. They were the same kind provided for your use in each room during your stay. The rooms were minimalistic and fun. We got a spacious suite with a bedroom and living space, which I would highly recommend. Our room also had a balcony and a hammock. The bathrooms were also really cool, with a great view into a plant filled private courtyard. I would say this hotel is young in feel but comfortable for all ages. Love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: Mosey08
Reviews.Content: If want a quiet hotel with excellent amenities, wonderful staff, food and drink on tap, and just minutes from the centre of everything in Barcelona, this is it! Stayed for 4 nights in June with teenage son. The 24 hour complimentary snack service in the lobby is great plus you get a cooked breakfast included in your room charge. We were travelling on in Spain after our stay here and the staff went out their way to help us with the arrangements from this. Spotlessly clean, roomy, comfortable accommodation. Wonderful staff. Great location. Everything you could possibly ask for and more!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ovelocityo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Casa Camper for six nights in March. The hotel is beautiful, the neighborhood is lovely and the staff is beyond helpful. We really enjoyed having the additional "lounge" room, although to be honest, we didn't make much use of it. The bedroom itself was not only nice to look at and well designed, but it was comfortable and felt like "home". The rooms were spotlessly clean and whatever lemongrass cleanser they use to clean is awesome. I know that's a weird comment but it's true... ha. The breakfast in the morning is a must-have since we found getting anything in Barcelona before 10:00 AM to be difficult. The free food provided the rest of the time there is uh...interesting. Don't plan on that food being your dinner. A lot of it was stale and/or foul. It was nice to have access to bottles of water and juice whenever you'd like, though. The service was great - the staff was super helpful with recommendations and there were a couple people we saw again and again who went out of their way to check-in with us and make sure we were happy. The only draw back is the somewhat high price. You definitely are getting what you pay for, but the price still seems a little high compared to some of the less trendy, but still very nice hotels in Barcelona. P.S. Def not for kids., free internet! and no room service, but seriously, why are you getting room service in Barcelona? There's great food everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a design hotel should be (and usually isn't!)”
Reviews.Author: Capricorn72
Reviews.Content: Our family with 2 small children had a fabulous stay at Casa Camper. The hotel was perfect for us. It's a great location in an interesting neighbourhood, a short walk from all the sights. We stayed in a suite, which was great for families. The room was spotless, everyone had plenty of space and our 3 year old loved the hammock! The natural light in the spacious bathroom was also a rare treat. The 24-hour food was good for keeping us going until our late Barcelona dinners. As many people have noted, the Casa Camper experience is really made by the fantastic staff. From the time our booking was confirmed until we hopped in a taxi to leave they were extremely friendly and went out of their way to make our stay more enjoyable. I wish I could stay at a Camper hotel everywhere we visit! Oh, just one word of warning, don't stray too far south in the Raval area - wandering back with the kids through a street full of prostitutes wasn't too much fun!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute must and highly recommended...”
Reviews.Author: phatsinoz
Reviews.Content: I cannot agree more with the other reviewers who have raved about the Casa Camper. If you're a regulart traveller and are burnt out by frequent hotel stays, then the Casa Camper experience makes a wonderful change to the somewhat robotic hotel service you usually come to expect. The staff are warm and accommodating, the beds and shower absolutely divine and the 24-hour snack bar a welcome addition to the experience. Agreeably, this hotel is not for everyone, but if you are looking for a unique experience in the funky, urban landscape of the Raval district, then look no further. An oasis of calm and pampering in the heart of Barcelona with a quirky twist!

Reviews.Title: “Best staff ever! Thank you from Wend and Christoph”
Reviews.Author: Wenders66Hereford
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Casa Camper. Firstly the location is truly perfect and I would not say that lightly. Just off Las Ramblas, so you are close to everything but also by a lovely square with a few cafes, where you can sit and sip sangria away from the frenetic pace of Barcelona. The rooms are a great size with a fantastic walk-in shower and lovely view of the inside garden. Spotlessly clean with nice touches like dressing gowns and when I brought a rose back one day, a few hours later it had been put in a lovely vase as if by magic. Which brings me to the staff. I am not exaggerating when I say that we have never come across such wonderful hotel staff before. It was my husbands birthday and our wedding anniversary whilst we were there and amazingly every member of staff knew and offered genuine best wishes on both days. They also organised a cake and balloons to be brought to my husband during his birthday breakfast on the terrace (breakfast on the terrace is a must!). When we got back to the room later that day the balloons had all been collected and put in our room which was a really sweet touch. I cannot praise them highly enough, they really wanted our stay to be as wonderful as possible. And it was! I have never bothered to write a hotel review before but our stay truly warranted one. Thank you to everyone at Casa Camper from Wend and Christoph!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: up4anything
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying at the Casa Camper for a wedding. The staff was so nice, welcoming and accommodating. The 24-hour snacks were great. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable space, great location, had a small cafe open 24 hrs”
Reviews.Author: robdon1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on good reviews and write ups, a little pricey, but well worth it for the modern amenities, great location, and helpful staff. The self service open cafe was great for snacks and organizing your day at breakfast, when they had a cook available. Felt very safe in a highly trafficed side street. Rooms are somewhat wierdly divided into sleeping/bathing space and a sitting room. We had a suite so these were attached, but most are separated by the main corrider. Everything was very clean, the sitting rooms have a futon and a very comfortable hammock!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Uustuner
Reviews.Content: I loved the location and snacks all day long. Snacks were so tasty and freshly prepared. This is the only hotel i have ever seen where you can find organic drinks and healthy sandwiches. At breakfast, you can have whatever you want and there are plenty selection. Once, I wanted Spanish Omlet and i received omlet full of onion. May be i could not taste potatoes inside but again it was great. Hotel is close to Ramblas however it is even closer to Raval where i didn't feel comfortable at night. What i did not like about the hotel was the bathroom that was open plan like bathroom, with no door. It made the room smelly after taking shower that was not nice. A second room was given to the us as living room, to me it was not necessary but this is a nice detail. In general, this is a great hotel. I would recommend to singles or families without children.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't be any better!”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers91
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed here and it continues to deliver. I was potentially the customer from hell, with large boxes being delivered, lots of queries, visitors etc etc. The staff here are amazing. They couldn't have been more helpful and did it all with a smile on their face. The rooms are amazing, clean and the food available is delicious! I wish I could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a bit different style”
Reviews.Author: ScandiCouple
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, good location - a bit different with the room (apartment) split in two across a corridor. Modern and personal style. Tried to get the 1898 hotel (with pool) but it was full. Was not dissapointed except a pool would have been nice. Stayed only for a night but would not have minded longer.

Reviews.Title: “Love this friendly, funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: apawley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend with my 9 year old daughter. She loved this hotel. It is in a great location and has a lovely feel. We had a suite, with me getting a double and my daughter a sofabed. She loved the fact the sitting area also had a hammock! Food is great, they have a help yourself open kitchen open 24 hours and the breakfast was excellent. The roof terrace is fun. Just off the Ramblas it is in an excellent, upcoming area. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “can stay in the hotel whole day long”
Reviews.Author: Alau
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. It's creative, clever staff are very helpful convenient location

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler1500
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a 100% pleasant surprise. From the mixed reviews, I was a bit nervous after booking -- could not have been more pleased with the place. When you first arrive - don't be surprised that it's in a street that seems more like an alley (it was my first time in Barcelona and apparently many of the streets are like this). The staff is exceptional -- every last person treats you as if you're in a 5-star, white-glove hotel. Stefano at the front desk is especially helpful and has great restaurant suggestions. The rooms are not strange in the least - they're incredibly practical and perfect for a business traveler who likes boutique style and doesn't take themselves too seriously (it's definitely not your grandma's hotel :) Good bed. Excellent size safe for laptops. Wireless and wired Internet. Marvelous shower and good towels. Terrific lighting in the bathroom and nice details, like a vanity area. The separate, private lounge across the hall is a small and comfortable space that is perfect if you need to work in your room - feels like you have a little ready-made office. The little cafe room downstairs that's open all day and fully included in your stay is a nice touch. Best moment ... I was late down for breakfast one day and they had just closed the breakfast room. Instead of turning me away, they said they could make me a continental breakfast ... I thought that in itself was very nice and hoped for a croissant and a cup of coffee. But they brought out so much food - one plate of breads, another of pastries, then cheeses, then meats, then sliced fruits ... just beautiful. That was the type of service I experienced from the moment I arrived until the moment I left. I wish I'd like the rest of Barcelona that much. Hopefully, Camper will open other hotels (maybe Paris or London?) so that I can stay more often ...

Reviews.Title: “Part Luxury Hotel, Part Youth Hostel”
Reviews.Author: Mayfair Ranger
Reviews.Content: The Casa Camper enjoys a good location near the university, within a couple of hundred yards of the top end of La Rambla. Reception staff are very friendly and helpful, although many are foreign students and some therefore do not have an extensive knowledge of the city. The hotel claims to be eco-friendly (e.g. recycling bathroom water) so it seemed curious that the air-conditioning and lights were always left on after our room was made up each day. The suites are well thought-out with clean lines and decor, interesting features and strong colours. As some other reviewers have noted, the basic rooms have a curious arrangement whereby the living room is located across a public corridor from the bedroom. You might not feel comfortable crossing the corridor in your pyjamas or underwear - we were certainly glad to be in a suite. The hotel benefits from a great complimentary all-day help-yourself snack bar. A cooked breakfast is however also available to order. If you enjoy light, be sure to specify a preference for a high floor. The hotel is located on an alleyway and the lower floors are conspicuously dark. The Casa Camper is a 4-star hotel, yet with certain youth hostel characteristics. As such it is both unique and charming. Even as someone who would steer a million miles from a youth hostel, I can strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely good”
Reviews.Author: IorekByrnison
Reviews.Content: Just to add my voice to the consensus of favourable reviews: this hotel i really good and in a very good position too

Reviews.Title: “I'm fussy”
Reviews.Author: Constance5
Reviews.Content: I'm fussy about where I stay. I like a comfortable bed, quiet, clean interesting space, kind staff, beverages in the AM. Hotel Camper fit the bill plus and one of the high lights of our trip to Barcelona. First a word on noise since this seemed to be a concern in some of the previous reviews. There was none. The hotel was an oasis of calm in an active, festive and throbbing city. The double glass doors to the lobby shut out all street noise. Jazz vocals played in the background. Our third floor bedroom was silent, the roof top sitting area was peaceful and as a bonus allowed a view of the nightly firworks. With the unfavorable exchange rate on the dollar and the exhorbitant price of even a light snack, having a more than adequatre, healthy 23 hour day and night buffet available was a cost saver and so convenient. Though the Barcelona food is a treat, there's too much to do in the city to be caught up in restaurant searches three times a day. Plus the food with it's emphasis on oil can be heavy. We enjoyed the hotel's fruit and salad. The bed was the right firmness and comfy, the room was dark, neat and elegant. My concern about the neighborhood was unwarranted. We were careful, the usual no swinging pocketbooks or back pant pocket valuables. Several blocks from Rambla on a well frequented street we felt safe night and even early morning going to our airport transport with luggage on tow. The location was perfect, a short walk to the action, but off the main drag. The staff was sweet and helpful, a little short on usual hotel concierge service. Worked out fine for us, we like to find our own way. Would love to come back and/or stay at another Camper boutique hotel elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Camper, Casa by name: home by nature”
Reviews.Author: scotsguy61
Reviews.Content: We had been in Barcelona for about a week in an apartment in the El Borne. We had a late flight home and had to be out our apartment by 11 am (the flight was at 9pm) and decided to move to the Casa Camper after seeing it on our way to MACBA. As other reviewers have pointed out (and in some cases seem to have missed the point of) the USP of Casa Camper is its unique room layouts, whereby everyone has what is essentially a suite, a bedroom and separate sitting area. The design takes advantage of this layout whereby the sitting area faces the (noisy) street, and is seperated by a corridor from the bedroom which is well insulated at the rear of the building. Compared to El Borne our night there was serene in its quietness. The functionality of the rooms has been criticised by some of the reviewers but to my mind the hotel bedrooms were well designed and equipped. The beds are huge, the sheets crisp the pillows soft. One of the best I've been in. The toiletries were top notch too. Aircon icy and two tvs one in each room. Staff were super friendly and gave us a late check out till 4 in the afternoon so our last day in Barcelona was releaxed and we had a chance to shower before we caught the plane home. All in all an oasis in the frenticism that is Barcelona. I highly recommend for couples, maybe not for families who may find it a bit sterile.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: iretravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Camper in mid-July (2 adults and two young boys - 5 and 7). We took a suite which provided plenty of room for everyone and was good value. The boys loved the hammock. Suite very nice and good air conditioning. Staff super attentive and very welcoming to the young boys. The cantina a great idea when travelling with young kids: nice to be able to have a snack in the hotel without having to go outside and deal with waiters etc. . Hotel very central. It is on a narrow laneway so difficult for taxis to find - print out a map to show the taxi driver! Only negative is that the lighting a bit too subtle: no overhead lighting at all.

Reviews.Title: “funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheviot
Reviews.Content: WE stayed for 3 nights at Casa Camper, Barcelona and mostly enjoyed it. THe best part was the position, once you and the taxi driver find it is very central to a great part of town. The down side for us was the liviing room/bedroom across the hall which had our 7 year old daughters bed, we did not feel comfortable leaving her across the hall. If you visit with small children make sure you book a room without the lounge across the hall. Apart from that the hotel is beautifully and simply decorated, a little dark in the rooms. The staff are helpful and the free food and drinks in the lobby a nice change from overpriced mini bars.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Convenient, and a Great "Service with a Smile" Staff”
Reviews.Author: HubrisChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the third floor in a suite. The suites are at the end of the hallway on each floor (five total), and are the only rooms where the bedrooms and sitting areas are connected. The remaining rooms require you to walk across the hallway to your connected sitting area. Not a big deal (we peeked in an open room), but worth noting. I think the hotel only has about forty(40) rooms. The suites are clean, comfortable, and have great cooling systems. The beds are sufficient, the sheets are crisp, and the pillows are fluffy. The shower water pressure is great, and the bathrooms are roomy and well lit. The sitting area in each room will allow you to open french doors, and stand on a small balcony overlooking the street below. When you close the doors, you can barely hear any of the street noise below, and in the bedroom you couldn't hear a thing. The hotel also has a great rooftop deck, includes morning breakfast, and has a small cantina that is open 24hrs per day that allows all guests to grab a quick water, coke, juice, sandwiches, etc.. at their convenience ----- included in hotel cost. The staff was very attentive, helped us book tours, provided printed out maps to various restaurants & attractions, and in general were filled with super-positive energy. We were on a portion of our honeymoon, and the staff even sent up a little bottle of champagne with well-wishes. Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SouthFLTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Camper Barcelona the night before our cruise left Barcelona. The hotel was neat, clean, and in a great location only a couple blocks from the La Rambla area. Our room was on the fifth floor, and the sitting area and bedroom/bathroom area are across the hall from each other. This was an interesting twist, but did not create any problems for us. The hotel provides and food area in the lobby 23 hours a day and there was always something available to drink and snack on. The hotel also provides free WiFi with the price. We did experience a problem with the air conditioning in our room and the hotel immediately responded to the issue. Overall this was a great hotel, in a good location, and we would recommend it to anyone traveling to the Barcelona area.

Reviews.Title: “When in Barcelona, there is only one hotel: Casa Camper”
Reviews.Author: Perthi
Reviews.Content: I am sorry about the people who had a bad experience at this hotel but this is the most interesting and one of the best hotels in Barcelona. First, it looks like an Art Gallery, secondly, the staff (specially Guillermo and the lady who cooks breakfast: she is a gem) are extremely friendly and helpful; thirdly, it is very central (just 2 minutes from Las Ramblas and Plaza Cataluna). Breakfast is excellent: you can have whatever you want. There is a good selection of snacks 24 hours "tentempie" including hot and cold drinks, cakes, soup, salads, etc., which you can take to your room or to the terrace. I used this service many times even at 3:00 am. The rooms are excellent. We stayed in a Suite with our private little balcony in a narrow street, a lounge, a bedroom with a Kingsize bed and a bathroom (The shower is a must). The whole place is like a small apartment. HOWEVER, there are 2 kinds of rooms: Suites and Rooms. The rooms are just like the Suites except that the lounge and balcony are separate so you have a corridor between your bedroom/bathroom and the lounge. We found that the Suites are very noisy SO I recommend not to book a Suite. Book a room. FINALLY, GUILLERMO (the Manager during the day) is wonderful: he is helpful, friendly, excellent, and he will do anything to sort out your problems. He is the heart of this hotel. Ask for him if you stay at this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hot and noisy”
Reviews.Author: TravelerCool
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based soley on trip advisor recommmendations; adn travelled there with my 2 boys for 4 days at the beginning of May. The taxi driver had no problem finding the hotel, even though I had taken the precaution of printing the map. On arrival, we were greeted by very pleasant reception staff and shown around the ground floor, which basically consisted of a seating area and a little room where you could have 24 hour complimentary "tentempe". This consisted of breads, soft drinks, juices, water, crisps, doughnuts,crackers, nuts, cheeses, tomatoes. In a fridge there were simple salads,various sandwiches and desserts. All were clearly marked and looked fresh. The area appeared to be very claen. There were different bins for the different types of waste, which I thought was impressive. The only downside to this area was that, according to my 11 year old, it felt like being in an airport terminal. The lay out and the clinical athmosphere were not what we are used to. However, when in Barcelona..... I had booked a suite, simply because my 2 boys and I would not have fitted in a standard room. One of us would would have had to stay across the hall. The "suite" consisted of a bathroom, sliding door to bedroom, sliding door to living room with sofa bed and french windows to tiny balcony and street outside. Therefore, we had none of this "hopping "across the corridor to the living room that other people had. There was a television in both the bedroom and the living room. The bathroom was ok, though the tiling looked cheap and poorly finished. It is hard to pinpoint why, but, for us, it just did not work. It was as if I was back in the caravans of my youth! The dim lighting,the sliding doors, the sparse sense of the place, a vaguely musty damp smell. In any event, it was late so we unpacked and went to bed. I agreed to take first night on the sofe bed (Stupid mom eh!) Then the fun started. The room was very hot and though we tried to adjust the aircon, it remained very hot so we could not sleep properly. The living room was right beside the street so it was quite noisy until 2 or 3 am with people in the street; short respite, then noise again from 5am, presumably this time from garbage and cleaning trucks. I must have finally dozed at 8 or so because it was 11 before we finally woke, shattered, and ran down to grab something for breakfast before it finished. The selection was good, well presented and enjoyable. After breakfast, I went to reception and explained about the aircon problem. The girl was attentive and interested. She said that she would try to have it sorted for us. I explained thaif she could not get it fixed we were happy to move rooms. She told me that they were fully booked so I said that , if the problem could not be remedied,we would have to move to another hotel. We went back to the room( I think it was 35) to get sorted and within 5 minutes a gentleman appeared at the door. If memory serves, his name was Peter. He explained that there had been problems with the aircon and that he was happy to move us to another hotel. He would arrange to have our luggage transferred and we could go ahead, inspect the hotel, and confirm whether it was acceptable to us. This we duly did ( see report on hotel regina) We checked out shortly after and I have to admit that I was surprised to be charged the full rate; though the wine I had the night before was comped. I suppose i expected more of a gesture given that we had not slept and that much time was to be wasted changing hotel. In any event, I was too tired to say anything.I paid the bill and we just moved to the other hotel. All in all, the saving grace of this hotel was its staff. I found the service at all times to be excellent. However, it was not enough to overcome the clinical athmosphere,the broken air con and the noisy rooms. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Camper-unfriendly manager,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Honeygatherer
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in Casa Camper, Barcelona in April-May 2008, for about 24 Room nights (nights x rooms), Each room night was about 240 Euros. The rest of the staff is very friendly and helpful but this seems to be a one man show of Peter,the Room Reservation Manager, who towers over the rest of the staff. He himself can be aggressive, unpleasant, prickly and overbearing as he was with me. He called a taxi 7 minutes earlier than it was booked the next morning and insisted that the driver would only charge from the time booked, whereas he didnt. The problem was compounded by Peter's belief that he knew English well.For 5 nights the AC in our room on the 5th floor wasn't working but it wasn't repaired. This was brought to the notice of the Hotel staff everyday but all they could say was please tell Peter- the big boss. The sink in another room a suite was clogged, the engineering mechanism for pulling up the venetian blinds wouldn't work in another room. Only Peter could do something about it, if at all.This Hotel has unusual ideas and is run by a well known shoe company- Camper. But the staff shouldnt be so dependent on one man and he should be trained to be pleasant and not aggressive, disagreeable

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected and more...”
Reviews.Author: boxerfan
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped through the glass front door, we knew this was the perfect choice for us....brilliant design execution...we stayed in a suite and despite the busy pedestrian traffic outside, the bedroom area was super quiet...my husband said it was the best sleep of our 2 week trip! loved watching tv in the hammock...loved the privacy of the bathroom with all the natural light...the rooftop deck was also a nice respite from the crowds...the made to order omelette was delicious and made with a smile! we will return to Barcelona and next time will spend more than one night at Casa Camper

Reviews.Title: “A little flashy but I loved it”
Reviews.Author: SparklyFlyingUnicorn
Reviews.Content: I did like this hotel. They've got this cool thing where there's a cafe-type place in the lobby and there's sandwiches and stuff and it's open 24/7 and you can take whatever you like and it's all included. The staff was nice, just one guy was annoying. Stephan I think... And you get two rooms, so that's pretty cool. But its cold. Yeah, thats it. Good value, good location. Enjoy! Oh, but theres not REAL restaurant. Just the cafe. It does do breakfast though.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Mindleftbody
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper is an incredible place to lay your head while in Barcelona. The overall feel of the place is great, the staff go out of there way to make you comfortable.. and the place is just plain funky in a great way. For a solo traveler in Barcelona, Casa Camper is perfect, its right off the top of the Rambla down a cool little side street, very close to Placa Cataluna, which is where you get dropped off from the airport bus, it was zero problem finding the hotel and they even had my room waiting for me when I arrived early int he AM, most places require you to wait until at least mid-afternoon to check in. The rooms themselves where great, spacious, clean, and the mini-lounge is great, with a hammock and big french doors that open to the street, plus flat screens in both the bedroom and lounge and some English lanquage TV. I stayed at the hotel for 5 days, and I would definitly put Casa Camper at the top of my list for my next trip to Barcelona, for all the reasons above PLUS the hotel bikes, the 24 food lounge, the free wi-fi and especially the staff

Reviews.Title: “"I felt like I was in a playhouse"”
Reviews.Author: tziambra
Reviews.Content: I have been to Barcelona many times in the past few years and this time around, I decided to try Casa Camper. The hotel is by far one of the nicest ones in the city and probably the funkiest. I am sure there are other luxury hotel chains that will give you the feel of a "normal" hotel but Casa Camper is a different experience. Each room actually has two rooms across the hallway from each other. One is the bedroom and the other one is the hangout room. The colors are bright, there is a huge window for a wall in the back that overlooks in the Casa Camper courtyard. Most of the furniture is the room is trendy (you can also buy it at this famous design store in the city) and functional. The bathroom has an excellent shower and great products, shower gel, shampoo etc. The "living room" has a huge hammock in it, a couch and a flat screen tv. It is unconventional but if you really think about it, it is a great idea. At the lobby of the hotel, there is a small "restaurant" area where you can get some food and snacks 24hours per day. This is included in the prices along with the breakfast. All the people working at Casa Camper were super-friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is very central, just off Las Ramblas close the Plaza Catalunya and it is surprisingly quiet for how close to the action it is. The best thing about Casa Camper is that it feels like "home". If, for example, you have been walking around the city for the whole day and you need sometime to relax, it is felt so much more fun to return to the hotel and hang out in the "living room" where you can take the food upstairs and chill and do not have to be stranded in a standard hotel room. I highly recommended to anybody who likes boutique, trendy hotels that diverge from the normal and expected.

Reviews.Title: “the place for my next stay”
Reviews.Author: travelerphil
Reviews.Content: Although I haven’t stayed at casa camper (cause they were booked), I walked by the hotel before my visit to the Contemporary art museum (macba). First thing I noticed was that the hotel’s main door was closed. But then a Brazilian receptionist opened a window beside and gave us all the information about this cool hotel. she was really nice and spoke English fluently. Now I am sure these amazing reviews about the hotel and friendly staff are true and I am willing to go back to Barcelona and to stay at casa Camper.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Tim-Limbach
Reviews.Content: My wife comments, "apart from the rooms in our suite being too dark, I don't know how I could fault it". I booked this hotel, following the many positive reviews I had read and wanted my wife to enjoy the no.1 hotel in Barcelona. On arrival we were invited to enjoy our choice from the extensive buffet, most salads, sandwiches and cakes being wrapped in individual plastic cartons. Guests are encouraged to recycle the waste.There is a fine selections of fizzy drinks (sodas) and fruit juices, as well as yoghurt and pastries, tea and coffee. All the snacks are described in Catalan and English. This buffet is available 24 hrs a day and is changed daily. Breakfast is also served in this buffet / lounge area and includes freshly squeezed orange / grapefruit juices, sliced fresh fruit, pastries, cold meats, cheeses, yoghurts plus food cooked to order by the charming chefs. I enjoyed pancakes with maple syrup. Our suite, consisted of a large bathroom, with tub and two types of powerful shower, fluffy towels and slippers / robes are provided. The bedroom had an enormous bed, plenty of shelf space, subdued lighting, a radio and flatscreen tv. The adjoining lounge had sofa, hammock, flatscreen tv and very narrow balcony. Each room had individually controlled a/c. There is a rooftop terrace available, with drinks for purchase, but it was too cold to enjoy. The situation is ideal, being minutes from Catalunya and Las Ramblas amd many other notable attractions. It is expensive at 270 Euros per night, but is worth a try. The staff are very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Most Stylish Hotels in Europe”
Reviews.Author: wrldtraveler-7
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper is one of the most stylish hotels in Europe. Guests have two rooms, one a bedroom and then a lounge in a separate room directly across the hallway. One of the real benefits of staying here is that instead of a minibar, there is a 24hr "snack bar" in the lobby: this is an interesting and original concept and ends up in big savings. The staff is very friendly, professional and warm and are really intent on making sure you enjoy yourself. The hotel is right off the Ramblas, five minutes from the Plaza de Catalunya and within easy walking distance to the old city's historic sites. This was the best hotel experience I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool Urban Oasis”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoad099
Reviews.Content: The two-room concept is terrific. Our teenagers took over the lounge room. With that, the great hotel security arrangement, and the free food and beverages in the lobby, every member of the family felt independent. Staff is incredibly friendly and helpful (ask for tapas suggestions). The lobby is a little community center and residents tended to be very friendly. Rooms are sleek, hip and just about perfect. Thanks to an ingenious system of window shading, they are bright and very private. Once we found the place (someone needs to educate the cabbies), the location turned out to be ideal. The entire atmosphere is cool, literally and figuratively, and we always enjoyed returning to the hotel after a hot day walking around this most wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Andrew-Greig
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for two nights in March. The location is great, two minutes from La Rambla and the Plaza Cataluna. It is worth printing out a map in advance to give to the taxi driver, as it can be difficult to find first time. We booked a suite as we were not 100% with the idea of going out of the main room into the living room. The greeting was great and the staff are all fab. Room was brilliant and there were som real funky touches - hammock etc The breakfast and all day snacks were also really cool. Whatever hot food you want for breakfast is cooked to order. Ask reception to recopmmend restaurants, we went to the 'Cellar of the Tapas' and whilst a little pricey, the food was excellent. Take the Turistic bus tour as this is the most regular with most buses. We would definitely return to both Barcelona and to the Casa Camper.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this hotel if you want to be where the action is...”
Reviews.Author: lonnybom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located and suberbly designed. It is close to museums, las ramblas and other quaint shops. It's security is tight (the staff only opens the door to would-be guests and other guests have their own key to enter). Unlike other chic hotels, this one has a relaxed and more down-to-earth vibe. The staff is friendly, attentive and helpful. A small corner of the hotel is specifically open all day long to hungry guests with free pastries, sandwiches and drinks. The rooms are lovely, spacious and all have a separate chill-out area with a hammock. Go there and you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back...”
Reviews.Author: QueenA
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here with my partner. We had a room (or 2 rooms) on the 5th floor. the 2 room set up is fine - we never saw anyone else when we made the cross. The main room is nicely done but a bit dark when you're trying to find your money/room card/map etc. Got very attached to the hammock in the lounge that faces the tv while my partner had a siesta. The reception staff are great and very knowledgeable about local restaurants etc. Breakfast is really good with a wide selection. All day buffet is fairly limited - sandwiches, salads, yoghurt mainly but good for a snack and who wants to hang out in the hotel lobby while you're in Barcelona?! Hotel is situated in the upper raval which is currently the hippest area of Barcelona. Contrary to what some people might have read, the upper raval is very safe, quite touristy but with bars/restaurants a plenty. Hotel is literally 3 mins walk from Museum of Modern Art. As an aside, the lower raval still has 'edge' so not a place to sightsee with the kids. Really recommend restaurant/bar Dos, Trice. 5 mins walk from hotel. Eat in the basement (smoking even if like us you don't smoke). Decor is a cross between a David Lynch film set and a brothel. ..Food really good and cheap. Full of locals. They do a good mojito too. this is the 2nd time I've been to barcelona and I can't wait to go back. Would stay at casa camper again too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Hwolfe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December for 3 nights with husband. There are many great hotels in Barcelona but wanted something a little different... Casa Camper is very cool but comfortable. Has a very "Barcelona"-feel to it. The design is fantastic (& the store Vincon is great to visit if you're interested in seeing more of it...) Stayed in a suite which was huge although a little dark. Not sure how the 2-part room would've worked for us, this was perfect and had a fab bath-tub. We were very happy with absolutely everything. Also borrowed the bikes and went for a ride along the beach which was brilliant. Highly recommend it although it won't be to everyone's taste.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: theTraveLees
Reviews.Content: The bedroom was huge, with a huge bathroom & truly awesome shower. Our room was very dark, though - just one window in the bathroom, which was eye-level with a courtyard (talk about no privacy!). The courtyard seemed to be accessible only to hotel employees, but we always kept the shades closed in case anyone walked by. But even with that window, we got zero sunlight - which meant that we were waking up at 2pm b/c our bodies never knew what time it was. Very disorienting, esp if your body is already trying to adjust to the time difference. We didn't really use the room across the hall very much, partly because the heat didn't work in there - we could have done without it, though the hammock was nice. Also nice was getting a variety of TV channels in English - a nice change. It was great having free food there - breakfasts made to order in the morning were pretty good, and it was really nice to have snacks and drinks available at any time of the day. When we read earlier reviews, we though we might end up eating some of our meals at the hotel, since they served sandwiches and other stuff, but that never happened b/c we found the prepackaged sandwiches & other substantial food to be really... not that good. The smaller things were fine, though (cheese, fruit), and free drinks was a great thing. The location is great - it's close to Las Ramblas but not so close that it was noisy. It's also pretty close to a metro stop and a lot of buses. If you're coming from the train station or airport, we'd recommend taking a cab here. The alley the hotel is in is pedestrian-only except for cabs. The staff was nice & very helpful, and everyone seemed to speak some English. When we left something behind in our room, they were really great about overnighting it to us at our next hotel in Madrid. We loved that the hotel is environmentally conscious. This is definitely a place for younger people - most people we saw there belonged to our demographic (25-34). The whole place is super-trendy & cool - not a place my parents would have liked at all! The only downside is that they started construction next door the morning of our departure reeeeally early in the morning - that was unfortunate. Don't know how long it will last, but the Camper shoe store next door is getting a complete makeover. We stayed there in Nov 2007, so anyone staying here should definitely check to see if/when construction is finished.

Reviews.Title: “Different!”
Reviews.Author: Coopers4
Reviews.Content: This property suited our family very well. We are a family of 2 adults and 2 teenagers and having been travelling together for a month we all felt the need for some time apart. The unusual arrangement at Casa Camper, where each room has a separate living room across the hallway, provided exactly what we needed. The 'living room' has a tv, desk, couch and hammock, all of which were useful. The bedrooms are comfortable and quirky. There is no enclosed wardrobe, just open shelves and a line of Shaker style pegs the length of the bedroom on which to hang things - even the TV and hotel information hang from pegs. The bathroom is not enclosed and looks out on a wall stacked with aspidistra in pots. It is all stylishly executed and practical enough. The living rooms face the street while the bedrooms overlook a small courtyard so are very quiet. What really sold our 2 teenagers on the hotel though is the excellent lounge/breakfast/snack room on the ground floor. Not only is the buffet breakfast complimentary but drinks and snacks are available at no charge throughout the day. They loved being able to help themselves whenever they felt like it. The food was also very good. The staff here were very welcoming and friendly, with useful recommendations about where to go and where to eat. The hotel is small and has quite an intimate feel to it. It is also very well located , just off La Rambla in the Raval area. The Museum of Contemporary Art is just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: california_girl007
Reviews.Content: An amazing place. They provided food 24 hr. with their theme of "open kitchen" so when you are jet lagged a nice place to feel at home. Also free bicycles to tour around the city and give your feet a rest. Loved the rooms which were clean and nicely designed. The staff were the best!

Reviews.Title: “A little Treasure!!”
Reviews.Author: Blayney
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper is the funkiest hotel I have ever stayed in. This hotel made my holiday. The location is excellant..just off La Ramblas. The staff were extremely friendly with excellant english. Can't recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jon Potter
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the 3rd floor suite here in early Dec. 2007. The suite was very comfortable and quite spacious. Our living area had a table, 2 chairs, a sofa, side tables and a hammock (handy for siestas!). The living area had a tiny balcony from which we could watch the happenings of the tiny (mostly pedestrian) street that the hotel is situated on. There was also a flat screen tv but we spent most of our time looking down onto the street below. The bedroom has no windows itself as it is situated between the living area and the bathroom. We had a comfortable king sized bed. There were some shelves and hooks to help keep this area tidy but it was a bit of a squeeze to keep 2 medium sized suitcases in this area. The bedroom area was a little dark at times, due to the fact that it had no windows. There was a tivoli audio radio, a great safe with power supply (to enable charging whilst storing electronic devices) and camper slippers. The bathroom was really lovely and looked out onto the vertical garden at the back of the hotel and was spacious and well set up. The shower (in bath) was great (nice and hot, and great pressure) as were the towels, robes and toiletries. The noise from the street below could get quite loud but we didn't find it too bad in the bedroom area, once the balcony and bedroom doors were shut. On our first night we had quite a lot of internal noise in our living area. This was due to our neighbours moving between their living and bedroom area a lot (on either side of the corridor). They had both their doors open and were yelling at one another from room to room. Luckily our stays only coincided for the 1 night. The staff was always friendly and willing to help out. The rooftop bar area had a lovely view and was a nice place to enjoy a drink and relax. The free wi-fi internet in room was a nice touch, as was the computer (also with internet access) provided in the lobby. The free breakfast (and all day snacks) provided was always fresh, tasty and generally healthy. It was really nice to be able to pop down to the communal cafe downstairs and help ourselves to snacks whenever we wanted! There was an option for a cooked breakfast in the mornings too. The information compendium in the room and the brochures in the communal area were useful. The hotel is well located for a lot of the major sites within the city (eg Las Ramblas, the old gothic quarter), public transport and shopping. There are also quite a few bars and restaurants in the area. We walked down Las Ramblas to the port within 20 mins. We walked to the food market on Las Ramblas one morning and bought lots of nice goodies which we ate in our living area for lunch. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best ever!”
Reviews.Author: chefsw
Reviews.Content: my wife and i have stayed in some wonderful hotels the world over,but never have we stayed in a hotel with staff as good as those at Casa Camper. thank you so much for being so helpful and pleasent and especially for the little surprises left in our room on hearing of the surprise we got from our son when he told us on the roof terrace that we were to become grandparents it was truly very touching thank you so much to all concerned oh and the hotel itself is fantastic by the way great location and enjoyed the 24 drinks and snacks,see you soon i hope

Reviews.Title: “Casa Camper Superb”
Reviews.Author: goonerbear
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the Casa Camper from Dec 18 2007 for 4 nights. From the moment we arrived the staff were excellent. In some 5* hotels we have stayed in the staff have been so pretentious its unbelievable (the Skt Petri in Copenhagen is a excellent example of this) however this is not the case here, they are all young and extremely helpfull and approachable, the fact they wear T-shirts reduces the stuffy atmosphere sometimes found in these sort of hotels. We had room 25 which is a suite,the bathroom,bedroom and lounge are all connected and not seperated by the corridor. this means you can use the balcony in the lounge without crossing the corridor, which is probably more important if you stay during the hot summer months. The room was superb and the bed extremely comfortable, never had a bad nights sleep. The hoel offers free food 24hrs a day, this includes pastrys, pasta, cakes, sandwiches, crisps, bottled juices, water and coffee, these are available in the lobby area,you just help yourself and take to your room or eat there as often as you like! A cooked breakfast is available, you just ask the friendly chefs and they cook it then and there along with a more continental style breakfast buffet. The hotel has a terrace which will be nice in the summer and a weird vertical garden.The location is superb just off Las Ramblas, just make sure the taxi driver knows where it is,ours didnt. All in all a superb hotel,excellent staff and great location. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: kaycameron100
Reviews.Content: My husbnd and I stayed here 2 years ago and loved it. On subsequent visits to Barcelona the hotel was always fully booked. This month my 28 yr -old daughter and I stayed in a suite while we soaked up Barcelona's special Christmas atmosphere. She adored the hotel and the 24-hour snack bar. For a totally quirky hotel experience combined with comfort and the nicest and most efficient hotel staff I've ever met we cannot recommend Casa Camper too highly- even if it means having even more difficulty getting booked! The Cameron family, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Well, I'm sorry...”
Reviews.Author: Geoffram
Reviews.Content: but I'm obviously in the minority. How stupid to have a lounge on the other side of a public corridor to the bedroom. Why would I want to see others in their undies flitting to their loved ones across the corridor? But this is typical of the whole hotel: someone thought it a bright idea: like putting the bedrooms on the inside so that there was no window. Or the run of hooks across one wall so that the door to the bathroom couldn't close completely. Or for that matter having no minibar so that if you woke up in the middle of the night with a slaking thirst, you had to trot downstairs to reception to get a drink. Or what was pretentiously called tentempié - hot and cold snacks throughout the day - which proved to be a pea soup in an electric tureen and some sandwiches inthe fridge. All in all, the hotel was designed for looks rather than practicality: fine if one was in one's twenties and paying 100 Euros a night, but this was more than twice that amount. Stick to making shoes, boys.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time at Casa Camper”
Reviews.Author: A_J_TLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our first trip to Barcelona where we celebrated our anniversary at the wonderful Casa Camper. Nothing was too much trouble for the friendly staff and we simply had to write a review of the hotel as it really made our trip special. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel tremendously welcome and relaxed. We stayed in a suite on the 5th floor which was very spacious and hip. The bed was large and very comfy and the lighting set the perfect ambience. The room encompassed a large living area with plasma screen TV etc and a very relaxing hammock and french doors from which you could step out and look down on the street below. The bathroom was also nicely sized with generous products to use and a fantastic power shower (and bath) - just what was needed after a day sightseeing in barcelona. We loved the unique design of the hotel from the lobby area through to the gorgeous roof terrace from which we enjoyed many a drink in the early evenings before going out for late dinner. The other remarkable thing about Casa Camper is the free food served 24 hours a day in the cafeteria. You can literally help yourself anytime to a selection of sandwiches, salads, cakes, pastries, yoghurts, crisps and a wide range of juices and soft drinks. All of this is included in yoru room rate and was a welcome addition to our stay. The location is also brilliant - on a small side street off Las Ramblas. The museum of contemporary art is at the end of the street and there are numerous lovely restaurants/cafes/bars nearby such as 'Es' meditaerranean restaurant and 'El Lobo' tapas restaurant - both very enjoyable and off the main tourist strip of Las Ramblas. We had a fantastic trip and cant reccommend this hotel highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “An age shrinking expreience”
Reviews.Author: crawfie
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper... how do you categorise a hotel like this? The first thing that you experience is the wonderful staff. I couldn't give enough praise in how helpful, friendly and genuinely caring they were. Nothing was too much trouble. The hotel itself is a tad unusual. Reception (and everywhere else) is painted in the camper shoes corporate colours. The reception area doubles as breakfast / snack area and has the initial impression of a giant upmarket youth hostel. There are free nibbles/salads/pastries and soft drinks available here 24 hrs a day. Alcoholic drinks are available for sale at reasonable prices. There is an amazing roof terrace, with excellent views of the Barcelona skyline. The rooms are to say the least quirky. there is a clever eco light switching environment, and the shower had the best pressure I've seen in a hotel shower for years. Each room has a lounge (replete with a second plasma screen TV) across the corridor. These have a balcony to the street side and a hammock. The bed was very comfortable, and the vertical garden view to the rear a novel idea. I was a bit confused why I had a pair of condoms left beside the bed. I thought it was a couple of chocolates at first! Still this is Barcelona! The location is excellent. It is just far enough away from the Ramblas to make it real. If you want to go to the Barri Gothic it is only a few minutes away. The hospitality and feel about the place takes years off your life, and lets you experience a welcome not typical of Catalunya. I certainly have no reservations in recommending Casa Camper.

Reviews.Title: “Great great”
Reviews.Author: surinameSuriname
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in and experience luxury, then you should stay at the casa camper hotel . The hotel was GREAT!! the staff was friendly and courteous. A great hotel in a beautiful city!!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: baburshah
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel ! For a nightly rate of 260€ you get a nice suite with very intrelligent and useful amenities, great bathroom products, unlimited food and soft drinks and the amazing, kind staff you cousl ever wish. This is not a snooty, snubbish place full of chintz and ultra-luxurious amenities but what you get for this price is outstanding and in a beautiful, central location. I am hard to impress after travelling in more than 200 places but this place is definitely on my top list. Just go and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Casa Camper Perfect For Open Minded Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Sanibelle1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Camper for 2 nights based on its outstanding reviews on Trip Advisor. This is not a hotel for everyone, but if you are open to new things and like contemporary, modern hotels, this just might be for you. It is located down a little street about two blocks from the Ramblas. Our taxi left us off about two blocks away despite our protests. We had just had a bag stolen at the airport and were not in the best frame of mind and ready to walk through the streets with our remaining bags. However, that was what we had to do as our taxi driver yelled after us, chastising us for even questioning the place where he let us out. The hotel is very stark and you have to be buzzed into the very plain lobby. The staff (all two of them) were young, hip and very helpful and they took us to our room to show us how things worked. The room was also very plain and somewhat cold, with dark red walls and black concrete floors. The main room faced a dark courtyard and the sitting area was actually across the hall which is somewhat inconvenient and we only used it to store our suitcases. It would prove very useful for a family with older children as I think it had a pullout couch. Amenities in the room were minimal but bottles of water were by our bed and Casa Camper's version of "crocs" were provided with new inner soles to wear in the room along with new age music coming out of the radio. The best part of the hotel was the open pantry in the lobby where breakfast was served. It was stocked 24 hours a day with nice salads, sandwiches, nuts, chips, yogurt, sodas, desserts, juices, etc and we took full advantage of it. They also provided internet access, including a printer, free of charge as well as shelves of books to take and share. The young staff could not have been more helpful and nice and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “loved the ambience”
Reviews.Author: teamRW
Reviews.Content: great service! BA lost our luggage and they were so helpful in calling the airline etc to get it back. they all speak great english. the free food is wonderful! The rooms very funky too. Highly recomend it. Great spot too but hard to find! loved the smell in the foyer too! a scented candle perhaps. Really cool place to stay and is a stand out for me in my 6 week europe holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Galapita
Reviews.Content: Just returned for 4 night at Casa Camper, and loved it. It is in a great location, and the room much larger then I thourgt from the pictures, and very quiret. The staff were great and helped with all you quistions, from trips to restaurants, very helpful. It is hip, without being over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: miabonds
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the excellent reviews I had read. I wasn't at all disappointed in my room which not only had a large bedroom and shower room (with 2 showers!) but also had a separate hallway with wardrobe and personal safe. The room was very clean and comfortable. The location of the hotel is excellent, quiet but central. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Camper is the Coolest!”
Reviews.Author: Shady-Grove
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 LOVED this hotel. We stayed in a suite so my husband and I could have the bedroom and the kids (ages 4 and 7) could stay in the living area. The living area came complete with flat screen TV, wall-size city map, and hammock! The location was perfect, just off La Rambla and Placa Catalunya on a cute narrow street near the Museum of Contemporary Art. The staff was exceedingly helpful, the decor cool and modern, and the rooms were far bigger than we expected. The large bathroom even had the option of a rainfall-type shower head. No minibar charges here--there was free food about 23 hours a day. In the morning they would make you pancakes or eggs along with bread selections, yogurt, drinks, etc. The rest of the day you could choose from a variety of sandwiches, cheese, yogurt, soup, juices, bottled water, and soda. Totally appreciated when you are jet-lagged and your eating is off-schedule. They also have a roof deck, bicycle rental, book exchange, wine for sale, and enjoyable bath products. We handled our reservation via email with no problems. We can't wait to return to Barcelona and Casa Camper!

Reviews.Title: “Can't get much better than this!”
Reviews.Author: mdp_az
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt the best hotel I've ever stayed in. The staff were top notch and provided a lot of personal service, great recommendations and a relaxed and friendly vibe. The property itself is awesome in a nice location near the Rambla, but far enough removed so that once inside your sleeping room you hear nothing but silence (unless you've returned after turn down when you'll hear the Tivoli radio playing soft classical music). The rooms are funky, minimalist, and quite comfy. The bed was awesome, there was adequate storage for clothes and extra luggage on the shelves, and the save was very convenient. The bathroom was amazing...words cannot do that shower justice. It did my enviro mind well knowing that water was solar heated and being re-used, b/c I definitely lingered in that shower for longer than normal! The vertical garden was a nice and unique touch, and the shade was great for creating a completely dark room. Across the hall, the lounge was so nice to come back to after a long day in the city. We'd pick up some drinks and snacks in the Tentempie (no addl. cost, of course!) and relax on the sofa while watching the nice sized LCD TV. I also opened the terrace doors a couple of times and chilled out in the hammock. Breakfasts were awesome...pancakes were amazing and like nothing I can make at home. The rooftop terrace was very nice and provided a beautiful view of the city and Tibidabo, and on the crowds below heading to/from the Rambla. So, now for the negatives. The lighting in the room and lounge was not very good, but was adequate in the bathroom. Some of the light switches seemed not to operate anything or function correctly. The TV in the room had different (and less) channels available than the one in the lounge. Minor complaint I know, but it just seemed a bit strange. There were more English channels available in the lounge, which is where I watched the most TV...go figure. The wooden bikes looked very cool, and we were hoping to take a couple out for an hour or so for a ride to the beach. I never saw anywhere that there was an additional cost for the bikes before booking, however they quoted a rental rate of something like 15 euro for a 1/2 day per bike. While that is not painfully expensive, I think they could do a better job of advertising the bikes as an amenity that costs extra. The only other negative is that I'm not still there.

Reviews.Title: “Staff in a league of their own”
Reviews.Author: SunsetJohn
Reviews.Content: In decades of business and pleasure travel around the world, I can honestly say that the staff at the Casa Camper are among the most accommodating, gracious, and helpful I've encountered anywhere. Each and every one seemed to have a passion for their job and for extending true customer service and a warm welcome. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Casa Camper while we explored Barcelona for 3 days pre-cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Martijn-de-Vries
Reviews.Content: After beining horrible disapointed in our booked B & B, Suzanna and her team made it all well in one seconde. When they heard we were on our honeymoon, they went upstairs en decorated the rooms with roses en champagne. They treat us so personally that it looked as if we stayed with friends. Ever morning they spoiled us with Coffee, Breakfast and Dutch newspapers. It is a small hotel, so they can and will give you all attention. They gave us names of restaurants, where only the Spanisch people eat and we have rarely eat that good before. Besides your large sleeping room, you also have an private lounge room. The roof terras will give you a beautiful view over Barcalona.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Camper, oh so good!”
Reviews.Author: 2IrishYoungOnes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for five nights at Casa Camper in Barcelona and truly it was one of the best holidays we have ever had. I had been trying to decide whether to book with Casa Camper or another hotel. I was going to surprise my husband on the accommodation front so I was a little nervous as I wanted to get it right. Casa Camper as it is not your traditional type of hotel and I worried that perhaps it would be too funky for us. Don't get me wrong we are mid-40's, young at heart but I for one like my comfort especially as I travel a lot for work and I was worried my husband might not be too crazy on this hip design concept. I was going out on a limb here or so I thought. He wasn't disappointed and neither was I. Comfort and hip were parallel, nothing was sacrificed. The design of this hotel is superb. It's the finer details that are looked after. From the massive beds with pure cotton bed linen, air conditioning, bottles of water being left in your room, a large safe for all your valuables, your bed being turned down with classical music tuned on your radio lulling you into your bedroom to huge fluffy bath towels; robes and slippers at your disposal. The showers are incredible, like a fire hose which definitely wakes you up. We had a suite so also had a bath and that was a luxury to soak in after a long day pounding the streets of Barcelona sightseeing. The hammock placed right next to the windows (with French doors and a teeny, tiny balcony – just perfect), so you can absorb the Catalan vibe from the streets below. The music that plays in the reception area and lifts is all designed, not just your regular CD's on a loop. I can't say that I heard the same songs twice and the music at breakfast was always nice and jazzy. It was great! The help yourself to salads, snacks and drinks anytime was brilliant. You would think that you would over indulge but you didn't. Water was a lifesaver. Just bring up a couple of bottles to your room and then more was delivered later. The breakfasts were great. The chef cooked what you ordered in the line of eggs, tortillas, bacon, etc. There were cold meats, cheeses, lots of perfectly presented sliced fruit (no pith!), pastries, yoghurt, cereals, bread to toast, juices, tea, coffee, I can go on... The city is a walker's city so the location of the hotel is spot on. About two blocks off Las Ramblas but very, very quiet. You might hear the green parakeets chatting away in the daytime on the palm trees nearby - amazing to see so many of them. The roof terrace is a great place to chill, grab a drink and take it up there. A real feel of the city, with views as far as the eye can see. Boy, this place was the best; totally different, great atmosphere and absolutely fantastic staff (who were friendly and most helpful but not intrusive). Because it was so relaxed and chilled, the staff really made it for us. There was always a friendly face, a "Hello!" and "How was your day?". It was never any trouble to recommend somewhere, book a restaurant or post a letter. They were so kind. And their recommendations were spot on. It was also nice that they asked us about a tapas bar we had been raving about because one of the other guests wanted to go there. That was cool to share info. Very observant! I had read up on Trip Advisor prior to booking this hotel and as one reviewer had said he would go back in a heartbeat - I can understand that. We plan to go back next year. The hotel might be a little more expensive than others but it makes sense to us to stay somewhere where we know it will be comfortable, clean, safe and friendly. Hats off to Casa Camper! Excellent - Five Star Rating all the way! Well done! To all the staff who were just great, thank you and especially Fernanda, Gemma, Guillermo and Sarah A seriously funky but extremely welcoming and comfortable hotel. Apparently, they will be opening one in Berlin sometime soon - I always wanted to visit that city too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mroth
Reviews.Content: Came to the Casa Camper from the Ritz Madrid so it was a change but it was still most excellent.......get the suite....not the reg rooms for you have to cross the corridor to go bathroom/bedroom to living area.....we had the sutie and it was great...... Staff most excellent...small hotel......very cool We loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Different!”
Reviews.Author: Karenherts
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Casa Camper last weekend and had a great stay. When you arrive at the hotel, there's an immediate wow factor and the fact that you can only get into the reception area with a special swipe card made us feel quite priveleged! The rooms were great, but to be honest I'm not sure that the two rooms (one being a bedroom and one being a lounge across the corridor) really worked for me. But it was a nice novelty and I can imagine would be great if you were travelling in a family or with a few other people. The bedrooms were a good size though and the fittings were top quality. I really appreciated the little design touches like the wall of plants outside the window (hard to explain, but very cool), the light fittings etc. I ended up taking lots of pictures as inspiration for our own home! The bottles of wine and beer in reception were a good idea and we'd come back to the hotel after eating out and buy a bottle of wine to drink on the sixth floor veranda. If it was closed for the evening the staff were really helpful and opened it up (although you need to get out at the fith floor and walk up one flight of stairs). It was like our little haven above the hustle and bustle of the streets below. The 'open' self service area was also a really nice touch for the odd snack and soft drink and breakfasts were really tasty. All in all we really enjoyed our stay. It wasn't the best hotel we have ever stayed in, but it was the quirkiest and I felt a real sense of personality, that I haven't experienced in any other hotel. All in all we would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel - Excellent in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Tilly19
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from the Casa Camper Hotel in Barcelona. We booked following the recommendations of fellow trip advisors, as the best hotel in Barcelona. We would certainly highly recommend this hotel. My teenage children loved it. The hotel was in a perfect location, a few steps from the Ramblas, and was very interesting and contemporary in design. The best part was the free 24 hour buffet serving unlimited snacks and drinks. You could choose a snack and take it up to the roof terrace, with beautiful views of Barcelona. The bedroom was really cool in design, as was the sitting area across the corridor. The children loved the hammock in the sitting room. One of the best parts of our stay was the friendly and helpful staff. They could not do enough for you and were happy to provide directions and restaurant recommendations. I contacted them by email before my stay, and they were very prompt at replying and the emails were written in perfect English. Go and stay at the Casa Camper, a different and wonderful hotel. We certainly can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Offering something genuinely different (and brilliant!)”
Reviews.Author: PaulReason
Reviews.Content: Offering something genuinely different (and brilliant!). We’ve been fortunate enough to stay at some very luxurious hotels over the recent years. There are far more luxurious hotels than Casa Camper. It doesn’t have a restaurant, concierge service, 24hr room service or a fitness centre. What it does have is unique character offering a unique experience without being your usual contemporary, but superficial, minimalist setup. Location - It’s perfectly placed in one of the most charismatic districts and is opposite a very cute infant school with glorious palm tree garden frontage. We have a 14 month old daughter and we took her to the small swing park in the square just around the corner surrounded by cafes.
