There are great café’s and restaurants (Mama Café and Es) seconds from the hotel. You can also walk to the gothic quarter in 5 mins. Service – I’ve never had service like this before. You need lots of it with a baby and they gave in abundance. Friendly, informal, pre-emptive – fantastic. Felt different from the Four Seasons style “we’ll give great service because you’re paying for it”. They spoilt my daughter to death, organised food to be brought in for us (including carrying it from a local restaurant), provided us with really helpful tourist advice etc etc. BRILLIANT! Style – The architect really did an amazing job on this place. With a standard room you get two rooms. A lounge and a bedroom with bathroom. The lounge is on the street side and the bedroom faces the vertical garden. In the bedroom, silence. In the lounge with the balcony overlooking the narrow pedestrian street, atmosphere. You feel connected to the city. We were on the first floor and it did get quite loud with people talking, skateboarders and the odd mo-ped. We actually loved this because you could feel the personality of Barcelona. With a young child having somewhere to sit and have a glass of wine, whilst being completely separate from the baby was a true godsend. The rest of the hotel works so well with stylish and surprisingly practical design. The music, 24hour café, roof terrace, room design, eco friendly nature (even the water is recycled!) furniture etc all work together perfectly. Value – for what you get this is amazing. It’s affordable and the service/environment makes you feel great. Book now, consider no other. We did leave wearing two pairs of new Campers purchased from the shop around the corner. I suspect many other do the same. Ingenious, really.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in BCN”
Reviews.Author: katrineCPH
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 3 nights at Casa Camper, and we wish we could have stayed for more. We are a small family of two adults and one child aged 6, so we didn't think that the two-room concept was such a good idea for us and opted for the suite. We were very glad that we did, but if our daughter had been older we could definitely see the benefits of the divided living-/bedroom idea. When we arrived we were very warmly welcomed by two staff members, one sorted out all the paperwork and while the other showed us to the free "minibar" and told us to sit down and have a drink. What a nice touch, the free minibar really is a great idea. Our suite was HUGE - living room with chairs, table, sofa (doubled as a bed at night), tv, hammock and balcony, bedroom with BIG bed, safe and radio, bathroom with tub and plenty of space. We liked the view from the bathroom - you look out to a vertical garden. It took some time to get used to the fact that you have a very large window in the bathroom, but noone can look inside, and there are blinds if you don't like the feeling... The decor is modern but sparse. we liked the bathroom best. The location really can't be beat - close to the Gothic Quarter and PLaca Catalunya and of course the Ramblas. Our favorite is the Raval quarter where the hotel is situated, and we loved all the squares and cafes just outside the hotel doors. Just around the corner on C/Doctor Dou is a great bakery, BarcelonaReykjavik, and just across the street you'll find the best bookstore in town. The Bar Kasparo on square next to bookstore is great for a drink and a snack with the locals. As said, the free minibar is a great idea - all day fruit, sandwiches, soft drinks, youghurts, cakes, tea and Nespresso coffee - meaning that you don't have to hunt around for supermarkets to buy water bottles. The breakfast was nice but nothing special. All members of staff were helpful and really did all they could to ensure that our stay was great. One thing: We had read here on TA and on other website that there should be an inroom dvd, but there wasn't. We asked for one at reception, and they installed one later same day, but they first had to make sure that they had one available. So just ask if you want one. We had a truly great stay at CAsa Camper and can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jenniejen101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Camper for 2 nights at the beginning of August and thoroughly enjoyed every minute of Barcelona and the hotel. Prior to our stay at Casa Camper, I emailed the hotel requesting a bottle of champagne and a fruit basket to be placed in our room for our wedding anniversary. They promptly replied to each email and assisted us in our transfer from the Airport to the hotel. We took the Aerobus which took us to Placa Cataluna within 20mins and a very short walk (about 5mins) we arrived the hotel. It is very secure and you need a pass to get through the door. When we arrived the receptionist was busy checking in another guest and a member of staff took us and showed us around the snack bar and got us settled with a drink whilst we waited for the receptionist to finish. the hotel have lots of tourist information - maps, guides, general info. The hotel room was very comfortable and everything was provided for you - even condoms!! Our Champagne and fruit was laid out very romatically in our lounge room and this room was aldso very comfortable. I know that you do not go on holiday to watch TV but after a long day of travelling, all we wanted todo was have a shower and relax with a glass of bubbly and film and it was nice that we had the option to watch a film in english!!. Breakfast was good and the staff were very helpful. After we checkeed out of the room, they allowed us to remain in the lobby/dining area to have a drink before we set off. We would not hesitate staying here again and we are looking forward to seeing more of these hotels appearing around the world - apparantly there are plans for belgium next.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Camper really is as fabulous as they say”
Reviews.Author: spaintraveler2
Reviews.Content: My family stayed for 5 nights in a suite at the Casa Camper in Barcelona. It really is as fabulous as the reviews that I read on Trip Advisor before I booked. The staff at the desk were friendly and helpful at everything that we needed, and were much better at speaking English than most of Spain! When we told them that we had lost luggage, they took care of calling the airline to make sure that it was delivered, which was a huge help! The breakfasts were fabulous! The chef made spectacular omelets, and the fruit and pastries were excellent. The hotel included 24-hour snack bar was different than in any other hotel where I have stayed. In Spain, lunch is a 1 2 hour affair. It was so nice to be able to get something quick and healthy at the snack bar when we didn't want to spend that much time on lunch or get fast food. The hotel was a nice, relaxing haven on our Spanish vacation. It was great to be able to grab a drink from the 24-hour snack bar and go up to the terrace to read the paper or just check out the view of the city. The bedroom, common room, and bathroom in the suite were very spacious for the 3 of us. The windows in the bathroom made it a light and airy atmosphere. The slippers to use in the room were a nice touch! It was nice to see the efforts the hotel made at sustainability, like reusing The hotel is located off Las Ramblas and near the Plaza Catalunya, which are the center of the city. This makes the Casa Camper a great location for tourists. Overall this was an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Casa Camper”
Reviews.Author: Radler
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed our stay at Casa Camper. It lived up to all expectations. We had a suite, which was superb in every way. The building itself is a designers dream and a lot of thought and attention to detail has gone into everything. The staff were very friendly but professional at the same time. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WaneeD
Reviews.Content: You can believe all the excellent reviews for Casa Camper. If your budget allows it, do not even consider staying any place else. We stayed in a suite and really liked the layout. The shower is the best in the world. We especially liked the large shampoo, soap, and conditioner dispensers; much easier to manage with soapy hands than little bottles. There was no street noise and we were on the 1st floor (2nd floor for Americans). The service and attitude of the staff was always friendly and very helpful. The hotel is very secure and located in a great, safe neighborhood with lots of restaurants within 5 minutes walk. Nearby restaurants offer everything from tapas to Med/Asian fusion. There is a little plaza 1/2 block from the hotel that is great for people watching. Las Ramblas and Catalunya Plaza are very close. Casa Camper is our new favorite hotel, please don't change anything.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: kansastraveller
Reviews.Content: We had such an amazing time at Casa Camper, the only negative thing was we couldn't stay longer! Casa Camper is such an amazing place. We had such a great time! We had stayed at two other hotels in Barcelona and had such a negative view of Barcelona and thankfully we booked two nights at Casa Camper! We completely changed our view of Barcelona and loved every minute in our hotel and the city. It was rather late when we arrived but we were pleasently greeted by Sara and Sylas (both extrememly awesome individuals). They explained how the hotel worked and were taken to our room, which by the way was an amazing room! We were both so tired from traveling so we went back downstairs grabbed some snacks and wine and went to the terrace, it was sooooo wonderful and exactly what we needed. The food that was offered was really delicious! The salads, sandwiches, desserts and drinks are really great for being in the 'mini bar' I love the mini bar concept. Again, Casa Camper is worth every penny! The next morning, we went downstairs to eat breakfast and were greeted once again by Sylas and their amazing cook, who made anything we wanted for breakfast. The breakfast was amazningly delicious! I ordered an egg white omelette and it was the best egg white omelette I have ever eaten! It was so pretty! I highly recommend staying at Casa Camper because it is so comfortable, very unique and the staff is amazing (especially compared to the other places we stayed in Barcelona). Casa Camper is worth every penny and deserves to hold its #1 status on Trip Advisor. I can't hype this place up enough, we had an excellent stay and were treated really well and did not want to leave. We seriously considered staying an extra day just so we could stay at Casa Camper one night longer, it's that cool. I hope this review helps and urges you to book a couple of nights at a really great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Expedia or Casa Camper”
Reviews.Author: goodlife3
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper is a great location with very kind staff. Which leaves us baffled as to whether our dissappointment is in them or Expedia.com. We prebooked our hotel with many others on our Vacation and this was the only one that we didn't pay in full before leaving home. At the end of a month vacation we arrive to learn that even though our itinery quoted our daughter as 15 years old and a part of the reservation. She in fact would cost us an additional 95Euro or approx. $135. per night (for 4 nights!) and she would have to sleep alone across the hall from us. (no way to put any kind of bed in the main room). So of course my husband slept on the couch across the hall. Well with all the rooms in the area booked out, who are you going to argue with. Especially when you booked with Expedia not directly with the hotel. It was an expensive misleading experience to be warey of. But to be fair, the staff was helpful and nice and the rooms very clean and in a great location. Expedia says they are trying to resolve this but 3 weeks later we can not get a response. At this point no, I will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “What a place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: Lkp_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Casa Camper summer 2006 with my family. This boutique hotel is a fantasitc place to stay. I highly recommend it to anybody considering staying in Barcelona. Firstly, the location is ideal- just off Las Ramblas, therefore there is no noise to be heard, ensuring a great stay. It is literally at couple of minutes walk to the main street. Then, there is the hotel itself, which is spectactular. There is 24hr access to food, including freshly made breakfasts in the morning (which need to be ordered- recommended!). The spacious rooms are extremely modern with large beds, a flat screen tv, great amount of wardrobe space, and a bathroom area. The shower itself alone is fantastic (v.powerful). Each room has its own 'lounge' opposite, with a sitting area, hammock and another flat screen tv- somewhere to relax after a long day. This area has a view of a side street, just off Las Ramblas. The sevice in this chic hotel is brilliant, as are the staff who work here. Conclusively, I recommend this hotel, as there were no faults to be found. Although, some prefer a bar area, and this hotel does not provide one- but who needs this when you are in the busy city of Barcelona? I would definitely return- it's probably the most luxurious hotel that i've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Cool classy and staff who care”
Reviews.Author: JoyLeeds
Reviews.Content: the ambience is cool and calm - in this vibrant lively city that never sleeps. Excellent central location in quiet street. Well designed rooms -very comfy bed - brilliant walk in shower. LCD TV Radio and DVD. Loved the idea of 24hr healthy snacks - sandwich's -salads soup and organic juices (and cakes) great to come back to after long days sightseeing. Breakfast excellent the cook made whatever your request (with a smile)!. The staff were amazing in that they were attentive and genuinely seemed to care about our stay, esp Guillermo - always helpful and gave excellent restaurant recommendations. Christian (Silas) never stop smiling - couldn't do enough and was always there to provide the ice bucket for our champagne/wine in the evening. This was truly refreshing the staff as much as the design makes this hotel you can have great design and without good people it has no soul.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid.”
Reviews.Author: GeGa
Reviews.Content: Number 1 is the rating this Hotel has here on Tripadvisor and rightly so. This was my 4th. time staying here and I love it more each time I stay. You do it right Casa Camper, keep doing it as you do it now and you should be in top position for a long time to come. Great/splendid/amazing/etc. Question:- Why is the example of Casa Camper not followed more closely???

Reviews.Title: “A reality check -- cool hotel, but disappointing service all around”
Reviews.Author: quantum_jane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are writing this review together from our Casa Camper hotel room! We are here on our third night, and we have been saying for the past 72 hours “add that to the Trip Advisor review!” So we thought we’d write it down now, since the list has grown so long and while it is still in our memory. We call this review The Reality Check – since we booked the hotel based on the glowing “best hotel ever” reviews, and in reality, we have had one problem after another with this hotel. We have mixed feelings after our stay, and wanted to share them. We splurged on this hotel, and the level of service was just not up to what we would expect. (Hotels we enjoy a lot, by comparison, include the Langham Plaza in Hong Kong, the Four Seasons in Sydney, and the Avenue Hotel in Copenhagen – to give you a sense of where we’re coming from.) We give in two stars for service, five stars for location and design -- we average it out to 3.5/4 stars. First, the positive: This hotel is in an unbeatable location. That alone is a great reason to stay here. Also, it has a very cool, hip vibe, great showers, and the rooms are smart and well-designed. However, we have had a string of problems throughout our stay that frustrated us greatly, especially at the rate we paid – 220 Euro or 330 US dollars per night. We wanted to share them so that those of you who book here can temper your expectations a bit. We recommend that travelers looking for excellent service and concierges to think about booking elsewhere. - SMOKY ROOMS. The first night we checked in, we were given a room that smelled very strongly of cigarette smoke, even though it is a non-smoking hotel. We called down to ask about this, and the front desk acknowledged that they had smelled the smoke earlier when the made up the room. They said that they had opened the window in the bathroom and hoped that had helped, but it hadn’t. There was no other room to move us, they said, and they had no way to clear the smoke out. So we spent our first night sleeping in a room that was very uncomfortable for us, as non-smokers. This is a big deal for me, as I hate sleeping in smoky rooms. It really made for an unpleasant first night, and we were frustrated that they had noticed the problem earlier and not taken sufficient steps to resolve it before we checked in. To spend $330 USD for a cigarette-reeking room just made me sad. - THEY FORGOT TO GIVE US OUR WAKE-UP CALL. There is no alarm clock in the room. You need to rely on the wake up call or travel with your own – which we didn’t. So the second night, we were recovering from jet lag and requested a wake up call an hour before our dinner reservation at Comerc 24. They forgot to call us. We woke up ourselves eventually but it was a rush and we had to call the restaurant and request a later seating. With no alarms in the rooms, if you can't trust the front desk to give you your wake up call -- well, that's just not cool. - MANY FRONT DESK ERRORS. We depended on the front desk a couple of times, and we were really let down. First, when we really needed a cab quickly, they were unable to get one for us, even though when we checked in, we asked how difficult it was to get cabs and they said that it was no problem, to just call down. When they failed to get us a cab, my husband ran out into the street in front of the hotel and chased down a cab that had been parked out in front of the hotel. It seemed like something we could have gotten some help with – again, this is just a level of service. Later, we requested help booking train tickets. They said they would take care of it. But after a few hours we found out we had to go to the train service ourselves because you are unable to book those particular tickets over the phone. We only found this out because we stopped by the desk to inquire if everything was set. If we hadn’t asked, we would have returned home late at night, unable to get to the station and without any tickets for the next day. Also, the hotel says there are bikes to borrow, but when we checked on Saturday morning, they didn’t have any. Alas. These are little things, but my god, they add up! - FLAMENCO DANCING ON THE ROOF. If you want to sleep at midnight on a Saturday night, you might be in trouble – there was a troupe of Flamenco dancers on the roof two floors above us, which made for unbelievable stomping noises for a very long time. Although we were greatly disturbed by the noise, we weren’t allowed to even go up to the roof to enjoy the show, since it was for a private event. That also meant the Terrace, which we were hoping to hang out at Saturday night, was closed to us, which was disappointing. By itself, this wouldn’t be a big deal, but honestly, after all the other grief, it was just too much. CONCLUSION: We would only book here again only if we could do so at a reduced rate. If you are an extremely relaxed traveler, and the problems we had wouldn't be an issue for you, then by all means, this is a cool and comfortable hotel in a great location. If you want to be able to depend on the hotel for help with things or if you really need to get a good night's sleep, there might be better places for you in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Camper in Barcelona: a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: fvi
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location is very nice, you are in El Raval which is sometimes said to be dangerous; instead it is very charming and you don't get the impression of being among tourists only. The staff of the hotel are young, very nice, always ready to help you out, very professional and competent. My daughter (10) went crazy for the hammock: yes, there is one in every room! The only recommendation: if you like natural light, ask for the highest floor! I can't say about the price, it was a wonderful gift!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel i've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: benjackthomas
Reviews.Content: This is my favourite hotel I've ever stayed at. We (me and my girlfriend) had traveled up from Malaga on the night train (well worth doing - I think it was called trenhotel but it was genius cabins were brilliant) and arrived in Barcelona and was driven into the centre and down a small side street right in the centre was Casa Camper. The staff from the moment we arrived to the moment we left were ridiculously happy and helpful (i think we got more maps of Barcelona than it's humanly possible to carry). The breakfast was awesome and we even snuck some of the jams back to our rooms for snackage (you can't beat Bon Mamon). The room (the main room) was brilliant ultra modern and uber cool - ours was a black and red fest. You get an LCD TV on the wall, a cool radio, a DVD player (i think), a stupidly comfy bed, the best walk-in shower ever and lots of storage. You also get as a massive added bonus another room with a hamock and another TV and a comfy sofa. It's positioned right in the heart of Barcelona and is only minutes away from everything (well almost). Restaurant wise ask for the receptions recommendations of their favourite's we did this and were never disappointed. We also went to Nou Camp which i also thoroughly recommend. Bus to the airport was very easy (although had moaning English people on it - i think just to remind us we were going home).

Reviews.Title: “Back Again”
Reviews.Author: diamondrockfarm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Camper in early 2006 for our 40th wedding anniversary. We came back with 2 sets of friends on June 6, 2007. We loved the decor, the location, and the separate sitting room. The staff is wonderfully helpful. They will make recommendations for restaurants, call cabs, give directions, etc. All their restaurant suggestions were wonderful. We love the mini cafeteria with food and beverages available all the time. Our friends were thrilled with this hotel, and they think we have wonderful taste!

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Different,and Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MrJoelB
Reviews.Content: I'm currently writing from the lobby of Casa Camper. It is wonderul! Decent wireless Internet connection, unlike other hotels we've stayed at on this trip. Free snacks and beverages 24/7. Spacious rooms that are modern and functional. Super friendly and helpful staff. My wife and kids love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Casual luxury”
Reviews.Author: PVTexas
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy luxury but don't like the pretentiousness that often accompanies it, Casa Camper is the perfect hotel. It is a casual, comfortable hotel with a unique design and impressive service. The moment you enter the lobby, you sense the energy the exudes from the young, attentive and knowledgeable staff. You are greeted enthusiastically and provided a tour of the hotel facilities. I was a little concerned about the design of the accomodations which separate your bedroom and bath from the private lounge across the hall. However, this proved to be very well thought out, providing a quite room for sleeping in a busy city and a comfortable room for reading/siesta (in the hammock provided) overlooking the streets below. My kids, who shared a room, like the fact that sleeping room and the accompanying private lounge each had its own television. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the 24 snack bar was extremely handy given the strange dining hours that result from touring a large city like Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but fab”
Reviews.Author: Kizzylew
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful few days at the Casa Camper last year, and despite the expense I would recommend it. Great location in quiet street off Las Ramblas, the 24 hour 'cafe' area is great - we had breakfast and lunch here both days at no extra expense - plus any number of tempting snacks whenever we were worn out. Take a tray onto the top floor area and chill out. Love the green ethos of reusing water. Loved the decor - not sure about the mini living area idea (you get a private mini 'lounger' across the hall from your room) - maybe on a longer break you'd use the hammock area, but on such a short holiday we never really got much use of it. Most of all it was a laid back atmosphere, no pressure or fussiness from staff - you're just left to yourself unless you ask for help. Would love to return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at unique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rsp1
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper is a very unique hotel in the El Raval section of Barcelona, relatively close to the top of the Ramblas. The location is great -- Raval is roughly equivalent to the Lower East Side / E Village of New York (many students, hip scene, etc.). The hotel is close enough to the Ramblas to make anywhere in the city an easy walk (Gothic/Born, Pl Catalonya, etc). The hotel itself is interesting. The "rooms" are really composed of two separate rooms (divided by the hallway). The main room has the bedroom and bathroom. The second room is a lounge with hammock and desk and large framed wall-map of the area. The bedroom has a flatscreen, safe, Tivoli radio (with aux input for ipod). Storage space is plentiful and there are some creative touches in the bathroom area. The lounge has another flatscreen and telephone. The whole hotel has free wifi. Surprisingly, there was turndown service in the evening. The best touch, however, is the free food/drink available 24/7 in the lobby (soda/bottled water - even redbull, snacks, coffee, sandwiches/salads, etc). The staff is incredibly helpful and generally speaks excellent English.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Camper Excelente!”
Reviews.Author: chgowanderer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Camper in mid-May. The room configuration with a seperate mini lounge worked out wonderfully for me as I traveled with my 19 year old son. We both had our privacy. The rooms were clean with many amenities. The staff was wonderfully friendly and very helpful with answers to all our questions. The cooked to order breakfast was beyond anything we've had in a European hotel. One day pancakes with Nutella!!!!! Food available all day was definitely a benefit. Location was excellend and convenient to Placa de Catalunya and all forms of transit. We loved Barcelona and the Casa Camper!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: sgbslo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Camper for 2 nights after a cruise. Before our cruise we stayed at the Hotel Claris which is totally different from the Casa Camper but we liked both hotels. The Casa Camper is an eco-friendly, young, hip place. The staff are all young and wear t-shirts with the hotel logo. They were all very helpful and knowledgeable about the area. The rooms are somewhat minimually furnished but very comfortable. The bathroom is nicely equipped and the shower is huge and has a "rainfall" nozzle. In addition to your sleeping room you also have a little sitting room across the hall with a sofa, desk, hammock and a small balcony. The only thing I didn't like about the bedroom is that the only window is in the bath area and it looks out on an enclosed courtyard so there's not much natural light in the room. The rate includes breakfast and snacks 24 hours. The snack selections were surprisingly good and included sandwiches, salads, fruits, cookies etc. The location is on a street in El Raval near the contemporary art museum and very near La Ramblas. It had a nice "neighborhood" sort of feeling yet was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: BaaCheshireUK
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel and had all of the things we wanted: *ulta cool design *very clean *small ( only 25 rooms ) so very personal service *central but no traffic noise *each room has own extra room across the hall with hammock/tv *24 hour snack and soft drinks bar (included in room rate) *old rennovated building in heart of old streets *cycle hire *free internet The things that made this hotel so special for us was: *the quality of the food in the snack bar and the breakfasts *the calm helpful staff *peaceful vibe inside hotel *the guest camper slippers - dead comfy '*normal' charges for telephone use *tipping refused by staff and this was great not because we are mean but because it is alien to British culture and I never quite know what the rules are when I am overseas - how much, to all staff ?, at end of stay? etcetera......... Other comments: *skateboard park around the corner so noise of wheels occasionally as they made their way there - didn't bother us but may bother others * we couldn't cycle as no bike for my 11 year old which was a shame but I can see that they can't stock for all ages of children

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Julytime
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Casa Camper in March 2007 for a 3 night visit to Barcelona. We chose the hotel mainly based on the reviews in Tripadvisor and would agree that it certainly lived up to the glowing reports it has received. It is a very modern hotel but is still very comfortable. The bedrooms are nice - very modern and the large shower area is nice. The 2 room idea is great - it's lovely to have a room other than your bedroom to relax in after a long day walking around the city. It was nice to be able to throw open the balcony doors and relax with a coffee while listening to the sounds coming up from the street before getting ready to go out for dinner. Also loved the fact that the all day snacks were included in the room rate. It's also in a great location - just off La Ramblas. I would certainly recommend Casa Camper to anyone planning a stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Youthful and modern”
Reviews.Author: Photopedia
Reviews.Content: What a breath of fresh air. A unique experience....most of it delightful but one or two negative points. The positives (and there were many): 1) Very helpful friendly staff 2) Personal internet booking service- staff offered to arrange restaurant bookings and an airport pickup via email 3)Central location just off La Ramblas but very quiet 4) Relaxing rooftop terrace 5) Free drinks and snacks available in the lobby 24 hours a day 6) Free internet access (one terminal) in the lobby The negatives: 1) Decor felt like a rather stark version of Habitat - funky but not comfy or homely. Lobby felt like a shop interior, not a hotel. 2) Bedroom and lounge were dark and rather unwelcoming. The coolness might have been a relief in the heat of the summer but not at the end of March. Despite these gripes, the overall experience was very positive because the staff were all so kind.

Reviews.Title: “Love the shoes, love the hotel...”
Reviews.Author: LLSL
Reviews.Content: We were interested to see how Camper shoe design would translate into a hotel. And like the shoes, this place is comfortable, user-friendly and quirky. As standard you get two rooms, one is a mini-lounge across the public hotel corridor from the bedroom. This was fine except that is where the extra bed is, and we couldn't leave our 8yr old son in what is effectively a separate hotel room. There is a mechanism for opening the doors without a key but he was too short to reach one switch. Never mind, he slept with me and my husband got the extra bed! Except there is no toilet there, so he had to come in and out in the middle of the night. This aside, everything else was great. They have thought of the smallest detail including a nightlight in the toilet, a fantastic shower, automatic blinds which really cut out the light, and a whole wall of hooks to hang your stuff on. there is no mini-bar-but instead you get a free all day snack buffet, which was wonderful. Breakfast was delicious,and the chef will cook up any of your favourite breakfast dishes. The receptions staff are tremendously helpful with directions, bus numbers etc. Overall a great experience. (By the way there is a Camper shoe shop just metres away from the main entrance...)

Reviews.Title: “Practically perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: CindyFRichmond
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on Barcelona hotels because this was not a trip I take every day, and I wanted it to be special - perfect even. Casa Camper was everything I could have expected and more. The hotel itself is warm, inviting and hip without being snooty. All of the service personnel I encountered looked me in the eye when greeting me, and several times addressed me by name. We got amazingly good advice when asking for recommendations or directions - Guillermo at the front desk was especially helpful. They have a little food bar that's open 24 hours with free drinks and snacks. In the morning, they will cook you a breakfast to order - all included in the price of the room! I had a suite, and both rooms were very comfortable.There was a small balcony that overlooked Carrer Elisabets, as well as a hammock you could hang out in! The location was perfect - right in back of the Contemporary Art museum, and a few block s from Las Ramblas, near Plaza Catalunya. The bathroom faced their unique vertical garden - very cool. The whole atmosphere perfectly matched the whole Camper shoe vibe - comfortable, fun, and kinda hip. I loved every minute there, and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Camper is the place to be at”
Reviews.Author: ibboibbo
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - I stayed there for 6 nights on a worktrip, and I must say that this hotel lived up to every single expectation of mine. The staff is incredibly helpful and kind. The minibar is excellent, and the rooms were spacious and very comfortable. The rooms were also very homey, it didn't feel like I was at a hotel. The private lounge which comes with each rooms was a nice addition, it was great being able to relax in the hammock after a stressful day and reply to e-mails while listening to the street-life of Barcelona through the window. I give this hotel a 5 out of 5. I would give it 6 out of 5, but I'm afraid that's not possible.

Reviews.Title: “A great place.”
Reviews.Author: Natmandu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Casa Camper partly on the strength of the reviews on this site, and have to agree with everyone that said what a great place it is. This was my first time in Barcelona, and Casa Camper made it all the better. Close to La Rambla, and sat in the heart of the funky, arty, resurgent El Raval, the location is superb. The Mercado de la Boqueria is nearby, as well as several really good value cafes and restaurants. The Metro at Plaza de Catalunya is ten minutes walk, giving access to everything in Barcelona. Casa Camper itself is a breath of fresh air for someone who has stayed in hotels from budget dives to swisher places, and never been entirely satisfied by any of them while enjoying elements of all of them. It's modern, with minimalist, utilitarian features and shaker styling, and yet feels very comfortable indeed - imagine an almost 'hostel'-like atmosphere, but with the feeling of comfort of a more expensive hotel. The standard rooms give a separate bedroom and mini lounge, with the bedroom thoughtfully placed away from the street - these rooms come complete with flat screen TV, plenty of room, and a hammock in the lounge for a siesta. The shower was the best I have ever used. The emphasis on sustainability is in evidence everywhere - the water from the showers is all recycled and used again to flush the toilets, all of the glass, plastic and card is recycled, and most of the hotel seems to be made from recycled materials - very much in keeping with the Camper philosophy. This isn't however all crochet and joss sticks - this is a slick, modern design hotel. The food in the 24 hour canteen is free, the breakfast is free, everything is well thought out, and the staff are brilliant. I could have stayed just another night, and another... Easily my favourite hotel anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arie-Mordejai
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Casa Camper. What a great experience!. This time I could not book a suite and stayed and one of the rooms, and enjoyed having a separate private lounge to chill out and rest. It felt like home. Much more relaxing that having to sit on your bed on a normal hotel room. What is not to like. The rooms are big, modern and comfortable. The bathroom shower is a pleasure. The breakfast is a delight and the 24 hour free food bar is better than room service at most hotels. If there is one problem with the Hotel is that is not easily accesible directly by car. This is really an incovenience only if you are coming to Barcelona for business but even then, my local business partners don't seem to mind.

Reviews.Title: “cool hotel but beware of security!!!”
Reviews.Author: coreyman97
Reviews.Content: my family stayed here for 6 nites over christmas/new years. i booked it due to the reviews and it is a very cool place as most people have stated. so why the mediocre review? as my family and i were checking in we were told to leave all of our luggage at the front desk and to take a quick tour of the main floor. we were assured it was safe. the tour took all of a few minutes and when i returned, my knapsack was not there with all of my electronics and personal items. the check in manager said it was impossible and it never happened there. she also went on to question if i even had the bag since she had not seen it - though i had just given her my passports from the bag. i was told they would check the surveillance video and let me know if thay found anything. well of course the video showed someone lurking and stealing my bag when the front desk people turned their backs. i was told to go to the police station and make a report and they would see what they could do to compensate me with insurance. there is a fair amount of this petty thievery in barcelona so i was advised to come back real early the next day when i could take care of it in 1 hour rather that 3 or 4 as there were many similar cases. after making the report i was advised by casa camper that they were not insured unless i was mugged or physically had the bag ripped away from me. even though i was told by the hotel staff to leave everything and it would be safe, they couldn't do anything. they did say that i would receive a 15% discount on my stay - 2 rooms for 6 nites. while i appreciate the gesture it amounted to about 25% of what i had lost. i have emailed the owner of camper on 3 occasions to see if an organization as professional as theirs would "do the right thing" but i have not rec'd a reply. so just beware - the hotel is cool and our stay was enjoyable. but keep your bags and items close to you and when you are told to leave your belongings and they will be safe - DON'T DO IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.....”
Reviews.Author: applemouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite for 3 nights covering the New Year Period. The room was large and had a combined living room/bedroom, the room was extremely quiet and the bed was exceptionally comfy. There are so many good ideas in this hotel in regards to design, comfort and practicality. The 24 hour cafe was an excellent idea as you could help yourself to teas/coffee, soft drinks and food whenver you wanted. Definitely of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. This is what hotels should be like. The staff were very helpful and friendly and all speak excellent english.

Reviews.Title: “Pedestrian Chic”
Reviews.Author: Kradjian
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife over New Years and concur with most of the reviews. The staff was excellent, especially Guillermo. The food lounge saved us an exceptional amount of money, allowing us to splurge on dinners. Location was central although if you have a lot of luggage take a cab as it sits on a tiny side street and typically very crowded. Very tight quarters but that is Europe. Don't expect elegance here, this is stricty an art nevaux atmosphere complete with somewhat tricky fixtures. Don't forget your electric converters! The shower was great and allowed us to replenish our resources after all the wonderful walking. The "lounge" room is seperated by a common hallway, however, served its purpose well when one spouse wanted to sleep and the other didn't. The sleeping arrangements kept it from getting a perfect score - the bed was small, a little uncomfortable and low to the ground. And the hallway is extremely noisy so if you are a picky sleeper may want to keep in mind. However, as an overall value this hotel is extremely hard to beat and we would consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic--One Of The World's Great Boutique Hotels”
Reviews.Author: USAconcierge
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that has its act together. I chose this hotel because I'm the concierge at the No. #4 rated hotel in the United States on Tripadvisor, the Holiday Inn Historic District in Charleston, South Carolina, and whenever I travel I always like to stay at hotels that are highly rated on Tripadvisor so that I can learn tips and techniques to help me do even better at my own job. In my job as a concierge, I try to dazzle my guests every day with great customer service, but as result it's very hard to impress me when I stay at other hotels. Well, I'm here to say right now that I was completely DAZZLED by the level of customer service at Casa Camper. If you want to learn all the qualities that make up a great hotel, you need to stay at Casa Camper. Before my arrival, I asked the staff to recommend a tour guide to take us around Barcelona. They recommended someone and I tried several times to contact her by e-mail to no avail. So I e-mailed Casa Camper--could you try to track her down for me? Within two hours, I had an e-mail from the tour guide I was trying to reach, who said that Casa Camper had contacted her about my efforts to reach her and profuse apologies about her slowness in getting back to me. Now THAT"S customer service! When Casa Camper heard I was having trouble reaching this tour guide, they made my problem THEIR problem! We were taking trains all over Spain, but one of the tickets we were told could only be bought locally, not over the phone. So I e-mailed Casa Camper--could they get them for me? Within two hours, I received an e-mail from Casa Camper saying that they had already bought the tickets for me and would be waiting for me when I arrived! Wow---these people were really starting to dazzle me! When we finally arrived in early November, I immedietely fell in love with the decor of the hotel. There was a stunning mural of Barcelona on the wall and the whole place exuded an air of class and cool. When we checked in, something happened which I've never seen at a hotel before. One staff member took our passports and credit card while another one took us around and gave us an introductory walk around the hotel to explain the concept of the hotel and how it worked. This lasted at least 10 minutes and I later observed them doing this walk with other guests. They said they tried to do this with ALL the guests--it really made you feel special. I LOVED this idea. I LOVED the breakfasts---they made me a great ham and eggs or omelette every morning just the way I liked it and couldn't have been nicer about it. The rooms were ultra-chic and cool. The showers were the best I've ever encountered---fantastic water pressure that would come down like a waterfall. Everything was very, very clean. The beds were great, with huge pillows to rest your head against. When you got your wake-up call, they did something I've never seen at a hotel---they would ask you if you wanted them to call you back in 15 minutes just in case you went back to sleep!!! How innovative. When have you ever had a hotel ask you THAT before? The other innovative thing is this concept of the the 24-hour cafe in hotel where you could get snack or a drink at any hour of the day without having to pay anything. I loved this idea, too--although I will say it tended to be really healthy snacks. I suggested that they consider putting out some chocolate-chip cookies, oatmeal cookies, perhaps even some carrot cake for the junk-food junkies staying in the hotel. If they did that, then they 24-hour cafe concept would have been REALLY amazing! The best thing about this hotel, though, like all great hotels, is the staff. You can have the greatest rooms in the world, but without great staff, the hotel has no soul. The staff here speaks English fluently (a big plus in Barcelona, where a surprisingly large portion of the people have little grasp of English) and is in general, top-notch. I got a chance to speak with the General Manager, Nathalie Porta. She came up to me and and asked how my stay was going. Like most of the staff at Casa Camper, she was absolutely stunning to look at. I asked her, "What is your secret? How do get such great staff?" She said, "We teach the staff one thing--never assume anything." Great advice. I sat down with her and told her my impressions and what she could do to make it an even better hotel. To my amazement, she took notes! This is the mark of someone who was born for the hotel business. She didn't think she knew it all--she wanted to know what she could do to be even better! Other stand-outs among the staff---Gemma was a super-star. She also was an example of someone who was born for the hotel business. She gave the feeling she really cared about my stay and bent over backwards for us! Maude was a total sweetheart. She did the introductory walks of the hotel and was, in general, fabulous. Cristina did the e-mails beforehand and was just as nice in person as she was by e-mail. Marilo at the front desk was also super-nice. I have only one criticism--the tour guide that they recommended for us to take us on private tours around Barcelona was good, but not great. I suggested to Nathalie that they set up a program with the staff where once a month they pay each one of the staff to go out and take some interesting new walking tour or visit some new exhibit at one of Barcelona's many museums so that they can always have current and up-to-date suggestions of things to do for the guests. If they did this, they might have found a better tour guide to recommend to me. But if you don't pay the staff to do this, they get busy and never get around to it. As a concierge, I know I am as only as good as my suggestions. The bottom line--an innovative, ultra-chic hotel, in a great location, with super-friendly staff willing to bend over backwards for you ((and great breakfasts too!) I loved it and would never consider staying at any other hotel if I ever return to Barcelona. I liked it that much! Kevin McQuade Chief Concierge Holiday Inn Historic District Charleston, South Carolina USA

Reviews.Title: “Can not fault”
Reviews.Author: Miss_L79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Casa Camper over the New Years Eve break and definitely rate this hotel as one of the best I have stayed in (which is saying something as I tend to stay on avg in three hotels a month for work). Not only is the decor and the layout of the hotel and its amendities superb, but more importantly the staff were friendly and extremely helpful. They did their best to ensure our visit to Barcelona was wonderful from suggesting restaurants to providing information on tourist attractions. The location of the hotel itself is very central and only a short distance from the airport. I can't wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's all good.”
Reviews.Author: gcookedublin
Reviews.Content: The most quirky and genuinely welcoming hotel I've stayed in. The staff are helpful and will investigate any question you have (we were inquiring about nightclubs and restraunts a lot). The 24 hour food is an original and convenient idea. Loved the showers and the lounge too. The hotel is right beside Las Ramblas so within walking distance of everything. Highly recommended. PS- WATCH YOUR WALLET. Pickpockets are everywhere in Barcelona. Keep your wallet in an inside pocket if possible. Be careful in the back streets around Las Ramblas and on the escalators in the Metro. The bastards tried to steal my wallet twice in three days!

Reviews.Title: “Very very cool”
Reviews.Author: AC-Elite
Reviews.Content: While Casa Camper isn't cheap, it is certainly an exceptional and unique hotel experience. Much has been said about the very cool styling of the rooms and some of the innovative concepts (all day complimentary snacks and drinks), but what really makes this place stand out is the exceptional service and friendliness of the staff. GREAT THINGS: -Very cool, stylishly designed rooms -Separate lounge/sitting area across the hall is a fantastic concept, especially for those getting over jet lag and wanting to do something at 3am without waking your travel companion! -Tasty breakfast, tortillas to your liking made on demand -Free internet terminal w/ printer -Very cool location, a perfect base for Barcelona -Top-shelf staff, great language skills GOOD THINGS: -Good quality bed linen & towels -Hammocks in TV room, excellent TV screens -Bedroom & bathroom facing a serene (and quiet!) wall of plants -Honest-to-goodness environmental awareness, recycling of shower water DISAPPOINTING THINGS: -Lack of door on bathroom - you had better be very comfortable with your travel companion! -Quite expensive for Barcelona/Spain Overall, a fantastic experience, and one that shouldn't be missed.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Casa”
Reviews.Author: ricop
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. The rooms were great and the shower was the best I've had in any hotel anywhere. Location is a block and a half from the Ramblas with great restaurants and shopping very close. The hotel staff was very helpful. I've been in a few "hip" hotels where the young staff members viewed us 60+ year olds as interlopers on their turf and gave us short shrift. Not here--the staff was fabulous and mostly refused to accept tips. And the free food and non-alcoholic beverages 20 hours a day was wonderful. Just so nice to have that cold water, juice or soda there for the taking or a sandwich, salad, or cookie to tide us over till the late Barcelona dinners. What a treat.

Reviews.Title: “most helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Daniel&Virpi
Reviews.Content: Just spent a no-kids weekend getaway at the Casa Camper. We liked everything about it, the twin room concept was not bad at all and the interiors very nice. The location is great, not too noisy, and everything within walking distance. Breakfast was good and the free snacks a great idea. What really makes this place stand out is the staff, always helpful and friendly, and in a natural manner. One staffer got us tickets for a great football game on short notice, much appreciated. A stylish and relaxed hotel. (Also check out the Central bookstore in the same street if you are serious about books, and do go to a football game if Barca is playing).

Reviews.Title: “Twin room concept just doesn't work”
Reviews.Author: aristoph
Reviews.Content: Ok, first the great things about Casa Camper. It is very well located, just off la Rambla but in a relatively quiet side street. The staff are all young, very friendly and speak great English. While I was sceptical about the self-service food and drink concept at first it actually works very well in a hotel of this size (just 25 rooms) and there is a wide choice of snacks and drinks available. The main bedroom in your set of two rooms is large and well designed, with a beautiful walk-in shower (however using it does fill your whole bedroom with steam and humidity as there is no separating door). The fittings are all new and of high quality. All this is very very good. So why just a three-star rating then? The problem is that the split living-room/bedroom design with a corridor separating the two spaces just doesn't work. While we never actually used our living space that's not really a big issue as the bedroom is more than big enough to live in comfortably for two nights. No, our complaint was the noise every time our neighbours crossed the corridor between their two rooms. The doors are spring-loaded and slam loudly, made much louder by the hard floors in the corridor and rooms. Worse, there is a system to open the door across the corridor from your bedroom without using a key but this makes a very loud buzzing noise each time. None of this is too bad unless your neighbours are a family with children who are crossing the corridor every two or three minutes from 7am! Or the previous night a drunken couple who keep carrying things between the two rooms at 2am! Clearly the hotel can't be held responsible for the inconsiderate behaviour of its guests but the design is flawed and you risk a very bad night of sleep or a row with your neighbours. It's a shame as everything else is so right but I really can't recommend the Casa Camper.

Reviews.Title: “A joy for an architect.”
Reviews.Author: JohnHixArchitect
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a week’s stay in Casa Camper Hotel, Barcelona. We are owners of Hix Island House in Vieques, Puerto Rico which has a #1 Trip Advisor designation for hotels in Puerto Rico. We chose Camper because it was #1 on Trip Advisor in Barcelona. Camper’s unique plan of a separate living area across the corridor from the sleeping area ( the quiet side) is excellent and fun. The cheerful desk service cannot be topped. Reservations, travel, whatever-they do it for you. My wife discovered that she had over- paid 20 euros for a shirt, Guillermo, one of the Camper Team at the desk, went on her behalf and retrieved the money from the local merchant. Now that is service. The made to order breakfast and our ability to snack on salads, sandwiches etc. ( included in the rate) is contemporary and convenient in a city. But as an architect, it was refreshing for me to be living in a well thought out design ---and that lovely rain shower topped off a perfect day.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: jzking
Reviews.Content: I can't praise the Casa Camper Hotel enough. My Fiance and I were on a 1 month trip from Madrid to Holland and we stayed in Casa Camper along the way. Of the 7 places we stayed, this was my favorite and Barcelona was my favorite city! The hotel is located right off of the head of Las Ramblas. Everything is close by yet since it does not face Las Ramblas directly, it was quiet and peaceful. The coast is only a 15 minute walk down the Ramblas and only 5 minutes on bike (which are available at the hotel). The rooms were especially unique. Each room is split by the main hallway common to all the rooms. I won't spoil all the surprises but I will say that the mastermind behind Camper has introduced a refreshing twist on the traditional hotel suite. The rooms inside are very clean and comfortable. There is no carpet and lots of tile which is easily cleaned. The shower and bathroom overlook a beautiful private terrace filled with shelves and shelves of one variety of a local plant. The overall feel of the room and adjacent lounge is very modern and hip (but not overly so). The staff were the most friendly in Europe who did everything we asked from Checking train schedules to giving us maps and directions. There is an open/complimentary bar and cafe in the lobby for snacks, water, and softdrinks, midnight cravings, etc. Breakfast is included in the room rate and consists of the typical fare plus a cook who can make omelets and the like. If you are going to Barcelona and you can afford this hotel, I implore you to stay here. You will not regret it, despite what some other naysayers have claimed in these reviews. Some people are never satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this fun, colorful place. And the people are awesome.”
Reviews.Author: Brianstriptips
Reviews.Content: Well ... this new Casa Camper hotel has a lot going for it! Great location. Clean, colorful design. And a smart, functional concept. The bathrooms are awesome ... with a huge window that allows you a bright look into their simple courtyard with a rolling outdoor shutter that will close out the light for an afternoon nap. zzzzzzz Another unique aspect is a small sitting room across the hall .. allowing you to use it as an office, place to read or as a brief getaway from the bedroom and your significant other. Enjoy the romantic street below and rooftops of Barcelona on the upper floors. The simple, but elegant breakfasts and snacks available most all the day and night were a welcome refreshment. During the day the kids can be a bit noisy from a school across the street ... but let's face it ... it was the joyous sound of "fun." But ... the very best thing about Casa Camper was the staff ... the standouts were from Spain, Brasil and France ... Christina Noguiera, Ferdinanda, Laurent, and Joel ... and a wonderful lady with the coolest white glasses ... these folks bent over backwards to make sure you were happy, knew where you were going and never stopped smiling. What a welcome relief from the stodgy, bored front desk people of the world ... Casa Camper staff rocks ...! Bravo.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect marriage at Casa Camper”
Reviews.Author: Haraldo
Reviews.Content: We chose to celebrate our marriage in Barcelona because we wanted something special for us and our family. Barcelona lived up to our expectations - but it would not have been extraordinary had it not been for the excellent Casa Camper Team. Never have I experienced such a service minded and helpful team - for every little detail. Everything we didn't think of before the last minute - they had already fixed it... The roof top terrace was perfect for an all-night-dinner (by special reservation only) - the team set up a bar for us, played music and made everything just perfect. I can totally recommend Casa Camper for those seeking an extra-ordinary experience. They don't have an open restaurant, but cook upon orders. It seems like this make them more motived for the meels they make - our compliments to the chef !! (Their set menu was good value). Pricing is a bit on the high side, but if you appreciate such an extraordinary stay it is still very good value! Thanks a lot to Natalie and her team! We will come back next may to celebrate our anniversary! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Broncos347
Reviews.Content: What can I say. My wife and I loved every minute of our stay at Casa Camper. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is central being only 5 minutes from Placa de Catalunya where the Aerobus stops and only a couple of minutes from La Rambla. We stayed in a suite and even though it was €20 more a night it was well worth it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “huge telephone bill”
Reviews.Author: EstherD
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days at the casa camper. the service was nice and very helpful. However there were two flaws. One of them is that at the day we checked in at the hotel, we asked how much it will cost to make international calls. The girl at the entrance told us about $1 for every 5 minutes which sounds very reasonable, and not a rip -off price as many hotels are taking. However when we received the bill at the end of our stay, we had to pay $23 for 13 minutes of call time. There were a few calls that no one even answered (e.g. a 3 second call for $0.40 and no answering machine answered). The other issue is that our friends stayed in Barcelona and they came to visit us, and the hotel personnel let them in, while at the end the bill showed $14.10 for this visit. Nobody told us that there is a fee involved for letting our friends in. We should have known this fact before letting people in. Besides these flaws the stay was ok, but the hotel is very simple and the price (235 euro) is definitely not worth the stay. We stayed one night at the marina hotel which cost a little more (280 euros) but was definitely a 5 star hotel. If the free food is important for you, think about all the delicious food that you can taste at the streets of Barcelona. This hotel is nice, but the price is too high for what you get, and for me it is very important to get the real facts before you pay (telephone and friends visit).

Reviews.Title: “A refreshing concept”
Reviews.Author: J&ALondon
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper exceeded our expectations, even though we'd read all the good reviews of it on this site. It embodies an entire concept within one hotel. The stylish interior design and sustainability ethic can be seen from its website and is every bit as good as it looks there, attention to detail especially. What you can't see in advance is the atmosphere and exceptional attitude of the staff who take trouble to make you feel genuinely welcome (not the I've-been-trained to-say-this-fake-smile-have-a-nice-day you find pretty much everywhere else). The free all day snack idea and ability to take your breakfast up on to the roof terrace added even more to the sense that you are allowed to relax and feel at home. This works even if, as we did, you stay for just a weekend. The place fits you, not the reverse. If we go back to Barcelona, and we hope we will, we would not consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “What fun!”
Reviews.Author: aldonna
Reviews.Content: Everything about Casa Camper is fun and witty. The suspended wooden bicycles to borrow, the rubber camper slippers to relax in and the all day snacks help to make this a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A magical experience”
Reviews.Author: Bowen_Family
Reviews.Content: We very recently had a weekend break at Casa Camper with some good friends to celebrate a birthday. It was the best hotel experience any of us have ever had. I had asked for a bottle of Cava to be waiting in our friends room and not only had they remembered to do this (chilling in an ice bucket, ofcourse) but they had also made a small birthday cake with candle and left a lovely note for her. The hotel is ultra modern and very stylish - but somehow manages to have a real warmth about it. The 24/7 food was fantastic (the cooked breakfast was superb) and because all the food is included in the price, it really made it very good value. It is exceptionally child friendly yet child-free couples would love it also. I can't imagine staying anywhere else if we visit Barcelona again. At one point, sitting on their roof terrace with a view of the rooftops of the city, sipping chilled wine and tasting their delicious snacks we tried to invent a new holiday game - "If you could improve one thing about this hotel... what would it be?" and we were all lost for ideas. It is as if the owners have brain stormed everything people look for in a hotel and then gone on to make it happen. The only suggestion I can think of is... we need one in every city!

Reviews.Title: “Happy Campers”
Reviews.Author: funnymom
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5, including a teenager, an eleven year-old and a six-year old, stayed here in early August. We LOVED this hotel, and our children rated their stay in this hotel the high-point of our entire two-week trip to Northern Spain. Our boys shared a room with twin beds, my husband and I had a room with a queen-sized bed, and the lounge across the hall allowed our six-year old to have a "room of her own". The snacks downstairs were delicious and much appreciated. The modern decor was edgy, without being jarring, and was in keeping with the high-style elsewhere in the City. But, best of all were the warm and helpful staff. Due to the trouble in Heathrow, our return flight was cancelled. The staff, on no notice, found rooms for us, so that we had a place to stay until we could be re-booked back to the States. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little luxury”
Reviews.Author: francesl
Reviews.Content: Having read the review on this site, and looking for somewhere special to take my parents for a treat, this looked perfect. The staff were fantastic (apart from the one girl who didn't order the taxi we needed to the airport!), the rooms were fabulous, and the whole experience worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Super-hip oasis...”
Reviews.Author: restlesstraveler
Reviews.Content: If you go, spring for the suite -- pricy, but worth every bit of the money. The hip design and attention to detail are fabulous -- from the hammock in the living room to the sliding doors separating the spaces. The hotel has every amenity you'd want for an urban vacation (great shower, free broadband internet access via a terminal, flat panel TV, etc) plus some that are unique and cool (eco-friendly water re-use in the bathrooms, free sodas, juices and snacks -- including bottled cokes, etc). There's no gym or pool, but you'll get your exercise from walking around the city. Be sure to grab a bottle of wine and hang out for a bit on the penthouse floor ... great view and great spot to soak in all the buzz from below in the city. There are cool outdoor cafes as well nearby (on the same or adjacent side streets, slightly away from the madness of La Rambla) for afternoon or late night dining.

Reviews.Title: “Right location & great hotel”
Reviews.Author: steveclemo
Reviews.Content: From the tripadvisor reviews we chose this hotel for part of our honeymoon and it did not disappoint. The hotel was just off La Ramblas and in a little side street so it was very quitet. The free food was great and there was plenty of it. Special mention has to go to the staff, from the personal introduction to the hotel, to assistance with choosing restaurants, to taxis, to letting us leave our bags at the hotel a couple of days checking out. I would recommend paying for a suite if your budget allows, as the room is all connected, rather than split by a corridor. Finally, we loved the Camper slippers and searching for some on the internet to buy as a pratical memory of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Nick3000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa for 5 nights at the end of July/beginning of August and we were just blown away by this hotel. From the attentive, keen, helpful staff, to the cleanliness and decor of the rooms, the whole experience was exemplary. On arrival a staff member gave us an introductory tour of the ground floor where the 24hr buffet can be found, and our room (a suite, which is recommeded if you don't want the split lounge/bedroom arrangement). The rooms are excellent, with contemporary design and air con, vital in the height of summer! The days were spent touring the city, then grabbing a few soft drinks from the buffet or beers from reception and relaxing on the 6th floor terrace, complete with piped jazz, very chilled out! The staff couldn't do enough, even going so far as to post our postcards for free as we checked out. We weren't asked for a customer evaluation at the end of our stay so I hope the staff read this site on the free 24 hr internet access in the foyer, as this is hotel beats every city hotel we've stayed at, 5 stars and all. So believe the hype and book!!

Reviews.Title: “No room for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: paulcellist
Reviews.Content: The way this hotel epitimises everything thats cool and chic about Barcelona, and the way the staff runs it in every single aspect we noticed, leads me to think that there cannot be a negative review in this hotel's future. All the details are already stated here for you to read on. I would just say that it was very clear to us that there is nothing superficial about this place. They genuinely and sincerely want you to feel at home. Stylishness notwithstanding, it may be cool but the people are warmly hospitable, professional and knowledgeable. Give them a job, or share your travel arrangement snafu with the front desk and you will have all the help you could ever hope for. And what with everything else....(don't miss the omelettes!) It all helps to make this simply your first choice. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Another satisfied customer”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Flm
Reviews.Content: Just to reinforce the positive reviews below - we were delayed by the Barcelona airport strike and the staff were extremely supportive. This is an oasis of calm and cool (in both senses) in the city and provided a great base for our short visit. It's a great concept and maybe Camper will open more?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: orangegirly
Reviews.Content: lovely lovely chilled out hotel in the middle of a bustling city, fantastic service, hospitality, rooms and communal areas cannot say one bad word about this place - my review is short and sweet A++++++

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service, Unique & Lovely Rooms”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravUK
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of all the outstanding reviews on this site... and I was not disappointed. I love TripAdvisor and I love Casa Camper. I arrived early in the morning and discovered that Expedia screwed up my reservation (don't ever use Expedia for hotels - just flights) and the middle night we were staying was not available. However, the hotel insisted on finding us alternative accomodation for that one night and invited us back for their wonderful breakfast the next morning. They checked me in early with no problems. Breakfasts are wonderful. Simply wonderful. All-day food idea is fabulous, tasty, and sensible. I really liked the rooms, but it is a designer hotel, so it may be a touch modern for everyone's taste. The first everning (on my own), I made a lot of use of the second (living) room, but once my wife arrived and we became tourists, we didn't really use it. This is now my hotel for Barcelona. I simply would not stay anywhere else. Business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel- go for a suite”
Reviews.Author: kjvColorado
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 great nights here last month and loved the place. great service, wonderful location (a funky but ultra safe neighborhood, so if your tastes run 5th avenue stay elsewhere) and loved the free snacks and drinks all day (they should consider padding the seats fo the metal benches in the central lounge and breakfast area). one piece of advice- the suites have the lounge and bedroom connected (as opposed to being across the hall in the regular rooms) and we thought that made the lounge much more useable and made the room much more spacious. by the way- the person who said the rooms were "Ikea" is wrong. First, some of the accessories come from VIncon, a very cool store in Madrid and Barcelona (worth stopping in on your Gaudi walk), and second, they don't sell beds and linens this comfortable, or showerheads and sinks this luxurious, or flat screen tv's this nice (i could go on but you get my point) at Ikea.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend strongly - Feedback here is really objective”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my extended family, including a 6 year old, for three nights the last on July 1st. We had chosen the Casa Camper based on the feedback on tripadvisor and we will surely use trip advisor more often. Casa Camper is an extremely comfortable hotel with friendly and impeccable service. The ambience (especially the rooms, the snack bar and the extremely helpful (but not intrusive at all) staff make it feel just like home. The location is also nearly ideal - close enough to the bustle of La Ramblas, Placa Catalunya and the metro, yet just tucked away in a quaint and quiet block.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Camper - fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from our holiday in Barcelona where we stayed at Casa Camper. We picked the hotel largely based on other reviews read on Trip Advisor and, I have to say, all positive reviews are 100% correct. It is a lovely, lovely hotel and the staff are fantastic. We've stayed at similar 'pitched' hotels (The Clift in San Francisco, The Hudson in New York, Beau Rivage in Nice) and we both thought Casa Camper was the best of the lot! Where to start? The staff are so welcoming and friendly - nothing is too much trouble and they make you feel at home straight away. The rooms - we paid a little extra and stayed in a suite and it was worth every penny. With standard rooms I don't know about crossing the corridor to the lounge - I think we'd remain cocooned just in the bedroom and the suite has the luxury of both areas 'as one' - but, who knows?! The showers were fab, the beds were the most comfortable I've slept in and the rooms pleasantly quiet. The hammock was great to chill in after a strenous day at the shops or on the beach! The 24 hour snacks are a great idea and really healthy - perfect for a quick snack to stave off hunger pangs before the late night Spanish dining! Breakfasts, too, were delicious and the chef is happy to prepare any egg based dish for you. If not, there are croissants, fresh fruit, ensimadas, yogurts, bread, coffee, juices etc etc. The district is great too - very arty and cool. There are nice restaurants nearby (turn left out of the hotel and first left again) but don't expect to tuck into anything until post 9pm. For cocktails head to Rita Blue on Placa St Augusti (sp?) - 5 minutes walk away. So, all in all a brilliant hotel and one we'll definitely be returning too - hopefully time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “Ranked No. 1 for very good reason!”
Reviews.Author: portal
Reviews.Content: We stayed for seven nights in June and enjoyed every single minute in this fabulous Hotel. From the minute we arrived we were made to feel like we were the only guests in the Hotel. Checking in was unbelievably easy. Our passports were dealt with and our baggage collected whilst we were given a personal tour of the Hotel and its amenities. Everything was fully explained and demonstrated. We booked the suite on the third floor and it was incredible. Fantastic bathroom, super comfy large bed, safe, digital radio, and a lounge area with flatscreen tv, sofa, lamps, balcony and hammock. The free food and drink was fresh and the menu changed regularly. We took a tray of food and drink up to the lovely sun terrace each afternoon to relax after sightseeing before a relaxed night out. The Hotel is being cleaned almost 24 hrs a day and as you can imagine was absolutely spotless at all times. Our room was serviced each morning and prepared again each evening. The staff could not help us enough and I mean from the front of house to domestics. They all wore the same trendy black uniform and all went out of their way to keep us happy. The breakfasts offered eggs cooked to any order, meats, cheeses, bacon, sausages, fresh fruits, juices, coffee, tea, cereals. Every taste was catered for. The french guy that served us each morning was one of the nicest, friendly helpful staff I have ever encoutered at a hotel breakfast session! He remembered where we would sit, what we would drink and cleared the table clutter as soon as we had taken the last bite. There was so much good about this Hotel that it deserves to stay ranked at No1 for a very long time. I can honestly say that there is not one single thing about our seven night stay that I could criticise them for. They were all fabulous. I guess the key is that they have discovered how to offer 5 star service without all the over bearing stuffyness. The Hotel feels informal yet cool and chic. The cost is by no means cheap but after knocking off the money that one saves from beautiful breakfasts and free food and drink this makes it a rather good rate for what you get in return in my opinion. Take our advice and stop in a suite in this hotel. Do not stop anywhere else. Take the aerobus 3.50euros from the airport to Rambla and you are then just an easy five minute walk from the best hotel in Barcelona. Actually this is the best Hotel we have ever stayed in and we have stayed in a few. From Sydney to New York to London you will not get better service than you will get at Casa Camper Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: leslieness
Reviews.Content: How often do you go to a hotel and return home with ideas for how to make your own home as cozy as the hotel? Answer for me, never before, but Casa Camper did so many things right, I've already made some changes. They literally rethought everything about the hotel experience. Hate it when you lean up against a head board that a billion heads have leaned against before you? They designed their own bed that had cushions covered with fresh linens behind your pillows. Live in an apartment and keep dreaming that one day you'll have a yard with room for a hammock? They didn't wait. They installed a hammock in each and every day room. Always looking for a place to hang things in a hotel room or at home? Camper has a shaker style peg rack across an entire wall. Wish you had a chocolate on your pillow but trying to drop 10 extra pounds? Camper the Walking Society eases the sense of deprivation by putting a button on your pillow that says "walking is for lovers" that reminds you that chocolate isn't everything. But these are just some of the wonderful design ideas they've implimented, what really made the experience so special was the spirit of the staff who was always friendly and ever helpful in a way that felt authentic. Because of Casa Camper, our home away from home, my fiance and I had the impression that we weren't visiting Barcelona for a week, but truly living there. If you want to experience the essence of genuine hospitality in the heart of Barcelona, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: desertguy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on other comments on this site. I was totally happy with the room, location, service and price. No need to find another Barcelona Hotel - This is it!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Casa Camper”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 of the happiest nights of our life at the Casa Camper Hotel. We loved the location, the amazing staff who gave us great tips and booked us into restaurants each night, the cool rooms, the super comfortable bed and the free mini bar and delicious breakfasts. It was such a pleasant experience that I would recommend it 100% to anyone who is after a modern, funky and friendly hotel in a great location. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: greatscot
Reviews.Content: Just back from a stay at the Casa Camper. We booked on the strength of the other reviews and they are not exagerating how great this hotel is. There is a security entrance and on entering the hotel are greeted by the friendliest of staff who instantly make you feel welcome. The rooms are ultra modern and superbly clean. The little lounge across the corrider is compact and has its own tv and settee. There is a lovely terrace on the 6th floor, which has lovely views. The hotel is less than a 5 minute walk from las ramblas, in a great position just far enough away from the noice and bussle of this very busy tourist area.
